i have always had an issue with math, as in i don't know how to start problems. this has been something i always needed to work on, and i feel like this class with not only help me get organized and understand topics and find out why the way to solving these are different, it will also help me to understand where it starts and it would be a nice midweek review of concepts we have learned. especially since the lecture is fastpaced and i would need a midweek review with all the material so i can understand the next day of lectures. i have taken calc 2 last semester with the sci course, and i feel like that really benefitted me. i also feel like, i would benefit from working in a group and having people next to me would really help me understand the concept because they will have a different way of explaining and doing the problem.

i am here because i have changed what i wanted to study at school about 4 times without being certain whether i would like it or not. i am here because i have finally made up my mind. i believe that this physics course drastically contributes to my knowledge of physics, which i will apply in my engineering career. i am here to absorb new material, make mistakes, and learn from those mistakes. i am here to make new connections with people i work with, which contributes to my personal and career growth.
i am here taking this si class because i'm afraid of not passing my physics class.

i signed up for this sci class to get additional help in chemistry. after taking chem 115 i learned a lot of information but i realized that chem 215 was going to be a little more challenging. before chem 115 the last time i took chemistry was my sophomore year in highschool, and as a sophomore in college currently, most of the material that i had went over in highschool i had forgotten. but because i took chem last semester most of the material is still fresh. i also like how it is once a week so i was able to fit the class in my schedule. additionally, this is my second year taking a sci class. my first year of taking sci, i really enjoyed it. in addition, this will be very beneficial to me because i would gain better study habits, get better review sheets, and more practice worksheets. those worksheets would help me prepare me for future exams and have a better understanding of what we go through in class. when i was preparing for the first exam i was able to ask my sci instructors for help and the material that was given to us really helped me understand the general concept. lastly, taking a one unit course would boost my gpa so that was another benefit as to why i decided to take this course.

hello, my name is nanxi huang and i am a college first year. i am here in sci 240 class because last semester i learned about what sci classes were and i took one for biology 230. i felt that the biology 230 sci class, that i took last semester, was extremely helpful in helping me pass the biology 230 lecture and lab class. the biology sci 230 class was the first sci class i ever took. it allowed me to practice the science concepts and topics that were covered in lecture class, prepare and review for biology exams, as well as giving me another resource when i am confused about something and need help. i also like how sci class allows you to meet other students that you can turn to for help and form study groups with. for me, the biology sci 230 class was very effective because it actually helped me understand and think more in depth about the content i learned. lastly, sci classes are graded based on class attendance and participation, so if you attend every class and do the activities, then you will get an a and earn one unit, which is a good deal. for this spring semester, i knew that i wanted to take another sci class, so my previous sci instructors recommended sci 240 to me.

i took sci bio 230 like 2 semesters ago and it was literally great. i passed bio 230 with a good grade and i want to do it again for bio 240. so, pretty much the reason i am taking sci bio 240 is because it actually improves my learning and helps me understand the concepts of lecture and lab. my instructors have great teaching methods like kahoot, warm ups, worksheets, etc. that help me remember and practice the material. plus, it gives me an extra day to i guess study the material and ask questions if i have any. im not a great person that actually studies so, this class is literally perfect because we go over a lot without doing it all by myself or procrastinating. another reason i am taking sci bio 240 is because it makes me feel good and comfortable. literally all the students that are enrolled are in the same boat as me. we help and teach each other the material and thats what i like about it.

im here because i want to improve my studies in chemistry. im not good at chemistry, so i need lots of help and time just to learn something new. im hoping that being in this class will help me learn more concepts of studying and learning. being a visual learner, i cant just listen to people talk and learn from that. someone has to write it down or draw it for me to imagine what some type of problem looks like. when the professor asked us to shout the answer in class, i didnt know the answer nor what to say, so i usually stay silent. i hope this sci class helps me to know more about what im learning and helps me study more efficiently with all the practice problems they give me. so far, theyre helping, but my time management is a problem. im also taking this sci class to help with my time management on studying. going to a class which helps me study and manage my time. i know that im being productive in class and im not distracted on my phone and i can ask other classmates for help. knowing that this is a class that supports my organic chemistry class, i feel like i can ask for any confusions without being shy.

online classes have impacted my learning quite a lot. although i like the idea of learning online, i find it very helpful to learn at my own pace whether slower or faster at times. however the hardest thing has been physically being away from campus. i no longer have an apartment or a schedule really and it has been difficult. i have also been fasting for the month of ramadan the last month so that has been keeping me occupied. i am worried about getting bored. there aren't very many competitive things for me to do except video games which i am bored of now. i like doing physically competitive stuff with friends and people. i will have to find a way to challenge myself.

im here to get a better grasp on this subject as well as to get help on topics i need more help on. this is also a way for me to meet people in this course that i could gain some help with as well as help them (to the best of my ability). also to possibly see if there others in my other courses that maybe we could help each other in those courses as well.

john ellis jr2182020i am here in this sci class for a few different reasons. one reason why i am here, is to be able to better understand the material learned in the parent class with the help of my peers and the instructors of my sci class. having this extra help will allow me to be able to achieve a better grade for the parent class. with this help i will be able to create a good base understanding of the material and build upon it with new future topics in following semesters. another reason why i am here is, i like to procrastinate with studying. having this class allows me to set aside a designated time every week to better understand topics that we have already covered in the parent course or to prepare ourselves by working on material that we may encounter in the future. the last reason is to be able to meet new people. since some people are taking the same parent class as i am, i am able to connect with these people and we are able to benefit each other by discussing our lecture and creating study groups to prepare ourselves for tests or to help each other with homework.

the main reason i'm here is because i found the lecture don't provide much support in solving exercises due to the broad amount of material from each chapter.i've been advised during the orientation to take this support to help me improve my understanding of the class content. so far it's been helpful sitting in a table with other classmates discussing and solving problems that are challenging at some point. also the different level of knowledge of students helps me to understand in a one to one interaction questioning why someone solved an exercise in such specific manner. details are important specially refreshing some math from previous classes that are covered during this class, not such good examples using matlab but at least they provide a general idea. i would like to have not just solving random problems but past exams.i also wonder if we would be allowed to use a cheat sheet andor formulas from the book.

the reason why im here is because my parents decided they want to have kids, and the sperm that won out of the other thousands that couldve made it, but ended up dying before they could, making me the winner and here right now on this day. i think there is a reason why i won out of the others because i survived and won, which i guess you could say made me more superior than my other siblings. i think i am here to help people, and support them, and for the special people in my life i am here to bring them happiness, laughter and love. for example, a couple years ago ive helped a lot of people, such as helping my moms senior client find a pet dog after her husband passed away, and i've also fostered many dogs that needed a home and opened more spaces for the shelter to take in more dogs. i'm also a strong advocate for rescue dogs who need homes, and worked at a all senior dog rescue, along with adopting my 11 year old shepherd mix.

i ask myself this question every chance i get. often times, i can be very pessimistic and i eventually come to the conclusion that life has no meaning. if you think about it, there really is no true purpose to life except to live and to die. however, i refuse to throw life into this meaningless category because i believe theres more to life than the individual. after all, there is a reason why human connection is incredibly important to our health. i believe we are all here for a reason, and whether it may be right or wrong i believe it is noble. my belief is that we are all here for each other, whether it may be to love or to hate, we all learn from one another. due to this, i believe my purpose in life is to continue to improve the world for those to come. we study old architecture and literature to learn of the people before us, what they left behind was for our advancement as a human species.

i feel that i (and all of us) are here for a reason, and by no miracle we were given our life. we do not know and will never know what is after humanity, and this is crazy to think about because we still push ourselves everyday to be the best hardworking person we can be. god put everyone on this earth to live freely, but with a purpose. i believe that purpose is to see which people were caring and nice, and which people are mean and a threat to society. in other words it seems life is just the test, and whatever is after life is the bigger picture. personally though, i feel i am here for a big purpose, because i have a big heart and want to make everyones life better. im here to give back to the people, and help the people to make this world a better place. when my time is done god will know what ive done, and see that it was beneficial to the world.

the reason i believe that i am here is to help people, i believe that i was gifted with an extreme level of compassion for people and a strong desire to serve the populus i believe the best way that i can do that is through medicine and learning about the body. while attending school and pursuing higher education i believe that i can help people by teaching them the foundations of healthy choices and habits and how to maintain health in order to achieve confidence in their own frames. from a young age i always had a passion for health and fitness and this has evolved into a passion for health and medicine later on in my life. my approach to medicine is a holistic approach which i believe is the best approach because it doesnt solely focus on prescribing medication and sending people on their ways, rather it focuses on pushing health and taking care of the person as a whole in order to ensure that i left them better then when they came to me rather than just temporarily fixing one problem while inducing another one.

i've thought a lot about this subject to the point where i know too many different possibilities that it can drown me. i am a rather spiritual person i would say and i am also a curious one and for that reason i've asked a lot of different people a lot of different questions. i've studies with catholics, christians, jehovah witnesses, talked to muslums, mormons just to hear what they have to say. one of the most interesting versions i've heard was that we were all angels that lost our ways and we are living many lives in order to fix the mistakes that weve made and in the different life times that we live we are learning different lessons and once we've learned all our lessons that's when we can finally fully rest. i don't know how true that is but i thought it was interesting because if you pay attention to the things that happen around us then you can be really attuned to the things that pop up in your life and why. molst people live without thinking a single thought and choosing different things that can shape their life and others in different ways. as for why i am here, i have felt that i have always been here for other people. i teach and learn lessons as i go as to what my purpose is. i think i'm still on my way of figuring that out as the rest of us are. and i don't think anyone actually knows a definite answer considering there is no actual difference between me and the next person we are still on this same planet. i'm not worried about the what happens next either because at the end of the day it is inevitable, and i try not to think about the what i'm supposed to do for now as much because it can really put you in a helpless state, so i'm just trying to trust my intuition and flow to where life takes me.

me being here is actually quite a surprise to me. growing up i never thought i would go to college or let alone be alive at 20 years old. i was always getting bad grades, kicked out of schools, and doing things that i shouldn't have been doing. so to actually be here in physics 2 studying for a civil engineer is huge accomplishment for me. i am very thankful for where i'm at today and very thankful for the lessons god has taught me. i look forward to a great semester.

i am here because despite all the order that needs to be in place for our universe and the things in it to be in relative equilibrium, i am a product of the spontaneity of our universe. i am here because as humans, we learned to be more present and to have direction in our lives. i believe the human experience is to build and develop a purpose in our lives beyond our primal instincts using the complex minds that we were gifted with. for me personally, i have chosen to try to be a positive effect on those who i am connected with. in this present moment, i am building myself up through education and experiences so that later in my life, i will be able to contribute to the personal growth of others and help them through their endeavours.

in this present moment, i am building myself up through education and experiences so that later in my life, i will be able to contribute to the personal growth of others and help them through their endeavors.(note: i apologize for the late submission. i was not able to attend the first lab session earlier in the semester which was the reason why i never got to submit this. since you opened up late work until may 16th, i realized i could go back and finally submit this consciousness assignment.)

i believe i am here for a reason, only god knows. i think as i grow up, i'm starting to come to a better understanding of what my purpose is here on earth, but i do not completely understand yet. sometimes, i feel as if i am here simply to be an aid to others. i am the friend you come to when you need advice. i am the peace maker. i am the one who always remains calm. i think that these type of characteristics must somehow. be tied into the big question, "why am i here?" maybe i was placed on this earth so i can help other people. these type of thoughts influence literally everything i do. i have chosen my career path based on this assumption as well. i just want to be someone others can count on, because in my darkest moments i have felt so alone. i never want anyone to feel that way, so i make sure that no matter who enters my life, i become someone they can trust and confide in.

my purpose in life, on this planet, here on earth, at this very day and age is to live to serve others. to live a life that does not solely benefit me, but rather to put another before myself in all situations. i strive to live this life everyday, although i am not perfect. as a human the tendency of selfabsorption is an instinct, and to combat that would be going against our natural instincts as humans. however, this selfdenying lifestyle has been proven and is continuously proven to be the most pleasant lifestyle to live holistically. from many testimonies of celebrities and billionaires that have acquired everything, the one thing that is a staple in all of their stories is that, after acquiring everything, living a selfindulgent lifestyle is not satisfying.

to be quite fair i'm not sure what anyones purpose is on the planet. i along with most believe my purpose is something greater than what's expected. i believe i am here to spark change, be a spark of something that should have been present long ago. now, im not saying i have higher power, but what i am saying is that i can be part of a higher power to help bring light to everything on earth. my purpose is change and enlightenment. i will be the solution instead of problems, and this goes for me being in college, or my personal life, or any job.

for the longest time, i have struggled with this question and i feel as though i still am. the first thing that comes to mind when i hear this question is i am meant to help people. it is a very cheesy and overused answer, but it has always been one of my biggest desires to help people hence why my major is prenursing. my surroundings and people close to me have been my biggest influence on why i believe this is my purpose and why i am here. i have grown up around some of the most selfless people i know. my grandaunt was a nurse in the philippines. with her earnings, she sheltered many street kids, providing them food, water, even teaching them in her free time. my grandpa, though with very little money, would always bring money on his way to work in the mornings so that he could buy bread and coffee to any homeless people he came across. even when my grandparents only had a small apartment in oakland, they would offer their homes to any relatives who needed somewhere to stay whether for work or running away from their home. when i think about the people i look up, the people i strive to be, i think of them. i want to be as selfless and generous as they were, to care for people the way did. i can only hope to be half the people they were. i am still not completely positive if that is really my purpose in life, or why i am here, but it is what i want to work towards every day of life.

you know, sometimes i ask that question a lot. i wonder why i'm here all the time. what is my purpose? i've heard a lot of answers, but the one that stood out to me was leaving a legacy.what kind of thing do you want people to remeber you as? it didn't matter if it was a world wide change or just making a difference in your community, as long as you were making a significant change to your community, that's what mattered the most.deep down, the everyone wants the same thing: to live a happy and carefree world without having to worry about anything. i think that kind of answer is the best outcome any wants. unfortunately, the world we live in is flawed, and everyone we encounter is flawed. it's within our dna to be scared as a defense mechanism. people only fear things because they don't understand it. if everyone came together, learned about each other and have an open mind, the world would be in a better place.i, myself can't do much as a person at the moment, but my goal in life is to be in a position, where i can make a change and be an example to others. whether it would be in research or as a head of company. that's the kind of legacy i want to be remembered as and a future i want to leave for the children of tomorrow.

sometimes when things in life don't go as planned, i always have to reflect on why i'm even here in the first place. i ask myself what am i doing to create a better future for myself but not forgetting to live life in the moment. i've been told i can do anything i put my mind to but how am i supposed to figure out my true purpose if i can do "everything"? it then narrows down to the things that i find joy in participating in and how i utilize my god given gifts. i'm a person of many talents and skills, which is why i believe i was placed here on this universe for multiple purposes. when i was younger, my mother was diagnosed with a brain tumor and it took months of convincing her to finally get surgery to remove the tumor. after experiencing those years of watching her suffer, i've developed a love for the medical field and knew i wanted to be apart of changing the lives of others through medicine. also, i've been granted the gift of imagination which allows me to write mini books, poems, and short stories, along with a long list of other talents. i truly believe my huge personality, when combined with my career interests and natural talents, were placed here to spread love throughout those i cross paths with in life. i'm here to share smiles and be a light in the midst of someone's darkness, while assisting in prolonging long and healthy lives.

It's so weird to think that that's how it works because it seems nearly impossible, but I like to think that whatever being is out, may it be a God or the Universe, I am where I need to be today. I am here because something out there is letting me be here. I don't necessarily need an explanation on WHY am I here, like the theory of evolution or anything, but it's more of why am I HERE because I could be anywhere right now. But I am glad I exist today and experience the good of life. I do however think there is an explanation for everything, like how we evolved, or like how reproduction works, or even why I chose SFSU, but it's pretty cool to think that we are all here at the same time, experiencing the same world.

I am here in San Francisco because I've always wanted to live in a big city and its the closest to where my mom just moved to. I'm in this class because I hadn't realized that I was supposed to take the lab last semester with the lecture so I'm taking it now to fill the GE requirement. Though I liked the lecture, I'm not too keen on hands on activities like this so I'm hoping to just get through this class with a good grade. I'm here right now on February 11th because I think it's important to attend class especially this one because you can easily fall behind.

Why am I here? Why is anyone here? This is honestly such a vague question to ask as it can have a thousand meanings. We can start with why I am here in this class; I am taking ASTR 116 because as far as I am aware, this class is supposed to accompany ASTR 115, and I am taking that class this semester as well? Why am I in San Francisco? because this just so happened to be where my parents decided to move when my older brother and I were born. The next logical question, since this is an astronomy class, would be why am I on earth? well I don't think anyone knows the answer to that question except maybe God. I could on for hours answering this one question.

This questions seems pretty deep to me. It seems hard to answer "why am i here?", Well im in this classroom to get a graduate requirement course on my degree. Im also here because i "qualified" for the course by taking a regular astronomy class last semester. Astronomy is pretty interesting to me. The sky and the universe is pretty big and hard to fathom. "why am I here?", I'm in San Francisco to go to college here and graduate. I choose to come here because I thought the city life would be exciting and I got recruited here to wrestle for the schools team. "why am I here" I'm attending college as a first generation from an immigrant household. I'm here for the wishes of my mom, I want to make her proud and do something for myself to set myself up in the future. College isn't the only way to do this but it's the path I chose.

I am in this class because I enrolled into it when applying to classes and I needed a lab and thought that astronomy is like the closest thing to being a really cool person. I'm here to expand my knowledge about our universe and space and all the cool stars and planets with different colors. I am here because I need an education, and I won't get anywhere in life unless is finish my four years here. I don't compare this to the four years of high school because I can feel my brain developing and I can feel myself getting more intelligent. I love meeting new people and especially in this city where I can run into literally anyone and learn something either about them or about me or about the world. I could have totally skipped class today and stayed in my dorms, but I am here because I need to work on my consistency and going to class is like bare minimum. But I am excited to walk back to my dorms and maybe see a friend or two and then work on homework. But I am here ultimately for school. Got to keep the priorities straight and make sure I don't fall off track.

I am here because I've always been fascinated by the universe. I've always loved the stars and watching shooting stars in the night sky when I was little. There's always been something so magical about the universe that I feel strongly connected to, in a spiritual sense. I remember having astrophysical dreams where I would see from outside my body the formation of the universe. I've always thought was a good reason to want to know more and learn from within myself what I can know about what's outside of our realm of knowledge. Aside from these, I've enjoyed my time with Mr. Chris McCarthy last Fall in ASTR 115, and I'd hope that this class would be just as fun and entertaining for me. And aside from everything else, this class is an easy general education requirement class that I feel I can excel in because the lecture was pretty breezy for me.

Im here in this class because it was a requirement to take but I also was interested in learning more about astronomy and having a more hands on experience with learning. I wanted to learn more about the planets and our solar system and why it is the way it is. Im here at San Francisco State to get my Bachelors in Studio Art and to continue expanding on my art work. I felt San Francisco State would be the best option for that and has a wide diversity on campus. Its also not super far from where I live but far enough where I have to commute to get to campus.

While Im not exactly sure why Im here in this class aside from my slight interest in astronomy, I am here at San Francisco State University purely because I love San Francisco. I couldve gone somewhere else, more prestigious to my interest (and i probably will transfer) but having the opportunity to live in the place I love during some of my young adult life means the world to me. While I grew up just an hour away, getting to actually be in the middle of it and have this city be my everyday life is very exciting. Knowing that even though I have a busy class schedule, at the end of the week I get to go and experience all that San Francisco has to offer is a very freeing feeling. Even though my room doesnt have AC and gets very hot, and the recent rain completely destroyed my umbrella, Im glad i decided to come here even if I dont finish my full 4 years at SF state. I am excited to have the opportunity to learn new things that I didnt have access to beforelike astronomy, and I cant wait to see what the rest of this semester has in store for me.

I want to share the reason why I am here, at san Francisco State, at this point in my life. I previously attended university in Bologna, Italy, in the 90s (yes, 1990) pursuing a five year degree in semiotics and communication. Although at the time I completed all my exams, I did not finish writing my final dissertations. A move across continent, the birth of four children, and a career in marketing got in the way of my final assignment. Long story short, I was not able to claim my university diploma. I am here now, many years later, trying to finish what I had started: get the piece of paper and make my family, and myself, proud. So far, I am loving every minute of my experience. I cherish education so much more and with a newfound enthusiasm. I like the environment and especially my classmates, that are about the same age as my children.

When life gets challenging I like to stay on routine. I thrive on routine and if thats disrupted, things will only get worse for me. I like to get in 4-5 workouts in a week and walk my dog every day. I like to be in bed by 10:30 and I know if I keep this up, I will slowly get out of whatever challenge I may face. I also like to write things down and rely on the people I care about, I find that sometimes issues seem bigger but if I talk about things with my fiance or friends, they will somehow become smaller or I will get a lot of encouragement. Talking about things is also important because often times, our feelings and problems seem to be bigger in our head which can make some people feel overwhelmed in their situation. Additionally, I like to make a list of steps to do in order to overcome the challenge so I can visually see the solution.

when life gets challenging i like to think about what i can do in that moment to calm myself. Some things I do ( in no specific order) is call my friend bo and vent to them which usually ends up being a nice 4 hour call of us laughing and me forgetting i was ever sad. i call my aunt and explain to her how im feeling and we process my emotions together to see where it started usually its because i havent ate or drank any water that day. she helps me replace stuff that has gotten broken or messed up by others in my house. and she sends me gift cards for Uber and starbucks so i wont have food/traveling stress due to my arthritis commuting can be a pain in the a**. sometimes i blast music in my airpods and cry it out. i hold my dogs even though they dont like it but they must know im sad because they never get irritated with me if i do that while crying. and if i have the money i go shopping.

When life gets challenging, I tend to always pesevere even when it seems impossible. Following my routines, seeing friends and family, and putting energy into things I love. I try to focus on the things I can control as opposed to the things that are out of my hands. I will continue to put energy into taking care of myself and keep moving forward. During these times, there is a chance to have a bre akthrough in beliefs and limitations. I genuinely believe we all have the power to persevere and rebuild after challenges in life.

When life gets a little challenging I tend to take a step back and let loose a little bit by some stimulation of some sort. I usually like to do some form of physical activity to get the dopamine and endorphins going, which can include running, weightlifting, swimming, or hiking. I often do these things alone to try and figure out what is really bothering me or pressing me at the moment, but also try not to get off track or lost in my head about it. It is thankfully really easy to do all of these things around the city, which is surprising considering how small and dense it is, but Golden Gate Park houses half of my outlets and it is really easy to get to. I do not have to take a whole lot of breaks, but when I do this is usually my go to.

When life gets challenging I try to spend time with my loved ones, as connecting with others is the most useful tool to getting through something hard. As well as connecting with yourself. Spending time alone journaling, exercising, going on adventures, and of course keeping up with your mental health. Sometimes I also need to give myself a break because I over schedule myself, which can lead to burnout in challenging times. I think maintaining your mental health is the best way to get through hard times, rather then leave it to when things get really bad.

When life gets challenging, I try to set my focus on what life will be like once I overcome that challenge. I think that makes the challenge so much easier to tackle. For example, if I want to finish a project by a certain deadline and but I have more homework to do throughout that window of time, I'll think about how easily I can do my homework and focus on my project and get it done. If it's just a case of life being hard in general, I think I would just keep myself calm and collective with music or surround myself with things or people that'll make me overcome it. Music is really helpful most of the time because my mind is stimulated by sounds that make me feel comfortable and energetic. I think that's the case for a lot of people as well and I think that's something everyone should look into doing. Whether it's putting on a podcast or your favorite artist while you're, cooking, running, or doing homework.

When life gets challenging I have a few things I can turn to. My mom is great at giving advice and helping me think about things in a better light. Sometimes I also lean on my friends and they also help comfort me. When it comes to things that I do for myself, I usually just try to get more rest and relax. I like taking naps and naps usually make me feel a lot better. I also enjoy watching shows or youtube and when I watch those I feel a lot better. Sometimes I enjoy making myself a good meal too. I also like going and treating myself to a good drink from one of my favorite boba places or getting a yummy snack. I also like playing with my dogs because when i see that they're so excited to play it makes me forget about my problems.

When life gets challenging, in an academic setting, I close everything down and don't complete any work. By doing this, I allow myself space and time to reincorporate. However, it's a bit different in a professional setting. In a professional setting, I tend to finish what's on-hand. Then coping with it afterwards by binge eating. I don't find entertainment through the media (YouTube, Instagram, videogames, etc.). Something I do on a daily basis though is listen to music, when life gets challenging, music is a fun way to express your emotions.

When life gets challenging I would say my go to towards confronting it is to be productive in outlets that bring me down in stress and also in peace to reflect where I am and strategize where I can be. These outlets mainly consist of drawing running spinning vinyl to even just taking long naps. These outlets of mine are very much my anchor when things get challenging and I have the will to back away from things for a moment and go to want can calm me. Things are expected to hit ou hard with a sense of confronting and pushing to a point of uncomfortable but if anything its a opportunity to also gain strength in being humble. Ive had many times where the pressure was real with in my head and outside of it with expectations set upon me to deliver. At the same time I have enough confidence in myself to push through the feeling giving up due to my core mentality of patience. Ive told what I like to do physically when life gets tough but mentally I like to psyche myself up with the realization that if I just bow down and give up to the pressure of the challenge it will only reveal that the pressure the challenge brought was only temporary. with it being temporary your brought with the disappointment of realizing you coulee went farther so mentally when life gets challenging I try to go beyond the expectation/feeling of what the challenge negatively bring to the out come I can positively create I manage to stick through it & end up looking back realizing it wasn't the end of the world. Thats a mentality I got from being in track in field marathon running and being a artist. having patience in your self to go beyond the despair of what other and yourself think is key to coming out on the other side its something that I believe applies to running drawing and life itself.

When life gets challenging I keep going. I never give up unless it's time to give up. When life gets difficult I take care of my routine and make sure I am eating healthy because If I am in a good state of mind I can conquer any challenge. When life gets challenging I might cry and get sad but I will never surrender and will stay strong. There are many things in life that I do not want to do that I will have to do. I will not make excuses I will just do them with intensity, just get the work out of the way so that I can focus on more important pressing matters. I will balance my life well by counteracting challenging life tasks with fun things that I want to do and that give me purpose. When life gets challenging It means that you might grow and learn from this difficult time.

When life gets challenging I tend to grit my teeth and bare through it but always find an excuse to reward myself after completing anything during the hard time. Typically that treat is food, but sometimes depending on how stressed I am I may indulge in recreational smoking or drinking for the night after a hard day. The tricky part is maintaining the indulgence as it starts to become a habbit and coping mechanism for every little thing. So I try to save all of these rewards for special occasions. To prevent addiction but also to make those rewards all the more savorable.

I get anxious and I overthink when life has challenges. It's my first instinct to start worrying and making things worse than they already are. A lot of the time it's hard to notice the positive things in negative aspects. It's easier to worry about something than waste the time and energy just to fix it POSSIBLY. I will not hesitate to reach out for help; I've done so in the past, and I'll keep continuing to do it. It's futile to tackle things alone sometimes, having someone there who can pick you back up when you fall, is all you need. And when all else fails, just cry. Sit down, listen to some really sad music, make your room all dark, and just cry till you fall asleep. Crying releases endorphins in your body, which makes you feel better. Crying isn't for babies, it takes a grown and mature person to sob.

In my daily life, I always face difficulties. Whenever I have a hard time, I try to comfort myself, motivate myself, and overcome it on my own. As an international student studying in the U.S., I face even more challenges than I did in my home country. But every day, I try my best and work hard. I go out to explore new things and look for what can bring me joy as motivation to overcome these difficulties.Besides that, I often talk to my mom about the problems I face. She usually gives me advice and comforts me, telling me that I will get through them.I am also very lucky to have friends who are always by my side and help me. When they see that Im not okay, they usually check on me, give me advice, or take me out so I dont feel sad or overthink.

For me, I will look back at my life, look back at the days I have gone through difficulties and start to calm down and find a solution. I will find a quiet place and start writing my thoughts on paper and learn more knowledge from the life around me and the experiences I have gone through to develop myself and also deal with challenging from my life.

When life. Gets a bit difficult or challenging I tend to take it out with working out or doing anything physical because physical exertion is a huge outlet for me and It calms me in the long run and improves my mental and physical health although i dont as much physically work out all the time i do when my mid is not in the best mental state and looking at the rest of my family who have different coping mechanisms one to point out is anger and eating I find m coping helps other people be open to me because I dont have that emotional coping and makes me healthier in the long run.

When life gets challenging, depending on whatever it is thats bothering me, I do either of the following three. 1. Rant to my sister about it. This is usually the case when I'm complaining about someone or some situation in particular. It feels good to have someone who just listens. Although half the time i think she's not even listening lol. 2. I push through, more often than not to the detriment of myself ( aka my sleep). Usually before something important is due. 3. I go for a walk without a care in the world. Also before I need to get something done, but still have some time and cab avoid and pretend it's not due.

Life is already challenging for me and I am frustrated. Ever since the semester started, I have been getting homework non-stop which is ideal for a college student. But the amount of work being assigned in a week and expected to turn it in at the end of the week along with other classes is insane. I have a weekly reading to do along with practice quiz and a lab with it, and a weekly quiz from my other 2 classes and projects as well. It really does seem unideal for me to complete it in a week. However, this workload just might be the same to the real world in big jobs. I can't emphasize how much I care for sleeping. On top of my other school work, I have a full time job to make ends meet. It honestly sucks. Now what do I do when it is challenging already? Like an exam thats opening, 2 quizzes, a project due next week and a reading assigned this week thats also due in the same week. I push through and sleep less, thats just reality. Because I also have classes to attend and the time frame isn't ideal for me. I just have to suck it up and endure it. My plan is to just continue studying till my exam and do my best.

When life gets challenging I like to be by myself. I could be going for walks or exploring alone. It would be listening to music in bed. It could be taking a nap. It could be making food and watching a movie. I just need to be by myself. I need time to unfocus from the world and unfocus on people and focus on myself. I have learned that I have to be just as important to myself as others are to me, which is hard because I love to love. This seems so simple but honestly its so affective. I never take much me time, because I am a very social person, or I never not have someone around, because I love hanging out with people. I eventually learned that I need that time to me too, and eventually, I just took breaks from the world, but it always helps me reset in the end.

When life gets challenging, I try and work through it the best that I can. If I am having difficulties with friends I will go to to them and talk about the issue, trying to resolve it before it leads to resentment. If I am having trouble in school, I give myself a few days away from friends to focus on catching up. If everything seems to be getting overwhelming, I give myself space from everything and focus on one of my hobbies or take myself out to dinner to center myself again. Overall, when things start to get difficult, my main goal is to to shut down and forget about everything but simply give myself the space I need to in order to recover and calm down. In the past I used to not do that so well, and so I have been working on better managing my needs while being considerate of those around me in hard times.

Life has many ups and downs. At some point or another we all feel happiness in our lives, and that joy and happiness almost always gets offset by some hardship, or vise versa. Unsurprisingly, this has been the case in my life, I have gone on a roller coaster, having a high point, and then a sudden drop. One of the hardships I've been going through and still working on is with my journey to better myself. Last semester, I really felt like I was in a rut, I was failing a couple of classes, I stopped going to the gym and put on a lot of weight, and I fell into my temptations. I really did not want to repeat this mistake again this semester, so the biggest thing that helped me do better was to think about where I don't want to be in life, and then think about what I can do to be as far away from that as I can. Just that mindset alone has helped me get through this semester way better.

What I do when life gets challenging is lie down and give up. Nah, Im just joking around. What I do is take a step back recollect my thoughts and try to improve my mental health before continuing like maybe go for a walk or do something I enjoy before taking the challenge head on. Coming from a wrestling background and doing it for a large part of my life the sport has changed my outlook on what a challenge truly is giving me some thick skin. I am extremely grateful for this. Nothing could be tougher than cutting 12 pounds every week, starving, losing a close match after putting in blood, sweat and tears. But i've also learned that this sport has brought me many challenges as well like questioning my self worth. At that time I took a step back and reevaluated my self and chose myself over anything i am more than just my sport. This is where I learned that taking a step back and prioritizing my mental health is the best option when facing a challenge doing so allows me to re think and face the challenge in a new way.

When life gets challenging, I resort to a lot of different kinds of music. Specifically my rock playlist. All the hard bass and loud yells can help with my stress levels. I try to stray away from the sad songs because I tend to get emotional when I am in a bad area in life. Recently, life has been treating me pretty well. Im glad that the sun is out today because going outside is another way that gets me back to a calm state of mind. I try to go outside and maybe lay in the sun. Or go walk around my building and look out the windows from the 6th floor. Going back to music, it is my favorite thing to do when I am feeling down and I know that I can always pop my headphones in and play whatever can bring me back up from a rough patch.

When life gets challenging, I usually just take a moment to myself, step back, and breathe. I am a full-time student, work two part-time jobs, and maintain the cleanliness of my apartment. It can be a lot for most people, and it is, but it is what I wanted. I chose to do things, as difficult as they are, because I genuinely believe that in order for me to be my truest, highest, best version of myself in the future, I have to start working on it now. And it may only get harder then, but I will have been able to look back at myself now and say, "Wow, I really did that." Among other things I do is to just to promote physical and social wellness within myself by going to pilaes every weekend, and visit places in the city that I have always wanted to go to.

What I do when life gets challenging is I try to think about the positive things rather than focusing on the negative things. I also try to keep in mind that when life does get challenging, it doesnt always stay like that and it eventually passes. Remembering this helps me from being discouraged by negative influences that could appear in my life. When life gets challenging I also find ways to de-stress myself like going for a walk outside or painting usually helps me. It helps me focus on the present moment and distracts me from any issues at hand. Journaling is another way of dealing with life when it gets challenging that I find to be helpful. Its therapeutic in the sense that I get to write out how I feel about whatever it is thats bothering me and reflect on it.

When life gets challenging I like to sit in bed all day and sleep. I like to eat buldak ramen too but I cant eat too much of it because it has way too much sodium. I also like to clean my room and take a shower, ignoring everyone on my phone until I cant stand the notifications anymore. Iv honestly gotten pretty good at blocking things that stress me out but every once in a while something will really get to me and the rest spirals from there. I wish I was better at handling things but unfortunately, I am a crashout majority of the time. Iv been working on not being bothered and have been doing yoga to ease my mind but when something pisses me off, I get really really mad. Its bad. Maybe I need to go to bed earlier and not spend all night on tiktok and eat more fruit which the dining hall has almost none of (apples and oranges do not count). Overall, when life gets hard and Im stressed, I can manage until its too much. When Im pissed off, it just needs to run its course

When life gets challenging I try not to get overwhelmed. If the challenge is big, I try to break it down and see what I can do to chip at it and solve the problems I have control over. For the issues I can't control I seek advise from friends and family. I am very lucky I can rely on great people at this time in my life. I also try to take good care of both my physical and mental health. In the past 20 or so years I have not been able to care so much about myself because I was concerned with caring for my children. Now they are mostly grown up and I have more time to focus and me. So far I did not have to face huge challenges and I feel extremely grateful. Sense of humor always help and a good laugh goes a long way.

The values of my community and family have helped me navigate through college as they have been a support system for myself. My parents have instilled in me a strong work ethic so I try to try my best in all my classes. College can often be challenging but its mostly organizational and because I have a full time job. Often I will find an assignment to be easy but if I don't have the time to give it my all, I will just try to get it done with a passing grade instead of shooting for an A. However, my community will often try to make my life easier by either making dinner or checking in on me for whatever I need. This type of support has definitely helped me navigate through not just college but through life as well. Additionally, being open to this help is essential and something I've learned to do.

The values of my community have helped me throughout college in many different ways. Being able to work with all types of different people effectively is one of the biggest values I learned early on from my community. As you expand into other parts of life, being able to do this will help make working relationships run smoother.

The values of my community have thought me so much about drive and hard work. Without them, I do not believe that I could have gone as far as I did. They made me durable and able to handle so much more than a lot of people in my position. The drive goes hand in hand with being durable and to keep going after you have hit rock bottom over and over, is a invaluable skill to have, especially now when a lot of people want stuff handed to them. I am glad to have the community I had growing up, many would consider it rowdy and unkempt, but I loved it and it loved me. That being said, I struggle with wanting my future kids to experience the same, or if they should be shelter and babied. Either way, I know that the mold and wisdom that it gave me will always shine through my drive and hard work.

The values of my community and family have helped me navigate college not only in academics but in creative endeavors and social dynamics as well. As a film major creativity is central in my education so my family and community growing up fostering an environment to be creative was very important. I went to an art school with open minded values, that made SFSUs incorporation of the school of Ethnic studies and Women and Gender studies into the curriculum very familiar. My family prepared me well for living with roommates, that being respectful and kind in all social situations is the best route.

The values of my family helped me navigate through college by using what I've learned from my parents and others to make smart choices. When I was younger, my parents would always tell me how to handle certain situations before they happen, so I've always been prepared for anything. In high school, it was a lot easier to go through certain obstacles since I've gotten so much advice. Eventually, that carried over to college and those same values apply. In college, I find myself in a lot of places where I need to take responsibility for things and my Grandma always told me to be cautious and be responsible when I'm anywhere in the world. I find myself feeling a lot more mature than others in college as well because of the values of honesty, kindness, and care that was taught to me at a very young age. I also would give credit to my elementary/middle school which really shaped who I am through religious values. Although I'm not as religious as I once was, I still carry the values that were taught to me.

My mom has helped me the most through college so far. She has always been unconditionally supportive with whatever I decide is best for me and has a lot of trust in me. She encourages me to advocate for myself and to make sure I am getting my needs met like tutoring for example. She has taught me to trust my gut instinct and to also focus on something that I enjoy and am passionate about. I think that if it weren't for her, I would have not gone to SFSU and only went to community college, but she encouraged me to go out of my comfort zone and I enjoy it at SFSU! My friends have also been really supportive emotionally and I enjoy telling them about my college life vs. theirs. My dad is also very supportive and wants me to get a higher education because he was never able to get it himself and he wanted that for me.

My parents came from Vietnam and because of that, my family worked blue-collar jobs to earn livable wages. However, this isn't necessarily true for everyone in my family today. Parts of my family are successful while others aren't as nearly successful. I come from a family where my parents believed education was key to everything I wanted in life, thus education is a value instilled in me today. Being an "academic weapon" and upholding that "model minority" stereotype is basically what has navigated me through my academic journey.

I think my values of my community or my family helped me navigate through college through the choices Ive made this far. I think my family specifically my mominstilled in me a sense of making sure I stay on top of things likehygiene classwork tidiness and overall confidence in oneself. My mom before me went to UC Berkley and managed to provide for both my sister and me while being the role model she is, she set a good example for me to follow and also expand upon. When Im struggling with classwork or overall having a bad day I reminisce on watching my mom or my grandparents work through and manage themselves so using that as fuel I do the same and try to push through the bad by focusing on the good. I know I can't be just like my family in regards to achieving the level of success they have but I was also instilled with always having self confidence/ individuality so Overall my lessons and behavior of my family rubbed off on me on a good way in handling college so far

I don't know what family values my parents or family have given to me. I get along with people pretty well and generally know how to not be miserable/ entertain myself. I don't know if many values have made my college academic life easier my parents are ballet dancers and they never went to college or my dad went for about a year before dropping out. This isn't to say that my parents aren't hard workers and have not passed that down to me. I am good at getting stuff done I think my family has instilled doing the stuff you don't want to do. just getting that out the way because there is always stuff that you don't want to do in life. My parents have taught me to be funny and maybe appreciate the funny aspects of college life and just general life

My parents have helped me financially navigate college and my partner has pushed to go out and actually attend it as much as possible. But as for navigating college in my experience nobody has helped me especially at sfsu. My film major hasn't really taught me about the industry from a career perspective but just taught me the history of film. Which is great knowledge and all but how is it going to help me get a job? When I talk to advisors they assure it will later but I've already been in this school for 2 years and am still waiting for later to come. This has started to cause burnout unfortunately but I'm financially obligated to keep attending so all the money I've spent isn't for nothing

"How have the values of my community or my family (of origin or of choice) helped me navigate through college?" My aunt has granted me the privilege and honor to attend Sf State. I wouldnt even be where I am today without her help. My family in Texas always financially struggled, we were always house hopping and scrapping by. My aunt, Deborah, has helped us with financial support throughout all my life. I eventually was granted the opportunity to live with my Aunt and Uncle in berkeley and attend high school for my Junior and Senior years. It is took barely anytime time before my aunt to whip me in shape. I started to work out and be more social at school, my manors got better and I learned how to interact with people pleasantly. A lot of things approved for me, I wouldve never known id make it to college. I am forever grateful for the kindness of my Aunt and Uncle.

I am lucky to be born into a family where not only my parents but also other family members always care for, help, and encourage me. Whenever I want to do something, they are always by my side. When I started college, I had many worries, such as finances, health, and mental well-being. My family always provided me with everything in the best way possible. Especially when I studied abroad, things became much harder than studying in my home country. There were times when I wanted to give up, but my family was always the one to encourage me. They taught me how to be patient and overcome challenges in life. They always remind me to prioritize my studies and try my best to do well in school. After going through many things, I realized how important it is to have my family by my side. Their support is a great motivation for me in both college life and life beyond.

The important inspired from my family have played a significant role in helping me navigate college. This way of thinking has kept me motivated and disciplined even when I'm juggling a lot of obligations or difficult classes. Resilience was also stressed by my family, who urged me to see setbacks as chances for personal development. Overcoming challenges like handling a demanding workload or adjusting to new academic expectations has been simpler with this viewpoint. Additionally, the value of seeking support has guided me through college. My family always stressed me the importance of community, which has made me comfortable reaching out to professor and connect with my peers. Finally, the emphasis on integrity and compassion has shaped how I interact with others. These values continue to inspire and ground me as I pursue my education.

I belive the values of my family have severely helped when it comes to college academics while also hindering it in some ways as well because a very large view from my family is hard work while this is good an many aspects in life it also hinders me because sometime i work to hard at work or school and stats burning out with rlly make an impact on my progress if i have to take time on myself way more that usual but this is only one vale and this is how it affects me

My family has taught me that, consistency can take someone a long way. Giving effort is important, it's trying your best that matters most. So that's what I'm trying to do with college, I do my homework on time, try to attend class no matter how sleepy I am in the morning and honestly, after a whole days work, it feels really great, like I've accomplished something useful with my time. I feel productive.

I always had strict values from my community especially with my Chinese American family and other relatives or friends as well. They always pushed me hard to do well on my education and it has come to my attention that I should do well. But it is also difficult to do so with immense pressure that is constantly being put on me. Yes it is important to do well in education, but it has also only given me a sense that I want to just do well and not have a well-rounded perspective of what college is suppose to be like. I only continuously do work and don't really interact with people and I think thats killing my drive to learn the people around me. I wish to meet more people and maybe it will allow me to thrive in a better social life enviornment. However, I also learned to become an adult myself which means making choices on my own whether I should be doing this or pushing myself to do what I want to do. With this mentality, I'm slowly starting to understand what it is like to make my own choices and seek for a new world and discovering how life beautiful can be, especially in college.

The values of my family have helped me navigate through college because they taught me how to be strong and independent. I was taught to put myself first, but to treat others with respect no matter what, which has lead me to meet and befriend great people. They have taught me honesty and the outcomes of my actions, which has lead me to be aware of my decisions, and no matter what I do, not feel an ounce of regret. They have taught me how to work under pressure indirectly, by showing me how they handle situations, which has shown me how to react and how to handle any situation given to me. They value family, which has only shown me that I am loved and cared for, no matter where I am. It has been hard to be at college in a different state, away from all my family, but I, and they, are sure that I can handle myself in a new environment, because they trust in what they taught and shown me.

I think aspects my mom instilled in me when I was young helps me the most. She always trusted me to be independent, she taught me how to do things on my own, and gave me the freedom to do so. She taught me how to be strong through big changes, like for instance moving here from across the country. She gave me the confidence to realize that I can achieve the goals that I want. With the other side of my family being conservative and very stuck in their ways, I've learned how to deal with conflict and hardships. However, my friends here though is what really helps me navigate college. Everyone here has such unique experiences and we all come from different backgrounds and are simply trying to figure this college thing out themselves. My friends here are my home away from home, and a comfort in such an unfamiliar place.

The values of my family have stayed with me for life, including the principles of working hard and pushing through challenges, no matter what. Watching my single mother work 2 jobs my whole life, growing up, doing it all on her own, far away from her homeland. Aside from my direct family, my community, like my teachers, coaches, etc, have given me my values as a person, teaching me how to be a genuine and raw person, not putting up a front for anybody and being myself wherever I am. I've realised at a certain point you're more than yourself, you're a representation of your community and values, so live your life as if you're upholding something bigger than yourself. All these values have helped me so much in college, helping me be myself and find good friends who care for me and being confident in my work, and being able to work hard.

I have a very traditional upbringing. Having grown up in the Philippines, I grew up in culture and community. For as long as I could remember, I've been doing household chores and taking care of the younger childrenwhether they be my family or just the neighborhood kids. Now, I work at the Early Childhood Education Center which just felt natural to me because it was no different than how I lived the past 20 years of my life. I've also never had a hard time rooming in with four other girls because having lived in a multi-generation home, it's always crowded and always loud. You just never get bored. Additionally, the majority of my family members are women, there's like 1 boy every 10 years, so you already know the chores are getting done. This is also the case for my apartment-mates, it's easy living with all girls because they're not too messy, and things are getting done.

My familys values and support in general has helped me through college in many ways. I am currently the first in my family to go through a 4 year university system. Although I am the first, my family is full of hard working people who made their way despite not attending university. Throughout high school and into applying for colleges, they provided me support throughout. While now that Im here they have relaxed on checking on me academically, they still want whats best for me especially because I am considering transferring. One of the most valuable lessons that my family sticks by is going through it even if its tough and that has helped me tremendously. I hope to make my family proud, being the first. And want to see my education follow through getting my masters. Another thing that they have taught me as mentioned before is, you dont need college to be successful if you have the drive to succeed. But, I still really value education so, now Im here.

In my community education is extremely valued therefore there is preassure from society to achieve some form if higher education degree. Of course, in my country of origin, Italy, public education is free, and excellent college education is very much affordable (we are talking of about 500 dollars a year for law school, medical school etc.). In both my family and my community teachers are revered (so far) and they enjoy a level of respect from society at large. I agree with this assesment and I feel very much supported by mu community in my pursue of higher education.

I am here to fulfill my studies for my business management major and have fun with all of the activities that are available at the school. I want to network with individuals with similar experiences, such as myself. I am also here to enjoy my last youthful life before entering the career world. I am particularly excited to meet people and can be friends with those who enjoy similar activities that I want. Overall, I decided to go to San Francisco State University because I live in the Bay Area and find financial opportunities in San Francisco. I didnt choose to go anywhere further than the Bay Area due to being in financial need with my parents. The move was worth it as I found a job right in the financial district while studying for my degree. This allowed me to build my career life while enhancing my learning curve!

Why am I here? I think its because Ive been searching for something that connects me to a bigger picture, something that gives me purpose. Life can sometimes feel like a lot of moving parts, but when I stop to reflect, I realize that its about finding meaning in the small moments. Im here to learn, to grow, and to help make sense of the world around me. I think Im here to better understand the complexities of human existence, the relationships we build, and the ways we interact with each other and our environment. Theres a desire inside me to contribute, to share my experiences, and to learn from others. I believe Im here to challenge myself, push boundaries, and discover new ways of thinking. Im not sure if I have it all figured out, and maybe thats okay. Maybe its the journey that matters more than the destination. But Im here because I want to create something meaningful, to connect with others, and to leave a positive impact in whatever way I can. I think thats why Im here to find my place in this ever evolving world.

I'm here because I wanted to study away from home, not have the responsibilities I had, and part of the reason is because I wanted to explore San Francisco. I'm interested in criminal justice and looking into being in law enforcement, I'm not sure what I really want to be though, since I haven't put much thought into it. I go with the flow a lot and so far I think I'm doing alright. I might transfer, though, because of many classes being cut and starting to be too expensive. While I was here, I focused on my GE requirements, took like 3 CJ classes this year, but I should be done with the GE's, studying and being in school, was never my thing, but so far I think I've done pretty well.. I know I can make it through the 4 years, I just have to wait and see how my future turns out.

Because when i usually watch the sky I feel it is really beautiful but I don't know what is that star or moon. One time, when I went to observatory, my friend told me a lot of things about the stars. I thought if I can know like her, it will be good. I want to know which star is this when I see the sky every time through this class. I am really excited to learn at planetarium. It is really beautiful to see every stars in planetarium.

I am here because I really value my education, I am really thankful that I have the opportunity to be able to go to school and to be able to pursuit and education because a lot of people do not have the opportunity of doing so. I am glad that I get to be in college and have access to many resources and to be educated to have a brighter future. My parents always taught me to value my education. Right now I am focusing on finishing my GE classes because I am still trying to figure out what exactly I want to do with my life

Why am I here? I ask myself this question a lot to be honest. Sometimes I generally wonder why I am here. Is it because it's what my parents want? Is it because I wouldn't know what else to do with my life if I wasn't here ? All that to say that I have recently come to the conclusion that the reason why I am here is because I want to be a good role model for my sister and all of my younger cousins and just for everyone that looks up to me.I know that growing up I didn't have that and I also remember how much I needed it as well. Even though it doesn't sound like I'm really doing any of this for myself in reality I am because by being a good role model for my loved ones I'm benefiting myself and my future as well. I see it as killing two birds with one stone.

Well, I originally came here at SFSU for volleyball, but since my two years being here I have found more purpose in myself and my life. I have found joy in hard work, high achievements and helping others. I think my purpose is to work hard to fulfill things that my parents never got to do. I think each generation has a better opportunity to do better than their parents. Not for a selfish way although, but for them and future generations. This is where I've learned that helping people really brings passion and happiness. As a psych major my end goal is to help people achieve what they strive for with ease. Usually people never get that chance, you never know what is happening in someone's life. That is why my purpose is to work hard and find that out. I want to do better for the better of people.

I often journal and I often ask myself this question. I am here because my energy and spirit chose to be here. I am aware of the fact that we like to complain about life and question why we are here, especially when it gets hard. But, I believe we all made the choice to experience life this way in our physical manifestations of a human body. I understand the energy cannot be destroyed, and we often question how everything is created; this being the Universe. I believe that we are the Universe experiencing itself, every big and little aspect within it. Thinking about this question, literally... I am in school because my Dad believes it is a good path to have. I, too, believe it is, but sometimes I find myself feeling quite stagnant in this path. I think time is a very valuable thing and sometimes I struggle with myself that I am "wasting time" in college. However, as I am coming to the end of my second year, I am realizing that this will go by very fast. Sooner or later, I will be graduated and off to my next adventure. I do know that if I had ever thought about college when I was young, I always thought about studying abroad along with it. Saying this, that is a very big factor as to why I am here, in college. I would like to study abroad next year because I have always wanted to travel; I will in school and after school. Circling back to a more metaphorical and existential way of thinking about the question, I am here because I am learning about myself. I personally think this is the entire point of life. I am happy to be here, while sometimes I am not. I understand it is all a part of it, and for that I am grateful and will indulge every bit of myself in it. I am thankful to experience all of the emotions that come with being a human... Yes, they are hard at times. But, I know that it is only necessary to fully experience what it is to be a human, to not suppress anything. I am curious how you would answer this question.

I am here at SF State to explore areas outside of where I'm from. I wanted to be able to shed a portion of my life that I feel unhappy with, and I like the city here. SF State actually was the only college that I applied to due to my mental health at the time. I also liked the vast demographic of people both at this college and in this city, and the perspective and life experiences that come with interacting with a wide variety of people is of great importance to me.

For me when I think about this question I think more about, why I am here at SF State. I think back to when I was younger and my parents always telling my sister and I that they wanted us to live a better life than they had. My parents didn't get a chance to further their education so I am very appreciative of the fact that I am able to be here today. Here at SF State, I am studying Criminal Justice and Psychology as well as minoring in prison reentry. I am here not only to make my parents proud but also to make myself proud. For the longest time, I did not know what it was that I wanted to study until I started to learn about certain cases that had been happening around where I live which made me wonder why people commit certain crimes. This ended up making me want to pursue a career as a forensic psychologist.

I am a strong believer of everything happens for a reason. I like to wonder why I am here, what brought me to the specific moment, what if I had done something differently, but I dont like to question the reason if that makes sense. Its more of saying I wonder why but I dont actually want to know, because theres a reason for it. I also dont believe in regrets because again, things happen for a reason. Maybe I wasnt happy with my past, or someone elses path, but who knows if that past didnt happen, maybe the future wouldnt be the same. Now if we change it and look more at the Astr. apart of it, Im here and choose this class because how interesting it sounds and looks. Just think about it, we see the sky everyday, we honestly see it more than anything else. We are this little micro atom sized ball floating through space, and thats all we know. Im here because I want to learn more about this ball we live on and the things that surround us as we know of right now. Brandon Gatson

I am here at SF State because I am a Track and Field Athlete. I transferred here from Cal state San Bernardino in 2023 to be closer to home. I have loved it so far up u til this past April where everything changed . I tore my Achilles at the beginning of outdoor season and this fall all of our coaching staff quit and started coaching at other schools because of the major budget cuts and program changes happening. Afterthought that announcement in October, teammates also started quitting and it hasnt been enjoyable since. I already cant even run due to my foot not be8ng healed and a huge part of why I came to SF state because not only am I close to home but I felt at home at school and loved the program. Now? Not so much. I am planning on graduating this spring hopefully nothing goes wrong , so now I just am focusing on healing , trying to find what makes me happy outside of track and just graduating in a few months. I know everything happens for a reason so its okay . Itll make sense down the line . Im glad just to be on earth lol

I suppose that I am here in this astronomy lab because I am required to take it. I struggle with math and science, so I guess that I am here slightly reluctantly. I was a pandemic high schooler, so I haven't taken an in person science class in about five years, I do not remember much at all. I am here at San Francisco State because I wanted to know what it was like to live somewhere besides Los Angeles. San Francisco is beautiful, and I find that it motivates my learning. I really want to get my degree. I love to learn, and besides my Dad, no one on his side of the family has been to college, so I'd like to continue my Dad's legacy and keep learning. I also strive to make my Mom's side of the family proud. They prioritize learning and education, and I have definitely picked that up from them.

I've been thinking about why I'm here more the past week or two. I found myself excited to go out one day and take some photographs with my camera, my favorite hobby right now, and for a split second I had a feeling of doubt and thought "why am I doing this?" Since that happened around a week ago, I've sorta been thinking about why I do things and what the point of everything is. I know my own personal philosophy on life is to just do whatever makes myself and others happy but I've just been thinking about it more and more. Today during my Astronomy lecture, I felt a little weird because we were talking about the next transit of Venus being in around 100 years from now, and that felt so surreal for a moment. It made me feel a little small and inconsequential for a moment but maybe that's a good thing, we're all pretty small in the scope of time and space but that's what makes each of our individual lives so interesting and personal, that fact that they're our own and only that. We don't have to exist and be here to be some huge figures like Issac Newton or Obama or Gandhi, I mean we could be, but if we're not that's completely fine and that's pretty nice, we don't have to be here to serve the entire world, just ourselves and those around us.
