I don't know why i'm here, and I don't really ask myself that much when I go through life. I think it's just people in my life telling me to do things, and I do them. Or certain boundaries and rules that people tell me to follow/not cross, so I don't. I try to live my life with some semblance of agency, but that agency is dictated by knowing what someone else needs me to do in life. Why am I here in class? Woke up early. Had a nice morning. Went to class because I can't afford to miss a class, despite being semi-unprepared for it. I don't have much to say. I don't like to think why i'm here often, because eventually I'll start asking myself when can I leave. 'Why' is a word I hate when it applies to personal things, because finding out why someone is the way they are/why they live removes everything cool about them. I don't 'need' to know why i'm here. Just have to keep moving as if I know in my heart that I'm doing something, whether that something is beneficial or damaging to me. I feel like it's been five minutes now, I should stop writing. I feel like everything I just said doesn't make sense. I'm here for vibes, thats why. Maybe. I don't know.

Im loving astronomy so far, I just find everything about anything outside of our planet interesting and also learning how big these planets are. Ive always found anything in space fascinating since I was in middle school, seeing my first Solar Eclipse. I just hope I can learn more about it in class for a later assignment. Another thing I love to do in this class is is going to the observatory. For me, I didnt realize how cool it wouldve been because it isnt the real thing. Although it isnt, it is still cool to have seen all of the stars, and constellations in a smaller model anyways. I would love to learn more about the stars and why it does spin around the North Star, or any other lesson about space I don't even know about yet. I also didn't realize how much effect perspective has to show us how big or little a huge object has as well.

Why am I here? Im here because the sky brings me a sense of piece since it reminds me how little my worries really are compared to the universe. So I am here so I can learn more about the Universe, the night sky and everything in between because I was told once its cool to know the name of thing and background then just saying oh I like the stars I want to be able to point something in the sky and explain what it is to who ever Im with as I enjoy sharing what I know to others. But I am also here explore in majors as I came into college as undeclared so I really want to be able to take up the opportunity iv been given with education.

Its funny, I've answered this one a few times. Im here because I think i need to be. Way too many things happened that were completely out of my hands that landed me here, at this school, in this classroom, and right now I have to just suck it up and deal with it. Im here because it is necessary by some other entities standards, and we go with the flow. Im here because I love the bounce theory more than anything else, and because every time i close my eyes the beginning of everything comes into view. Im here because I'm rebuilding myself after living through hell, and im determined not to break. Im here to play the game, to finally come alive, to show what the hell im made of. Im here to learn, to grow, to heal. Im here because i cry in planetariums and spend most nights looking up at the sky. Im here because i am afraid, and im tired, and im stressed, but im safe, and I can grow here. Im here because its a required class, but this is the only lab I actually like. Im here because I loved too much and tried to believe in the best in people. Im here because i need to get my crap done, and force my way back to where i need to be.

The reason that I wanted to take this class in college is because when I was younger, I was really interested in sciences relating to our universe. I think studying the universe is very helpful towards being a wiser human being because it allows us to have a bigger perspective on how important it is to keep our world safe and clean. I think learning about different sciences can help expand our brains to new limits. My grandfather was a rocket scientist who worked for JPL, and he told me about his achievements, such as helping the rover land on mars, which motivated me to want to learn about space when I was older. I read books regarding space often and the interesting facts are limitless and wonderful. Space is beautiful, and I am very grateful for the privilege of taking this course, and I am confident that I will meet wonderful people in this class who feel the same way.

I am here because I want to open new doors for my family. I am here because I want to be the first person in my family to graduate from college. I am here because my family wants what is best for me and told me never settle for less. I am here because I want my grandpas name on a degree(AKA my name). I am here to build new connections because it's not what you know it's who you know. I am also here to receive a degree and use it towards something that will protect my well being. I also just want to make my parents proud and do what they couldn't. It's always been my dream to make my parents proud and be better than them not cause I want to cause they want me to. So many times I wanted to give up but i'm still here so it's Gods plan.

Why am I here? Thats a big question, and honestly, I dont know if I have a perfect answer. Maybe Im here because Im trying to figure things out who I am, what I want, where Im going. Maybe Im here because I have dreams, even if theyre not completely clear yet, and I know that every step I take gets me closer to something meaningful. Im here because I believe in growth. Because I know that even the tough moments, the confusion, and the setbacks are all part of something bigger. Im here because I want to learn, to challenge myself, to become better, not just for me, but for the people around me. And maybe Im here simply because Im supposed to be. Because this is where I need to be right now, even if I dont fully understand why yet. And thats okay. Life isnt about having everything figured out, its about showing up, being present, and trusting that one day, all the pieces will make sense.

Why am I here? I am here because I need a science lab for my GE requirements. When I first saw Astronomy on the list of science classes I wanted to take something stood out to me. I read the class description, and it is an interesting class to attend. Once I joined the class my cousin told me it was too hard. They put in my head that I'd have to do a lot of math and physics which scared me just a bit. they told me to switch my class to a biology class because it would be easier and faster with less math. When school started I went straight to the metro to help change my class from Astro to Bio, but once I got to the metro we looked into the enrollment center to apply for a bio lecture and the laboratory wasnt available. I decided to take the Astro because I had both the lab and a lecture which is most convenient for me and my GE requirement. I then thought to myself and decided on and I went to the class and I'm starting to like the class.

When life gets hard, I try to remind myself that everything is temporary. No matter how tough things feel in the moment, I know that Ive gotten through difficult times before, and I will again. Sometimes, I just need to take a breakwhether its listening to music, going for a walk, or just sitting alone to clear my mind. It helps me reset and figure out my next step. I also try to focus on what I can control instead of stressing over things I cant change. Talking to someone I trust, like a friend or family member, makes a big difference too because I know I dont have to deal with everything alone. When I feel overwhelmed, I remind myself why Im doing what Im doingmy goals, my dreams, and the people who support me. Challenges arent easy, but I try to see them as chances to grow. Even when it doesnt feel like it, I know that every struggle is making me stronger

Whenever life gets challenging, I would go ahead and take a walk or do productive things such as cleaning my room or washing the dishes. This allows me to reset my mind and clearly understand what I need to do before moving on in life. Whenever I am stressed, I cannot concentrate on anything, so I implement these strategies to improve my performance. I would also distract myself by watching movies for escapism. Even though it is not productive, I can clear my mind and escape a little bit before returning to work. Lastly, scheduling would help me have a straightforward line of knowing what to do before ending my day. This allows me to understand what priorities I need to do before doing any other activities. I would get distracted easily such as doing activities that I like to do, so I have a plan such as doing my homework or studying before moving forward.

When life gets challenging I usually just wing it, yes I stress about it but theres not much I can do from it. When it's about classes I just try to get assignments in when I can or when it's about financial stuff I ask my family for help but it stresses me out because even though I am trying to look for a new job, someone else gets picked for the positions or I'm not qualified enough. When I'm stressed I just lay down, I was tiktoks to drain me and take a nap or snack on food to be distracted, It might not be the healthiest way to deal with something but it usually helps me to calm down and I take it slow. Especially with homework, I sometimes forget about it because most stuff is on modules and not on the canvas calendar for most of my classes, but I try to keep up.

I will leave some times until I will calm down. I feel if something happen I usually get panic and I dont know what I have to do. However, I need somebody to hangout because I will think too much. I think it is important to accept my emotions and situations honestly, do not try to be positive, and take care of myself. Sometimes, taking a step back and taking a rest, or having someone who I trust listen to me makes my heart lighter. In addition, when I am facing a difficult situation, I may be able to move forward little by little by dividing the problems into small pieces and solving them one by one. It is important to move forward at my own pace without being in a hurry. I might ask somebody to get advice too.

When life gets challenging I like to focus on things that I find fulfilling like school work or things that make me happy like going outside or reading a book. I have found that having a "dopamine menu" in my head for things that make me happy is really important within taking care of my mental health. Taking care of my physical health I have found is also really important for me because it coincides with my mental health. I have also found that things like going on walks or journaling help me organize my thoughts especially when things get hard and stressful. I have found that actually taking time within my day to practice taking care of my mental health is really important especially when things get challenging. Especially practicing gratitude and staying present with myself, I have found that it is really helpful within getting myself through challenging time.

When life gets challenging something that I do is just face it head on. Throughout my life I have been hit with a lot of challenges like most do. But the thing I would always do was just run away from them and not face them for what they are or were. Lately I have been facing a lot of challenges in my personal life and because of that my life has just been a mess. The only difference from what I would do in the past and what I have been doing is just facing the problem for what it is. The only problem with that is because I have been so hyper focused on the problem I have been neglecting everything else in my life. So now I'm trying my best to feel my feelings when it comes to what I've been going through, get back on track in school, and continue to support my family through all of this. I know it sounds like a lot but thankfully I have such an amazing support team that has been helping me out throughout all of this. But all of this goes to show that even when you think you have found a solution to a problem or on how you handle your problems there is always room for improvement.

When life gets challenging I normally like to take a step back and treat myself to self care. For me self care is either going therapy shopping, treating myself to my favorite foods or treats, doing at home facials, taking my puppy on a walk, going to Pilates etc. but as Im doing my favorite things I also like to think about what is challenging my life and how I could make it easier on myself. This normally always helps because when I treat myself to self care it normally takes the whole day so I get that whole time to think things over by myself. It always works for me because it feels like Im taking three steps back while also taking three steps forward if that makes sense.

When things get challenging, I usually remind myself that there hasn't been a time where I haven't gotten out of it successful. I have always been a hard worker in my life, especially as a student athlete in college. It has taught me to get through challenging times in life, academics, sports, or whatever it could be. If I weren't able to get out of a challenge, I would not be where I am at today. When times do get hard and you feel hopeless, I look back. I look back to where I was a couple of years ago, definitely not as far in life as I am now. Comparison can be good when it comes to motivation. I think that is the best inspiration to keep you going. Life is full of challenges, without it, it would be boring. Love the challenge and remember you can always succeed.

When life gets challenging, I find it most helpful to journal. It helps me focus on what is within my control, and helps me to sort out my own emotions. I often feel out of control and it is difficult for me to move forward while in this headspace. I can find myself freezing or spiraling when overwhelmed, and journaling forces me to slow down and focus on what is going on in my body. I have also been trying to nurture my relationship with myself lately. I am trying to learn how to treat myself with respect and kindness, and that means seeing myself as human instead of being so hard on myself for mistakes. I take myself out to get flowers on the weekends to bring more life to my apartment, and further, my life. Taking walks both during night and day helps me when I feel overwhelmed because I focus on my surroundings, and it gives me time for a short break before returning to the tasks I have to do.

When life gets challenging, I have noticed that I tend to not try to pay attention to it. I sort of close myself off from trying to fix or better the situation. Even though I know that it is not great to do that, I still do it. Recently I have tried making sure that I don't shut myself off from people, especially when I know that they are just trying to help. I try to just make light of the situation. I don't get frustrated at myself, especially when the situation is out of my control. I also just like going to my mom and dad when things get hard because they always somehow say the right thing or have good advice that makes me feel better about the situation. I also like to go to my sister because she's older than me so I know she may have been through some of the struggles that I face from time to time.

As a student athlete, life gets challenging a lot, and what really sucks is that you don't really get to time to sit down and relax. The most important thing for me to do is to honestly prevent any outburst which do happen. Such as getting mad easier, feeling like brain is always running. Some of the most important things I do are play my saxophone, which helps relive any stress that I have at the time. It's basically like yelling into the instrument but instead, nice sounds come out. Another thing I do is watch movies or Youtube. I find that this takes my mind away from thinking to much and get to sit back and relax a little. One thing that I found that helps a lot, is being around or at least talking to the people that care about you the most. I find that when I'm really stressed I like to call my mom, dad, or sister and just talk about life and what they've been up to. And sometimes they even give me that reassurance I need to here. Lucky for me I have my girlfriend here who really helps keep my stress down as she knows most things going on in my life and is there whenever I need her.

When life gets challenging for me, when actually it is challenging for me right now, I turn to my family and try to spend time talking to my family and trying to do things that I particularly enjoy like self care . I also pray and turn to god. I. Not as consistent as I should be but I am trying to do better with praying every single day. I love bi be watching tv shows so Ill do that and read as well . My main thing g is basically trying to keep my mind distracted.

When life gets challenging, I often feel a rush of frustration and confusion. My first instinct is to want to control everything, to find an immediate solution. I sometimes get overwhelmed, thinking I need to fix everything right away. But when things get really tough, I know deep down that I have to step back and breathe. I remind myself that it's okay to not have all the answers. Sometimes, I just sit with the discomfort and give myself permission to feel whatever is coming up without judgment. When I face challenges, I find comfort in small routinesdrinking coffee, going for a walk, or calling a friend. These moments help me reconnect with myself and ground me in the present. I also lean into the support around me. Im lucky to have people who listen, offer advice, or simply sit in silence with me. Ultimately, I try to find meaning in the struggle. Its through hardship that I learn, grow, and reconnect to what truly matters. Lifes challenges are a reminder to be present, to trust the process, and to keep moving forward even when the path feels unclear.

When life gets challenging, I let myself be upset, but I always keep going. Growing up, my Grandmother always told me two Japanese sayings that she learned from her parents. Ganbatte, and Gaman. Ganbatte means to keep going, while Gaman represents endurance. These sayings have stuck with me throughout my life, and have encouraged me to persevere.

When life gets challenging, one constant I always have is music. Im almost always listening to music, at least when my ears arent occupied by other things. That tends to calm me down, I also look to my other hobbies. I play guitar and Ive picked up photography relatively recently so those help calm me down. I also just kinda think about whatever it is thats troubling me and if I think about it enough I usually think of some sort of way to minimize or worry less about the trouble, even if I know Im a little bit delusional. If my grades arent what I want them to be, I might think about how with a few assignments it could come up, things like that. Most importantly though, if its something that troubles me and makes me very nervous, I remind myself that Ill live another day and whatever is on my mind will eventually resolve, whether in days, weeks, months, or years, eventually itll be alright. It also helps to talk to friends for advice or just to share what Im thinking, thats one of the most helpful things, it helps me realize that Im not the only one being troubled and I know I have someone rooting for me.

Life recently has gotten challenging. I slipped up, missed a couple of classes, now with dirt under my nails from the last time, I have to crawl out of a hole I dug. I don't know what I do when life gets challenging. I just move. I keep walking. I take whatever is in my way to the chin, and keep living. I think it worked for the first 17 years of my life, but i'm an adult now. I don't know, i'll figure it out. Maybe i'll skip town and let life get challenging in another area. Just kidding. I'll just do my missing assignments so life isn't challenging anymore. Life has been challenging constantly in different ways, i'll survive.

If something gets hard I either try to find another person to get support or and suggestion. I do this so I can have another perspective of the kind of challenge I facing where it is something probably obvious but I just cant see it. But if I cant do that, then I just take a step back and recall what I am doing, and see if theres another route I can take to tackle the challenge. This helps to just take a breath and see if I misread a question or reading it again fires up my neurons and I figure out the solution to the problem. On top of that I want to finish my work and do a good job with it. Challenges are rough and maybe there are more strategies I could use that I dont know about yet, but so far this has been going well for me since high-school. Ill try to be more flexible for college though and see if I can make more improvements against my challenges.

When life gets hard, I usually end up calling my parents. I dont even always talk about whats going on with me, but hearing their voices somehow makes everything feel a little lighter. Its like theyre a piece of home, and just hearing about whats happening when Im not there helps me escape my own reality for a second. Its nice to think about their stories, even if its just about random things, like what the dog did or what my siblings are up to. Its like, for a little while, I can step away from my own head and feel like things are normal again. Its not always about talking through my problems, more like just being reminded that theres love and support waiting for me, even when I feel lost. The comfort of those small conversations helps me breathe and refocus. Its a weird kind of peace, knowing that life keeps going on even when it feels like mine is stuck. They dont have to fix anything, but they remind me I dont have to do this alone.

What do I do when life gets challenging? When life begins to get hard, I will always take the time to turn to god and breathe, because I believe he will always be by my side in the times I need him most and even least and having this mindset is what gets me through all the challenging times because I really do put all my trust in the God as I also tend to believe everything we go through and make it out even if were hurt a bit it was a lesson to help your full potential self. Another thing I do is just get lost in my thoughts, but in a way, I lay out everything I'm thinking of and try to figure out what is going on overall. I always try to help myself before asking for help.

My life has never not been challenging. I keep getting thrown curve balls and Im sick of it frankly, but it has made me stronger. When life gets challenging, I buckle down. And by buckle down I mean buckle down. First I get focused and serious instantly and cut off any and all distractions until im through. I wont allow myself to panic or freak out until I have a handle on whats going on because otherwise that panic might make me fail. The second thing i do is analyze the situation and see what exactly im dealing with. Then I examine all my options. possible solutions, and pick the route that has the best likelyhood to give the outcome I want. Then I create a backup plan, and begin working. I have been through more than enough to handle basically any challenge given to me and I do not back down.

When things get tough what I do is get through it and face it. Although I may want to steer away from it running from it will not save me see it through. It may get ugly but there are things you can do to make you feel better. Such as finding a hobby that can support you and regenerate energy to keep going. Or talking to people that you are comfortable with because sometimes you just need to let things out and you may not know if people are willing to listen. People are it builds connections and bonds that will only grow stronger. But something I do is listen to music because I feel that the music speaks to me and have me more laid back and something about my favorite artists sits with me. I also play the game nothing in this world has been more reliable then my game its just something you can turn to sunny, rainy, hot, cold its always going to be there. It also can be a way to talk to your friends and have fun together.

When life gets challenging, I try to slow down and remind myself to breathe. Everything feels heavier when I am rushing through it, so just pausing helps. I ask myself what I can actually control in the moment and I try to focus only on that. Sometimes it is as simple as getting out of bed, taking a shower, or texting someone I trust. I have learned that reaching out, even when it is hard, makes a difference. I also remind myself that every tough moment I have survived has passed eventually, even if it did not feel like it would at the time. That gives me some hope. I try to write, even if it is messy. Writing helps me put the storm in my head into words I can see and work through. I do not always know my full purpose, but I do know I am still here and that must mean something. Maybe part of my purpose is to keep going even when it is hard and to grow stronger from the struggle. I think challenges shape who we become and maybe someday what I learn now will help someone else. That gives me a reason to keep pushing forward.

My family taught me to work hard and never give up, no matter how hard life gets. Thats something I carry with me every day in college. My parents didnt have an easy life, especially after coming to the U.S., but they always pushed through and did whatever they could for our family. Seeing that growing up made me feel like I have no excuse to quit, even when things get hard. Another thing I learned from my community is to always stay connected to who I am. Even though English isnt my first language and sometimes I feel out of place, I remind myself that my background is part of my strength. My culture, my faith, and the way we support each otherit all helps me stay grounded. These values remind me why Im in college in the first place. Im not just doing it for myself, but for my family and everyone who believes in me. That keeps me going

I have values within my family whenever I go through college because I am here to progress in life and find opportunities, such as networking or communicating with others to get a promising career. My parents support me through college, such as paying my housing and tuition, which is why I am dedicating my time here. My values are to connect with others, ensuring that my parents are satisfied with my career ladder. I am finding ways to improve myself, such as getting a job and attending courses that would improve some aspects of my life. Within my community, I must work hard and be sure I have navigated through life before getting a full-time job. I already have a part-time job, but I am making sure to use the skills I learned from the job to climb the ladder and find a full-time job that will fulfill my dreams and values.

Values are important to me, especially in how my family may see me. Their comments or concerns help me continue my journey in college, but lately, it's been a hassle, I feel stressed, sad, empty, not homesick, but as if I'm slowly feeling like I can't continue school. I'm trying to catch up with classes, I'm trying to get up in the morning and to study, but it's an off-and-on thing like if I'm already drained from trying. I try to think about my family and friends to have them understand where I'm coming from and not judge me, but I still feel it even if it's not expressed to me, I try to think of my community and how there are people out there who wish to be in my position and be in school, I use that as a way to remind me I can't give up right now.

I usually share everything what I did a school to my family. When I have a to struggle something I ask to my family what I have to do. When I feel happy I always tell to my family at first. Even they cannot give me a good advice, if they can listen my talking, it is enough for me.

My dad worked really hard in order to set the rest of my family up for success he did this though education. He always taught me to work hard in school. I have realized how privileged I am to be in the financial spot of being able to go to school easily without any financial trouble. I think receiving an education should be a right but today it is a privilege.

When it comes to the values that I have picked up from my family that have really helped me navigate life in college I would be asking for help when I need it. My mom always told me as a child that there is always help out there you just have to ask for it because if you don't ask for it no one will know that you need help. This has been something that I have struggled to do in the past because let's be honest no one really likes asking for help because no one wants to be the only one lost when everyone else around you seems to have everything figured out. But Something that I learned is that everyone needs help and not everyone has everything figured out even though it seems like they do.With all that said I will always hold on to that pieces of advice that mom gave me because there will always be a point in time where we are going to need help and we need to be comfortable with asking for it.

The values in my community and family have been a big impact on my journey through college. My family tends to value loyalty, confidence, and support. With their loyalty I always know if I run into a problem financially or mentally I know I can fall back on them and they well help left me up without hesitation. With confidence, they always upheld this mindset that doesnt make me second think if Im doing the right things in life, they always tell me that I got this or that  your doing amazing and many more they boost my confidence which makes me feel confident in the world of college. And I wouldnt even know where to begin with their support. My family never made it a must for me to go to college, if I told them I wanted to do a training, they would respond great we will help because at the end of day its what you want to do and what makes you happy. You can only imagine how excited and happy they were to have decided to go to a four year university. They made it clear for me to know that if I wanted to go to a university I didnt need to work, they would take care of my financial side of college, they want me to enjoy college and put in my all. The way I navigate through college has been wonderful as a first gen because of my family.

The value of my family has taught me that you don't just get things handed to you, you work hard for it. On top of that I have also learned that we are the saviors of our generation. Our family history has never been the brightest, more so on the darker side. Us children have the opportunity to end that. My brother and I talk about it all of the time. Now is the time to change the way or more so the "Garza Curse". This has given me the drive to be successful and navigate through college. In the end I'm not only doing it for me, I'm doing it for the past and future generations of the Garza bloodline. So far things have been handed beautifully to me with my hard work, the drive will always be there though. So, when I think of what drives me through college, it is the opportunity to save.

When thinking about the values that I have learned from my family, I am grateful to know that they help me throughout my college experience. Not only do they help navigate me through these four years of my life, but rather my entire life moving forward. My Dad is a very logistical person and shows little to no emotional attachment to most situations. He is a very solution-oriented person, which has ultimately influenced me. Learning these logical standpoints has helped me through many different endeavors that have been stressful to me. On the other hand, my Mom is very emotionally intelligent and moves about her life thinking much of her heart. Learning how to deal with my emotions and energy has greatly helped me with meeting new people and experiencing new relationships in my life (both platonic and romantic). I can confidently say that given these two individuals as my parents, I am able to shed a logical light, along with an emotional light, on my life.

I have come from a community that prioritizes education and this has motivated me to go to college in the first place. Being raised primarily by my sister, I share similar values with her both in education and life. However, others in my family have different values, one of which is assimilation. In this aspect, I am different because I have a larger sense of justice that presents itself in advocating for myself. This has impacted the way I navigate through college through my decision to to pursue a case against the person who has assaulted me. In pursuing this case, both my mental health and academic wellbeing has been compromised. However, I am proud of myself for being able to advocate for myself in such an important way. Another value I have that has been influenced by my sister is persistence. Despite facing adversity in my college career and personal life, continuing to move forward is vital to being able to pursue happiness in my overall life.

I think that growing up in a place like the Mission really taught me a lot about hard work and not giving up. My parents worked really hard to give me a better life, and that is one of the things that really keeps me motivated in college. When things tend to get stressful, I always try to remind myself that Im here for a reason, not just for me, but for them too. Ive seen people push through challenging situations, and that reminds me that I can do the same. In college, when things get hard, which they do, I just think about my family and community. And how they persist even when things get hard. Their strength reminds me that I can do the same. It pushes me to work harder and stay focused on my goals. I know that every challenge I overcome brings me one step closer to success.

I think the biggest value that I have in my family that has really helped me navigate my. Way through college is support. I know that every single one of my family members, blood related or not, support me in anyways they can wether its, money or simply just calling to make sure Im holding up ok. I get phone calls everyday from friends asking how college has been. My mom and dad also support me tremendously as the they help pay for my college tuition and housing. Without them, I have no idea where I would be financially wise.

My Family has been a huge support system for me throughout college, not only have they financially supported me tremendously but they also have been there emotionally. With uplifting words and helping me stay on track a huge part of why Im graduating is because of my family. When it comes to college track my family , specifically my mom and brothers , have been supportive and cheering in the bleachers at mostly every track meet I competed at even when; I lost a race. When I had serious injuries, even when the ones that required surgery they were there helping me through it the whole time. I come from a huge close knit family and they instilled the values of compassion , working hard and faith within me along with many other values. My family today is now helping me through graduate school applications and helping me stay positive. I genuinely wouldnt be where or who I am without my family.

Growing up, my family always emphasized resilience and hard work. They taught me that challenges are a part of life, but perseverance is what sets people apart. That mindset has been my anchor throughout college. There have been moments when I felt overwhelmed when assignments piled up, when I doubted my abilities, or when I struggled to balance school and personal life. But I always hear my parents' voices reminding me that nothing worth having comes easy. Beyond resilience, my community has instilled in me the value of support. Whether its family members checking in on me, friends offering encouragement, or even professors who genuinely want to see me succeed, Ive learned that I dont have to go through this journey alone. In my culture, we believe in lifting each other, and that has helped me seek help when I need it instead of struggling in silence College is tough, but the values I was raised withperseverance, community, and gratitudehave helped me stay grounded. No matter how difficult things get, I know I have the strength to push forward and the support of those who believe in me. And for that, Im grateful

My moms side of the family has always placed college as an expectation, not an option, while my Dads side of the family has a more open perspective and views upper education as an option. When I attended community college after high school, I really struggled. Due to its stigma, I felt like I was disappointing my Mom and her side of the family, while simultaneously surprising my Dads side of the family by making the decision to continue my education. My family members opinions led me to feel very confused as to if I was doing good enough in life, and I struggled to realize that I was exactly where I was meant to be.

I was never raised explicitly with a set of values, I wasnt told there was something I had to follow, instead I had to learn them and follow them. I think the most important value Ive learned is general kindness, my mom and family always taught me that but I was also a really grumpy little kid so growing out of that and learning to be kind with the help of those around me helped a lot. Especially as I got older and I could think some semi-deep thoughts I realized that theres not much of a point to be judgemental or unkind. I also come from a smallish city with ~175,000 people but weve had some community wide challenges and tragedies, especially in regards to schools. It was valuable to be apart of a community where I knew there was support and like minded people, especially in a small city where I knew people werent inaccesible to me. That helped form an appreciation for community and solidarity.

It left me undoubtably ill-prepared. There isn't much to say besides that, and i'm not sure if there's enough to say for it to hit 150 words. I haven't really been part of a community at any point in my life for more than three or four years, which is also a bad habit I developed young of just leaving things when I felt, even for a second that I wasn't needed anymore. I've hung out, for most my life with a family who wants me to think five steps ahead in my future, and a community that doesn't acknowledge anything but the present. It's clashed in me, and I think thats why I worry about everything and speculate on so much of my future, but refuse to touch the break or gas in order to go anywhere. I try to apply the things i've learned in my life from people I love to college, to my success, maybe I just love people who never got that chance themselves, and are trying to do their best to guide me, when no hand was on their back to guide them.

They helped me a lot through my journey. They firstly did help me get an education from schools throughout my life, and I have learned a lot on the journey till now. They have helped me financially to pay for me to go to college, and I cant thank them enough for that. SFSU is a school I thought of going too since I was a lot younger when my older cousin went here, and to finally be here feels great. They also given me a place to live so I can eat, sleep, and study, and that really helps get a lot of the pressure off of me. Also with moral support of helping me through work I go through, and understanding whenever I can't go anywhere due to the work I need to finish for college. I just feel very thankful for my family being this supportive of me going through my college semester.

The values of tradition and faith that my family and community have instilled in me have been a steady guide through college. Growing up, I learned to value our traditions, from family gatherings to the stories passed down through generations. These traditions help me stay connected to my roots and remind me of who I am. Faith in God has also been a constant source of strength. Whenever I face challenges, my belief in a higher purpose gives me comfort. Prayer allows me to find peace and clarity, helping me navigate difficult moments with trust and patience. Together, these values have shaped how I approach my college experience. They remind me to stay grounded, to trust in the process, and that I am never truly alone. Whether through tradition or faith, Ive found strength and guidance in my journey, helping me stay focused and connected to my deeper purpose.

How have the values of my community and family helped me navigate through college? I feel as they have helped me in tremendous ways mentally but also physically, mentally I know I have the support from my family as well as my community that give me motivation to seek what makes me the happiest but this mentality hasnt always been the way as before getting into college I was more scared of not being enough to be like the rest to go to college and make my family disappointed but my senior year that changed as I got closer to my family and community which they helped me realize they only want to help me and when they see me happy is when theyre really happy which knowing that really pushed me to just explore and get out there and try things that I never have before because that makes me happy and its helping find a sense of self which I feel is bringing me closer to find what I really love to do. These values have helped me stay authentic to myself as I know I have the support from my village at home that will help me to achieve my dreams and make sure Im healthy and strong.

The main community value around me is that I get an education. It's been drilled in me that education is a source of freedom and I have experienced it first hand, which is why I am devoting myself entirely to my studies. One other community value that has massively helped me navigate is one that my favorite track coach instilled in me: stay light on your feet. While he mostly meant it for the 100m, its something I carry with me in my actions every day. I am always prepared to take or dodge a blow of any sort and do not let any challenge take me down. I think the number one value i have is from the kid i consider my little sister. She reminds me that I need to suck it up and deal with everything, but also that there is light in everything. She reminds me that not everyone is out to get me, that there are good people in the world. Most of all, I need to make the world better for her, so she never has to deal with what I did. She reminds me that there is a future, but i have to fight for it.

The values of my family help navigate through college because my family made a lot of sacrifices. Values that I seen were hard working. Seeing that made me think why would I give up on things that are hard when they went through hell to get me where I am today I owe them everything so I want to go school and finish and do it with all my heart, might, mind, and strength. Sometimes I seen my parents stress but look at them still here up and running so when I go through some Iant letting up. Also that they are paying for me to be here it ain't cheap so time is money and I have to make the most of it just like them my mom is an immigrant and still made a living I have to be the best that I can for them so I can open up doors like them.

The values of my family and community have been a huge anchor for me throughout college. My family, especially, has always taught me the importance of persistence. No matter how tough things get, you keep going. That lesson has been key in staying focused when college feels overwhelming or when I want to quit. The belief theyve instilled in me that hard work pays off helps me push through long study nights and challenging assignments, even when Im doubting myself. Theres also the sense of community I carry with me, knowing that my success is part of a bigger picture. My familys support has always been unconditional, reminding me that Im not alone in this journey. Their sacrifices and encouragement push me to do my best, not just for me, but for them too. The sense of responsibility and gratitude I feel for what theyve given me makes every challenge feel a little more manageable. Ultimately, these values remind me that college is more than just grades. Its about growth, resilience, and honoring the support that has gotten me this far.

My mother went to school at SFSU. This is such a big privilege because the woman who gave birth to me understands my struggles, which helps me communicate with my mother about my college experience. If I need help in a class, she will help me navigate to find tutoring or help. As well as having friends and family helps me navigate the school. I feel their support makes me think I deserve support for college.

I am taking this course for a few reasons. I have taken many different sciences courses throughout my academic career, but I have never had the opportunity to engage in Astronomy. With that being said, I made the decision to satisfy my science requirements, while learning about something I have always found interesting. I have always been fascinated with the sky and I admire its beauty often. From a bright full moon to the different shapes of clouds, everyday I take a moment to observe and absorb the wonder of what is up there in the sky. I often wondered as a kid what is stopping the moon from crashing down into earth, or when will the moon decide to stop being suspended in the sky. Besides just a scientific answer that can explain this question it is always something that made me wonder. I believe this class will demystify some aspects of the sky.

I am here because I am determined to succeed. I am the first person in my family to attend college and hopefully obtain a degree in accounting. I want to be an example to those around me who doubt attending college. I want them to know that although it's a struggle it can be done with determination. I did not have my parents or anyone else in my family support me through school. I had to plan my life around it. I had to find jobs that would be flexible to accommodate my school schedule and wouldn't mind giving me the necessary time off for school. I also had to stop going out with friends on the weekends, but I know that it will be worth it in the end. It is a sacrifice but it can be done. I am very excited to be the first to make it through college and on my own.

I decided to take this class for a couple of different reasons, first im an astrophysics major, and its always been my dream to work with space and be an astronomer or something of the sort. I also wanted to take this class because im taking 115 as well and wanted the hands on work with this class. I hope to learn a lot from this class, ill be trying to absorb it all like a sponge. Ive always loved looking at the constellations and trying to see which ones i remembered and could find. Im hoping to get my masters and maybe even my Phd in my pursuit for more information and things to learn about space.

I think I am here to experience. Sometimes I fear over analyzing a lot of situations I am in, however I am beginning to understand that there are so many reasons for so many things. So many places with so much rich history, and plenty of different types of people. Because of this, I started to question myself. Part of the reason is because I was finding myself in pretty unique situations, not necessarily bad, but it was always a question of how? But the more I began to explore, I understood I cant always have an understanding until I experience it. Whether it was talking to people, or visiting places, the art of experiencing is slowly overtaking the perspective of over analyzing. I find my purpose here is to just experience, even in situations I find myself super uncomfortable. I think that is also why I choose to stick to what makes me comfortable. But that is a process I am still trying to overcome.

I'm in San Fransisco right now because I felt like I needed to come back. I was born here but moved to Arizona when I was a toddler. Ever since I was a kid I wanted to study fashion. I learned how to draw and started reading fashion magazines in my free time. When I hit high school, I was even more certain that this was what I wanted to do with my life. But I also understood that my chances of making it big in the Phoenix suburbs were microscopic. That pretty much eliminated ASU from the running of potential colleges, but I still applied as a plan B. I decided to apply to one school in Northern and one in Southern California. I got into both, toured both, and ultimately decided to go here. It just felt right if that makes any sense. And I think I made the right decision. My first year here was rough, I was constantly homesick and missing my family. I still get days like that now, but San Fransico has started to feel like home to me.

This isnt my first time hearing this question, yet Im still stumped on it. I can never seem to put together an answer that satisfies me. The generic thing to say, I feel, is to leave my mark on the world or do my part to make the world a better place. Im not a big fan of those answers, they feel too cliche sounding or the way they are presented dont seem genuine. Im not sure if Im making sense thus far. I feel like I sound very negative and I hope you dont see me as a negative person now.

Why am I here? I dont know the specifics yet and I honestly dont know if I ever will, but theres small moments that make me believe the why isnt as important as the fact that I am. When I make a child laugh, scratch a dog in just the right place, or become someones shoulder to cry on, i feel a sense of purpose. Those moments the small and maybe almost meaningless moments to us can be such a big impact on others. Maybe you helped that child find humor when theyre anxious, you helped that dog with a feeling they cant communicate, you helped that person crying from feeling alone. We dont know our own impacts most of the time and we often times dont realize how good of an impact we truly have. I believe every person is good in the start of their life, people grow and can get lost in feelings of good or of evil or some weird middle ground. But were all here to help make a change. To be the reason behind an action, to help with the small motivations, to experience the one in a million chances. So no I dont know the specifics but I do know Im on this earth to love, to learn and to teach. I hope people believe that they are just as needed and that theyre here for a good reason. No 2 humans are the same so we are all needed and I hope to help people see that.

Why are we here? A question many people have asked many uncountable times. My personal answer to this question is vague. Because I feel the question itself is asking for a vague answer. The ability to answer this question will most likely never be found, but I (as well as many others in this school of thought) believe that life, and the reason we (as well as any species on this planet) exist to fulfill a certain purpose. Organisms are the planet's way of caring for itself, environments are carefully put together to care for its own ecosystem. Fish, algae, plankton, coral, all of these things work in a unison effort (though mostly involuntarily) to preserve their environment. To preserve the way their world operates. That is true for any form of bird, insect, marsupial, or mammal. Though I believe we are, among other creatures, existent only to care for our world, I believe the human consciousness has not only denied that purpose, but attempted to create new ones through art and music. Humanity has both destroyed its own purpose and created its own. Many could look at the rolling cities and monumental businesses as a horror of human ego, and you would be right, but you can also observe the wonders of the human mind that expresses the magnificence of consciousness as no other creature has done before (as we know of). My answer, in simple form, is that we as humans were put here for one purpose, as caretakers. But that we as humans, through our consciousness and desires for self expression have developed our own purpose.

I feel like I am here to help others and try to help get rid of the evil in this world, such as crime. I also feel that I am here as a companion to others. I'm here to be friendly and kind to people and lend a shoulder to those in need. Being a good friend is something that is very important to me, as well as just being a good person in general. I think being a good person is one of the best atributes someone could have. I also feel like I am here just to be myself. I belive that everyone has a purpose and that you don't need to be a certain thing to fulfill that purpose; being yourself is more than enough. As long as continue to be a good friend, be a kind person, and always be myself, then I think I will fulfill what I am here for

I chose astronomy because constellations and planets have always been an interest of mine. In high school I took mythology do I learned the stories behind the constellations and some of the planets. I want to be able to share my learnings from this class with the people in my life and be able to look into the sky identifying the different constellations and stars. I am excited to learn about all of these things and more, I am also excited to do the different labs and experiments in the class. I plan to go to the observatory soon as well and I believe I can connect more to it with the help of this lab and my lecture class. I enjoy going to the planetarium, picking out the different constellations and stars as I learn is an amazing experience for me. I believe it expands my knowledge and helps me to challenge myself to point out new stars and constellations I just learned.

I dont know if this is supposed to mean why am I here in general or specifically in this class but I am here in this class because I need to GE credits and a lot of my friends are taking astronomy this semester so it made sense to take it. I am actually pretty interested in astronomy but I dont think I would be taking this class if it wasnt for GE. Generally speaking I am at this school and this point in my life because I wanted to study film but couldnt get into to any of the really good film schools in LA so I am here at sfsu since it has a pretty good film program and so I can get enough credits to be able to transfer and then i am going to transfer to a better school down in LA. I want to try and get into UCLA or USC because they are both like the best film schools in California and are also in LA which is where I would want to work for film. I am also currently making short films right now to improve my craft and hopefully increase my chances of getting into these schools.

I enrolled in this astronomy lab to gain a greater understanding of our solar system and universe. I have always taken a liking to the stars in our sky and have naturally been curious as to what exists outside of earth. By enrolling in this class I am able to gain the knowledge I have always wanted to know as a young child. I am here to learn all that this class has to offer and more. I want to deep dive on the universe and figure out what is truly out there and how the planets differ from another. I have already applied knowledge we learned of the constellations with my friends and family. It's exciting to be able to take this course and be able to have hands on labs to expand our knowledge.

I am here, on Earth for no express purpose other than to live life and try to affect the world and the people I care about as positively as I can. If the question is why am I in Astronomy Lab 116, it's because I am interested in some sort of career in astronomy, and It's a required course for the higher division astronomy classes. I am sill undeclared in terms of my major, but I hope to change that! Probably after my first full year here at Sfsu is done :). I took Astronomy 115 last semester and I am excited to take the lab this semester! I have really enjoyed it so far, especially since we've been spending so much time in the planetarium.

Why I'm i here? The reason I'm here is the same with many other students its that i am here part of it because I'm interested in learning about outer space and how people in hundreds of years figured these planets or stars and how did they measure it and how did they get the exact measurements of the moon, sun other stars and what they did to figure it out also came here because my sister graduated with astrophysics degree from Sf state a year ago and took astronomy class as well and I'm just basically following her foot steps. I am excited to use the telescope as i always wanted to and kept wondering where it would be i wanna see the moon and the other cool planets using the telescope so far I am enjoying the class as we go to the Planetarium each week and learning about each constellations makes me interested more.

"Why am I here?" I ask myself this question almost every other day. To me, learning about astronomy runs deeper than class credits or learning about the moon and the earth and stars. To me, learning about astronomy is understanding why WE are here. Why are humans here and what's protecting us from the sky or the stars falling down from the sky. Understanding what the purpose is of having an orbiting system and what it means for every sentient or conscious being on earth or even beyond earth. I think my reason for choosing to be in astronomy is to grasp a better understanding of what we are as humans and to learn or understand how everything living thrives despite living in a vast universe that remains unknown. I wonder if the things that are in the environment from space has a direct impact on the beings in Earth.

I don't usually think too deep about my greater purpose in life or on the planet, but i know from the short time that i've been around that I want to do some form of good. Not the type of good that'll change the fate of history but the regular type of good that like being a good neighbor and friend. I think i'm around for the same reason everyone else is, to live until it inevitably ends. It might sound overly simple, but I think its the complete opposite, a lot of shit can happen in someone's life. Nevertheless, so far I can say that I'm here to do whatever interests me, its like minecraft, there really isn't a wrong way to play that game. At the moment, I can say that im here to learn and make art. I really like to make clothes, i'm not particularly good at it and I don't know i'll keep doing it forever, but for now im glad to know that I have a lot of life left to find out.

Why am I here? That question can be interpreted in many ways like being in San Francisco State or in Astronomy Lab. I'm here doing Astronomy because I wanna learn more about the sky, the stars, constellations, the moon, etc. So being in Astronomy is pretty cool because by the end of the semester I'll be able to identify stuff in the sky whenever I'm out with family or friends. And as for why I'm here in San Francisco State it's because I'm from LA and apart of me wanted to learn and become independent so coming here was something I debated on because its not far far but its also not close which has given me the freedom to learn to how to be my own person. Although there are times when I do feel homesick and wish I would've went to school closer to home but I like being here San Francisco and I wouldn't change why I am here.

There are many ways to answer the question, Why am I here? First, we need to consider the context of this question. Why am I in this class? Why am I at SFSU? Why am I here on Earth? Why am I here in this universe in this exact spot at this exact moment? The deeper we go, the more my mind spirals. Lets answer all of these questions. The reason why I'm in this class is because I needed to complete my GEs, so I picked this class which is convenient because I love astronomy. Ive loved NASA and all things space, and I want to learn more about it. I think this class is also fun so far which is great, and the planetarium is also really cool. Im at SFSU because I like San Francisco, the school color is purple and its far enough from home for me to be free, but close enough where I can see my family every weekend. Im here on Earth because I was born a human being, and humans live on Earth. I have no clue how to answer anything else. As much as I would love to know all the answers about the universe and how everything works, I would go crazy.

The main reason I am here is because this class covers a requirement for my GEs, however I chose specifically astronomy because although I don't have a lot of knowledge rewarding this field, I do have genuine interest in learning about it. Since I was a kid I have had a deep interest in the moon and its phases as well as constellations, more than anything with the stories that relate to each of the names, and why they got their names as well, however, while from what I've seen so far from the labs we have had the scientific side of of seems kind of hard, I am really interested in keep learning about why are certain phenomenons caused, and what are the outcomes or those phenomenons. After lab one I was a little bit intimidated because it was really hard for me to finish but after lab 2, I gained more confidence and Im exited for future labs.

I am here in this class because of a series of events leading me to going to this school. In high school, I was very uncertain of what I wanted to do with my future. I still am. I almost went to community college, partially because of having no idea what field I wanted to pursue, and adding to that, because I didn't want to go through all the trouble of college applications and finding the right school without feeling like I had a real reason to go to any particular school. I didn't know how to pick a school since it seemed I needed to have some idea of what I wanted to be justified in my choice, and I felt like I had none. Probably around a week before application deadlines, my friend told me that CSUs didn't have essays as part of their application process. I decided to apply to a few, just focusing on ones that were nearby because I didn't want to be too far from home. SFSU became my top choice because I've always liked the city. I'm in this class specifically because I thought astronomy would be fun to take. (Admittedly I was originally going to take a marine bio course instead, but it was full.)

Why am I here? Good question. Well like I said in class I recently saw the movie interstellar. I think it changed my perception on how I see things around me especially how insignificant we really all are. We exist on a spec in a galaxy with who knows how many other galaxies that are out there. But we exist here and now which is why I find this class interesting. Getting to figure little things about the moon phases is something I find interesting and learning along the way is also cool. And again the only reason I was inclined to take this class is solely because of a movie. Which I really liked and influenced my decision in classes here at sf state. I think I enjoy the time we have in class although were the last ones out at the end of the day. But hey we learn and we have a fun time right.

Im here, in Astronomy 116 for the credit, and I have genuine interest in the class because I think the stars and the sky are beautiful on surface and deeper level, math and everything science to me kinda hurts to do sometimes, but i'm here because I hope in understanding a bit more about both what I can see, and what I cant see, ill be able to appreciate the sky more. I also love learning constellations, I could never for the life of me actually see them but that's mainly because I could never track stars and find them the same place i saw them before. someone lied to me when i learned the north star is the "brightest" its a damn lie. Id spend hours when i was out of a city searching but id use my compass after id found it, and i was facing south. Anyway that's part of why im here to learn what's actually real about stars.

I have not always been my best when faced with certain challenges. It is a continual progression in how handle disappointments, failures, and challenges. When faced with challenges I would turn to different vices and give in to adversity. With the help of family, I have always been able to successfully persevere. In this current time, as I become older and wiser, Ive learned or at I try to take a deep breath and calm myself. I tend become overwhelmed and act impulsively. I have learned to observe the situation and not procrastinate. I have found that challenges become more difficult mentally, when one just sits and overthinks. I also most importantly have leaned on God. I discovered prayer and positive has helped me make it through challenging journeys. With the help of God, my family, and simply taking a deep breath and applying positive action, I have become better at facing adversity.

When life gets challenging, I like to focus on keeping myself as healthy as possible by going to the gym and eating nurturing foods. I can emotionally and mentally control my stress (although not always healthy) by remembering that I am in charge of the situation and controlling my reactions. However, stress tends to manifest physically for me. I can break out in hives, lose my appetite, have intense nausea, and migraines, as well as losing my focus. So, I must lower my stress by going to the gym and eating lots of fruits and veggies. I feel relieved knowing that I am helping my body overcome whatever emotional or mental challenge in my life. I also like listening to music and planning my week time, so I don't miss any activities. I have slots for each activity throughout the day, even meal prepping so I don't have to cook every day. It's tough to keep up with this routine but I do see a difference when I do.

When life gets challenging, what I do first is try to figure it out myself. I feel that its best for somethings to be planned or prepared for compared to others so it terms of something challenging I first challenge myself to figure it out myself. If that doesnt work I go to the people closest to me like friends and family. Especially my parents who help me a lot. When I have a work ethic and people to work or learn for I can have a focus on myself rather than putting it on others but everyone needs someone to depend on when in college and nineteen. In other ways, when life gets challenging like socially or with stress I try things to calm me down like being outside during the day and taking melatonin and magnesium at night for sleep. With routine I think comes great things and although Im not the best, when I am on routine it feels good so getting on routine is something I feels helps a lot.

When life gets challenging, I like to go outside by myself and get fresh air to decompress and collect my thoughts. I'm not used to talking about my feelings so being by myself allows me to separate myself from any negative feelings I am feeling about my current situation. Listening to music is also something I do when times get tough, or just all the time in general. Being in a state just listening to music brings me peace, almost feeling like I'm in a completely different world. Music can also change the vibe I am in if I don't like what I am feeling at the time. I also like to play video games when I am stressed. It reminds me of my childhood when I had nothing to worry about, when those times felt like forever. I think I play games for the nostalgic feeling I get when playing rather than the actual enjoyment I get out of it.

When life gets challenging the first thing I do is reach out to the people I care about. Even if it is just to talk for a few minutes, it can make a huge difference. Sometimes, it helps just to remember that there are people that care about you and want to see you happy. My mom is usually the first person I talk to when I need help or advice. She is so far away but she always manages to calm me down and help me think about my situation rationally instead of panicking, which is not productive. She tells me that I always have to remember to be kind to myself. When life gets difficult to manage, I need to keep taking care of myself by eating and drinking water, which can be hard to do when I get stressed. She tells me to do something nice for myself when I have the chance, like going out to eat or going shopping for a new purse. Just anything to take my mind off it.

When life gets hard, I attempt to distract myself. Usually, I'll grab my headphones and lay back in bed or go on a walk. This can be effective, though sometimes it is not. I find that listening to upbeat music works in distracting yourself the best, but my preferred choice of music is often slow and borderline sad music. This might cause one to further overthink or dwell on the things that may be making their life challenging but for me it feels good to listen to something that encapsulates what I'm feeling. I like to view it as a way of expressing my thoughts/emotions when I myself can't find the words to do so. This might also just be me trying to romanticize these moments and make them key moments for me to look back on, if that makes any sense.

what do i do when life gets challenging? i learn to adapt ,to change, to find a window after seeing the closed door. I find outlets to channel my confusion and anxiety. i learn to dance my way through it, gliding like a feather swaying with the winds of change. when life gets challenging i find those i can trust and lean on them. we help balance eachother out in our turbulent lives. when life gets challenging i look forward to the wisdom and peace ill have when life gets a little easier. when life gets challenging i force myself to stand, to keep moving forward.

I have a few tactics for when life gets difficult. As someone who goes through recurring bouts of emotional distress I have found the easiest way to regulate myself is to distract and to relax my mind and body. Though not the most productive way, and certainly an intrusive one if occuring on a busy day, it can help tremendously by simply allowing myself a calm space to collect my thoughts and incramentally shift back into a more productive state.

When life gets challenging, I call my mom. When I lived at home, I could always go to her room and talk to her, or even just lay on her bed while she was on work calls. It is just her presence in general that comforts me, although my mom and don't always get along, she is always here for me through anything; even if she's mad at me. Like yesterday, when I was having a particularly bad day, my mom is the one I called. Even if she has nothing to say to me, it always helps just to have her listen.

When life gets challenging, I focus on staying organized, seeking support, and maintaining a positive mindset. First, I break tasks into smaller steps and create a schedule to manage my workload effectively. This helps prevent feeling overwhelmed. Second, I contact friends, family, or professors for guidance and encouragement. Their support reminds me that Im not alone. Lastly, I prioritize self-care by getting enough rest, eating well, and taking breaks when needed. Exercise or even a short walk helps clear my mind. I also remind myself that challenges are growth opportunities. Staying persistent and adjusting my approach when necessary, I can push through difficulties and become stronger. No matter how tough things get, I focus on progress, not perfection. Setbacks are temporary, and with resilience and effort, I can overcome obstacles and keep moving forward.

I feel like throughout my life what I have done when things get challenging has changed. I don't specifically remember things from my childhood where I gave up on something challenging, but I definitely did. I think that I was a pretty motivated person to accomplish the things that I wanted even when they were hard, and I still feel like I am this way to this day. It's a lot easier to put all your effort into something when you really want it rather than doing something that bores you and giving up, and the latter is something that I am guilty of doing more often than not. Something that I have done recently is whenever something scares me, even if it's just a tiny bit, or if it's pretty important, I make sure I do it as soon as possible. I think thinking of something as I will do this instead of i might do this just makes your brain instantly realize that instead of trying to get out of something it figures out how it can make the best of it instead. Whether it be going first in a presentation that I'm nervous on to get it over with or having a difficult conversation with someone that you need to have. I think this practice has helped a lot in molding my brain to think differently about the things that I want to give up on or not do. Some of them may not be difficult tasks by design but getting myself to do them is and I've gotten a lot better at having that mental control of figuring out how to make the best of an anxiety inducing situation instead of just putting it off until it's out of control.

When life gets challenging I always discover more about myself than I knew prior. I learn how much stronger I am than initially thought. I experience growth as I enter the challenges of the real world. But that is all after said and done. During challenging times I always have to remind myself that it is for a reason. That struggle creates something beautiful and puts me or creates me into where or who I need to be. Often times during struggle I find myself more connected to spirituality and taking more actions to care for myself. I like to search inside myself and ask what this situation could teach me and what I can take away from it. Sometimes the answer is not obvious but with due time it always shows itself.

When life gets challenging, I find lots of comfort in my friends, boyfriend, family, and music. I also love to do art! I also often find nature walks and connecting to the roots of my mental health to be a refreshing mental experience when things get tough. The other main way I can keep myself stable as a neurodivergent person is to remind myself to just keep pushing!! I know that I'm smart, and that if I work hard enough, I can accomplish anything! When it comes to receiving support from friends and my partner, Verbal and physical affirmation helps massively! I also love the band Kero Kero Bonito, they always help cheer me up when I don't feel the best !!

What i do when life gets challenging i tend to try and take a lot of deep breaths or go out to the beach or some nature like park and just try to calm my self down and i always remind my self when things are challenging to never give up as there is so many people in the world who face same challenges. When it comes to school challenges i go out of my comfort zone to ask the teacher for help for clarification and when it comes to real life challenges i will keep reminding myself that at one point in life there is always dark moments and there is always high moments a good example of life is basically like a roller coaster so every time i face a challenge i try to overcome and be better version of my self i will go on adventures like hiking or going to the beach or swimming these 3 main things that will help me through and gives stress relief .

Id like to say that when life gets challenging for me I find my way out. I find resourced that helps my state of mind. But this is not the case for me. Unfortunately, when life gets challenging for me I don't speak my mind, I resort to unhealthy habits and let it consume me. I am hoping to change this but man, its very hard. I have this habit of entering full hermit mode3 when I'm struggling because i feel like i can do it all by myself and I dont need anyone else's help. Im trying to learn how to speak up more or just find healthier ways to ease my mind when im stressed but its hard to do certain things or to look on the bright side of how you'll feel after these things when you're feeling so low.

Each time I ever felt my life getting challenging, I always panic. It's the first thing I seem to always do. I'll quietly feel stressed out and sweat a little as I can't think of what I need to do. I'll do this for about 5 minutes or so before finally starting to calm down. I take a deep breathe, compose myself, and then I try to understand the situation. It's not the best to be panicking over a challenging situation but it's normal to do so. I always try my best to understand my situation so that I can overcome the challenge and obstacles so that I don't panic again. When I need to, I always go to ask for help from someone, either a family member or a friend or even a teacher. I don't give up just because it might seem too challenging. I keep trying and trying until I feel successful at it. Even if I'm wrong, I did still proud that I tried my best at least and I learn something from it.

When life gets challenging what I do is take the time to do stuff that I feel make me the calmest. Not gonna lie I stress so much when things aren't going the way they should be. I tend to start baking new sometimes old recipes because I feel when I bake I'm the calmest and for me its so therapeutic. Another thing I also tend to just start randomly start cleaning and reorganizing my room because I feel that if I do it will help me resolve my problems but that's just me thinking positive but I don't think it ever worked. I think being away from my family for college is harder than I thought it would be because I can't just go running to my parents for a much needed hug when I feel like my life is falling apart from everything going on in my life because college life can get very challenging but at the same time I don't wanna worry them. So now in the ends when life gets challenging with no care I'll literally just cry it out it and it honestly helped me.

I listen to music mostly. I try to surround myself with people who support me and make me happy. I feel grateful that my life wasn't as challenging as others. Being grateful for your life will help you feel like your problems aren't as big as you think. Usually when life gets challenging I tend to neglect my responsibilities and fall into bad habits. Sometimes I don't even know I'm practicing bad habits because it's hard to realize that you are in a bad space. I want to learn how to take better care of myself regardless of if I'm in a bad place or not. I don't really show people I'm going through something unless it's my closest friends and I'm directly telling them something is wrong. I rely on my family and friends for support when life gets challenging because they always uplift me and I know that they won't judge me. I always feel better when I'm around people I love so I try to stay close to them as much as possible.
