When life gets challenging I like to try my hardest. Although giving up on things is the easy way out, and I have taken it sometimes, I strive to keep going and trying. Without this mentality I would always give up and likely get no where near the goals I have set for myself. I would not have come to San Francisco, gone to college, or even graduated high school if I did not hold myself accountable during the moments I felt challenged throughout my life. I think its also important to consider though that with these challenges are going to come failures even if I try to push through. If Im challenged by a test and study really hard there is still not a 100% chance I will do perfect on it. Knowing this, I am able to work hard while also not being too let down when things still dont go the way I planned which I believe is a very important part in the process since it allows me to keep this mindset for future challenges I face.

When life gets challenging, I tend to shut down and isolate myself for a little bit. I don't like to put myself out there into the world or talk to anyone if I'm not feeling my best, so I cheer myself up as best as I can until I feel able to start talking to people again or do whatever I have to do. When it gets really challenging, or moreso stressful, I cry because it's good to let it out. Sometimes I write about my feelings in a journal as well to sort out my thoughts, tasks, and emotions. But even when I shut myself out, I always persevere. Even when it gets rough, I know I will come back and recover and be okay again. Even if I don't do my best or act the best I should've, I take it as a learning experience and be better for next time something similar arises. It works out if you see it through. It also may not be what you wanted but maybe what you needed.

When life gets challenging, i find ways to cope with the stress. Depending on the situation, if its something i can' control in life, i find things that take my mind off things like playing games or listening to music. Its its something in my control like an assignment, i try to formulate a schedule and time manageme what i need to do in order to lessen the crunch time at the due date. So far this semester academically hasn't been stressing me out but my personal life has turned for the worse. Ive been keeping a diary to vent out any frustrations, listening to music, and playing games to cope. The situation im in doesnt allow me to open up to many people close to me so ive been crying a lot on my own, hoping things will get better. The combination of crying and keeping a diary has been keeping me sane through the nights. During the day, thats when distractions such as music and gaming come into play, they relax me and take my mind off things temporarily.

When life gets challenging, its extremely easy to become overwhelmed and lose part of yourself. I believe in order to counteract these feelings, its important to obtain balance in your life. This can be achieved through whatever a specific person needs as everyone is different. For example, when life gets hard before a big exam or a job interview, you need something that will help ease the stress and anxiety. This could be a hobby or time going out with friends. Its whatever someone personally needs and I think its important to figure out what that something is early on in life. For myself, I take time out of my day to relax and release built up stress by listening to music or watching my favorite shows or even by playing games.

When life gets challenging I often like to take my mind off of what I'm dealing with and do something that I enjoy. I love to explore and go out, go get myself my comfort foods, and take naps in order to relieve some stress, clear my mind and replenish my energy. I also try and organize my thoughts in order to soothe the overwhelming feeling that I often get when I feel stressed out. Also saying affirmation words to myself such as "it's ok", "you can do it" is very important to me as it reminds me that this is part of of life and it will eventually pass and lead to a place that I'm meant for in the future.

When life get a little challenging I like to take a step back, slow down, and reorganize myself. Taking a step back can help me see the overall problems and make the neccessary changes. Sometime when things get a little challenging for me it is because I am trying to do too many things at once. My priorities start getting skewed and I tend to feel overwhlemed. By taking a step back and slowing down, it allows me to cut out uneccessary things, and focus on what is important. That way I can prioritize my time into things that are important. Also, if things get a little overwhelming, I like to take a break, give myself some rest, so that I could recharge and gain the energy to tackle all of the problems being presented to me at the moment. I could reorganize my priorities and get rid of the "fluff". Having organized thought can help me manage my problems a whole lot better.

When life gets challenging I take a step back to reset, take deep breaths, and try to stay calm. I think that it is best to make decision and handle situations in the right state of mind. If you are angry, upset, or worried, your emotions can reflect and impact your decision making. Another thing that I do is to talk to someone whether that's my friends or family, talking to someone about what your going through can help relieve stress and can make you feel better because you're removing weight off your shoulders by letting out your thoughts and emotions. Lastly, I go to a safe place, something where I can feel like myself and not hav to worry about anything else, whether that going on a walk, going to the gym, playing basketball, driving around at night, listening to music, or even playing video games. As a catholic, I also do try my best to pray a lot and go to church especially when life gets challenging.

To be honest I don't even know what to do when life gets challenging as most people just cope with what they can when it gets stressful. When it's stressful, I usually just listen to music as that is a way that can calm me down for a bit and then get back to what I was trying to solve. However, music doesn't really help the problem so I will just ask people for help if they know how to help it. When life gets challenging, sometimes there's no way to really solve the problem so trying to distract yourself is the only way you forget what was going on so most people try to do challenging problems to things to make them focus on that challenge. With this kind of mindset, I would really just go on my phone and play games that rely on focusing on the game rather that thinking too much on the situation.

What I do when life gets challenging is I lay down and sit with my thoughts and try to focus and breathe and remind myself that everything will be okay. Another thing I do is go ahead and find some distractions (in a good/positive way) like go to the gym or hangout with my friends because sometimes you just need a break from what is stressing you out or making life challenging. Although, when life gets challenging sometimes I like to just take some time to myself and be alone because being around others doesn't help. It also motivates me to want to do better because I understand that everything happens for a reason and I like to see things in a positive way rather than negative. Getting little things done whether it is school/homework, at home chores, etc. it helps see the bigger picture that I am doing something right.

When is getting challenging I take a step back and see what is challenging. I try to zoom out and see what is calling the stress. Is it external or internal? Is it something I can control or something I cannot. It seems like at some times when life is getting stressful, I am not making it any easier for myself. Holding myself back, not trying hard enough or doing my best to be proactive. Some things are societal and are ingrained into me without even knowing. These believes may be the things that actually hold me back from actually accomplishing what I set out for, others like how the society is or the politics going on also plays a major roll in how we live our lives. They talk about how it was so easy back then and how things costed less. Nowadays we don't make that much and prices for goods have sky rocketed some the 1900s and we are expected to do better than our parents in that regard. We have lived through a lot in this generation already.

When life gets challenging, there's a few things that help me push through with things. It's about that time right now in the semester when school starts ramping up with tests and the workload become much more challenging. Every year, I try to stay as consistent as possible with my routine. This means making time for the gym, eating well, dedicating time to classwork, setting aside moments for my hobbies, sleeping enough, and prioritizing taking care of myself in order to prevent burnout before it even has a chance to take hold. I find that when I neglect self-care, I end up more likely to deal with burnout or feelings of resentment towards my studies which lower my productivity, mood, and enjoyment of what should be interesting subjects. Normally when it's too late and I feel burnout, I find it best to step back from the workload and do something outside like hiking, running, and taking pictures of the outdoors.

When life gets challenging I tend to go through periods of motivation and self destruction. I feel heavily influenced by my emotions and because of that, it's either very easy or very hard to pull myself out of challenging circumstances, especially when the challenges are prolonged. I try often prioritizing myself which is my way of saying isolating myself from other people to force internal conversations within myself. I also try my best during these times to do my favorite things and visit old interests and hobbies.

When life gets challenging I mostly just push though, there aren't many other options or else it wouldn't be challenging at that point. I have learned to take things step by step and to be able to shut out the stress that plagues me if there should be too many, difficult things coming up. Sometimes when life gets challenging that may be a sign that something needs to change, this is not about fault or wrong. Rather when life gets challenging its also an opportunity to better certain aspects, to see whats working, and not. To find out the main sources of that challenge, or outside of that challenge that's negatively impacting. I find that it also helps to find things to look forward to, and ways to enjoy your time, as even if it may seem counter produce, enjoying and having free time allows for quality of life to increase, and those challenges to seem less.

I vary between healthy and unhealthy habits when life gets challenging. More often than not, I take a step back and do something I like, such as cooking or working out, and use that time to process whatever has been going on, or I'll turn to more self-destructive behaviors such as partying and drinking to "procrastinate" on when I need to do my processing. As far as I am concerned, when life gets challenging I am alone, and I need not put that weight on anyone else but myself.

When life gets challenging I need to be able to calm down by breathing and clearing my mind as it could be much worse. My main priority is to calm down so that I don't do anything I may regret after. Even when things are super challenging I am a person who does not give up on anything I persevere until I can accomplish whatever it is. I think about the benefits that accomplishing the activity would give me. If it is something super difficult related to school I have many resources I can use and take advantage of like my professors, office hours or my counselors. Usually even if things are difficult if I continue to persevere and try my best I am able to complete it. Life is beautiful and even when it gets challenging you have to view it as a good thing because it helps you become mentally stronger.

When life gets challenging i try to make sure that I practice yoga and deep breathing so I can maintain my peace of mind. I make sure to also exercise and do things that i love to do like get outside, run , bike, swim, etc. These activities help keep me grounded and really help me enjoy life more when things do start to get a little chaotic. I especially love to run and do yoga tho, when I go for runs out in the nice weather I feel so amazing afterwards. I live on campus as well so sometimes I will finish my runs and then go to my front lawn and start stretching and do yoga/deep breathing and it really makes me feel so amazing especially when I feel really stressed. I love going during the middle of the day because thats when its the warmest and it just feels so good when Im able to finish my run and then get my day going.

When life gets challenging, I usually try and not look back whatever mistakes I made doesn't matter in the present. I try to continue living my life even if it gets hard sometimes, I also try to take a little time for myself a little break. Being a college student sometimes is really difficult plus I commute an hour and fifteen minutes away there for its extra difficult because I spend most of my time coming and going back home but it was because I needed money, so I stayed home it was a better alternative than getting a loan I knew I wouldn't be able to pay off by dorming plus I am a very messy person and cannot live with anyone else other than my sister I hate being complained to. But anyways yea I try to just take in one day at a time and not worry too much on what I can't control

Life is always challenging but there are a few coping mechanisms that work for me. I always make sure I find time to exercise, exercise alone has helped me with managing stress levels and life in general. I think consistently challenging your body with help with anything that is stressful in life. Also I make sure I sleep well, eat well, and get plenty of sun light. I think vitamin D plays a huge part in living a well balanced life. Not enough people talk about it instead they focus on how the sun can cause cancer. I also have maintained strong relationships with family and friends I think you need to do that in order to function properly in everyday life. I have hobbies that help with stress such as baseball, lifting weights, and yoga that are all physical but help me mentally. School right now gives me a purpose and a goal with also helps keep stress levels down, I think the stress of school/work can be a good thing, especially to make you a tougher stronger person. Thank you.

When life gets challenging I go through many emotions. Usually my first instinct is to try and figure out what I can do to make it better. Sometimes I go to other people for advice or I just do some reflecting and decide how to best handle it. Once I figure out what to do about the challenge I will try to break it up into smaller steps. I do this especially if there is a big project or assignment that Im feeling overwhelmed by. Breaking up the assignment and completing little bits everyday makes it feel less daunting.

I don't know why I am here. I don't really know what my true purpose is. There's days that I think that I know and there's days when I have no clue and I'm ok with that. I like that there is uncertainty in life. Right now I want to be a physical therapist and I'm working towards that. So right now that is why I am here. But in 20 years or so, why I am here could be totally different. I could be pursuing an entirely different career and be in a totally different part of the world surrounded by totally different people. I use to be so fixated on what I should do with my life and that I need to know as soon as possible. But as I get older I am more and more ok with pursuing what I think is best for now, work towards something that I enjoy that satisfies my needs. Things and interest can always change and I want to be more and more content that things will not always be the same. So why am I here? I guess to live and experience whatever comes by.

The reason I am here is because I want to achieve my goals even when times get rough. I work hard when I can and try my best even when times get hard. The things I do, like the work I decide to do or what courses to take, I do for my future or the results I'll get from them. I tend to lack here and there, and I try to fix that habit, but it's sometimes hard for me because I tend to put a lot on my plate. The moral of the story is that I am here for myself and for the future I want to give myself. Going down that path will take a lot of time and effort, and it's going to take a lot of me to get there. I know I have the help and strength from friends and loved ones, so I want to make them proud of me for achieving my goals.

The reason that I am in this class, at least literally, is because I need it as a core requirement for the major that I am taking right now, and that was due to me switching over to Kinesiology where beforehand I was Undeclared with an Interest in Nursing. So right now, I am taking a bit of classes that would usually be for freshman year students and it kind of feels like a "fresh start" but not really since I am a Junior here at SFSU. It isn't the most fun thinking about but I want to take advantage of this opportunity to rebound myself from last semester, since I was taking technically only 1 class that I had to go to on campus, and other class I had that was completely asynchronous so I didn't have to worry about it too often. But being in class for only 2 days out of the week last semester really messed up my schedule back then, but now I am able to have a full day of classes and honestly come home tired at the end of the day.

For the past 2 labs in physics I have learned alot but also remembered a lot of things from highschool. Lab 1 we learned about conversion rates for distance and weights. It was much of a lab but more like calculator work and getting to know my physics partners. In lab 2 we learned about velocity and time and how it's graphed. It was definitely a long lab which i wasnt a fan of and made me super tired. But it was very fun doing everything and learning on the way. I learned that if the line on the graph is positive it means we are traveling away from the sensor and if its negative we are coming towards the sensor on the velocity vs time graph and on the position graph we cant really tell what direction we are going unless its ascending or descending. I also WISH the formatting on the labs when transferring to google docs was a bit more nice because everytime we are writing an answer down in the doc there are massive spaces and weird spaces in betwen each question and answer.

Right now I am just a little tired and hungry and am looking forward to heading back to my room and having a snack or something. I only have a little more homework tonight but after that I will probably just relax and play video games and watch stuff. I cant think of much else to wright so a lot of what I am saying is just a way to pad out the word count in order to reach the one hundred and fifty word minimum which I hope to reach by the end of my rambling but cannot confirm it with absolute certainty.

I am here at SF State to pursue higher education, meet new people, and explore San Fransisco as a city. As to why I am in physics, it meets a pre-requisite as I am a business major. So, although I do not need physics, I think it's cool to learn the basics. As I said, I am pursuing business information systems and planning to stay in business, though I don't know if I will stick to information systems. So far, I have learned some accounting, math, and communication. I have also met some cool people who I was able to bond with and learn together. Both inside and outside of class. I hope to continue to learn things and hopefully not drop out and fail too many classes in the process.

I have no idea why I'm here. Logically, it's because I was born in San Francisco, I attended school, I grew up and decided SFSU was the best college choice for me, and all that yada yada ya. But to be honest I don't know why I'm here. I always contemplate why things exist in the universe like, what were the chances of me getting you as my professor, or me meeting my friends, or me even becoming apart of the family that I call my. I sometimes think about all this and I lose track of time thinking about it because it's a lot easier to ask why than find out why, especially in cases like this. This might also be due to how Ive taken I think 3 astronomy classes and a physics class in the past, but I do wonder a lot of stuff about the universe and humans existing on earth and even the existence of earth a lot. Like I get so into it sometimes I stare at stuff that exists so much that at humans or animals just ends up looking weird in my eyes, but then I get back to reality and accept that all this is normal. I also think about how we're only here because of how everything in the history of our universe actually happened and it happened precisely enough to allow other events to happen which ultimately leads us to the "present" where I am here, you are here, etc.

I've been super busy recently, all over the place doing a bunch of different stuff from class to work to hanging out with people and also dealing with financial aid issues along with housing issues. I hate being an adult, but it's also like experience. I'm learning a lot and getting to experience a lot because of everything I do, and I'm grateful for it, but it's also just like I'm tired. I would like to not be doing as much all the time, but that's the cost of wanting to be great, you know? I enjoy this physics class and a lot that it has offered from the online class itself and from the in-person lab. That's been cool. I hate the weather it's been super cold and I don't like rainy weather I feel like I have to constantly plan around the rain now we'll see how that goes hopefully it won't be too bad in the next couple of days.

This is a very deep question. It makes much more sense if I had done this assignment when it was due. I took it as Why am I in this class? Why am I taking physics? What can it do for me? I personally had no idea I had to take physics. Therefore, I missed the first three weeks of this class. However, now at the end of this semester, I can see how physics is very important. I can now relate it to my kinesiology classes on how bodies move within the physics of hte world. being able to see how movement relates to gravity, light, and colors. Now, knowing that I am finally getting closer to my goal in life is so relieving. knowing that once these base-level classes are done, I can be closer to my career goal. I have loved this class. Lab, it has been super interesting, and I'm glad I got to take it.

As a kinesiology major Im not too sure why Im in here. Other than the fact that this is a prerequisite for another class if I the option to avoid physics in all honesty I wouldve, but now that Im in the class I can say I have been finding it very interesting. I think the professor plays a big role in to why I feel this way. How relatable the professor comes off and knowledgeable he is makes me feel very confident for what my future in this class holds. Ive never been a talkative person but working in groups in this class helps a lot with the learning process. Having ideas and questions from different perspectives, combining to reach an answer really makes it feel like its a team effort. Im still not too sure what to expect for the remainder of this class but its been very interesting so far and Im hoping to learn new skills and knowledge by the end of it.

I am here because I want to earn my degree and become a nurse. I am here because that is what is expected from me by everyone including myself. I truly want to be here because it is what I need to do to get to my end goal of becoming a nurse. It has not been easy and there were some unexpected turns, but I am determined to push through. Like, I never though I would be taking Physics as a Kinesiology Major right now, but I learned it was a path I had to divert to in order to reach my goal. Sometimes when I feel like it's so hard to continue with my school work I tell myself that I won't have to worry about it in a week, in a day, or in a couple of hours, so I should just do it and get it over with. Some times I really put in genuine work into my assignments, but sometimes I just try to get the assignment done as fast and as easy as possible, too.

Although I initially enrolled in this course since it was a prerequisite for my major, I've come to see that physics can be beneficial for me. It teaches me to think differently, more thoughtfully, more carefully, and more logically. Of course, it's not always simple. Even though the concepts seem intimidating at times, I want to attend because I am aware that the skills I am developing here go beyond just passing the class. I'm learning to keep pushing through problems and not give up when the solution isn't obvious right away. This class is part of a larger picture, a step toward my goals, and it's helping me become someone who can confront problems with persistence and openness. I'm here because I want to grow, and sometimes that involves doing the hard stuff, even when it's not what I would have chosen first.

I think that I am here because it will help to grow my mind and help me have a better way of thinking about physics. I am also here because I know that I need this physics 101 and 102 to help me with getting into my major and starting it up. being here is the reason why its going to help me level up my thinking when thinking of physics and anything that relates to physics. I am currently in the class now and I like it very much and the professor is a good one. I used to think that I would have physics since I never had to take it in high school. People always used to tell me that taking physics is a hard class and that you should never take unless you really have to like in my case I REALLY need the class to graduate and continues my studies in Kinesiology.

Why Am I Here? I am here in the United States, but if I really ask myself why, the answer isnt simple. On the surface, it seems like I made the decision to move, to start fresh, to pursue something new. But looking deeper, I realize it wasnt just one decisionit was a series of events, circumstances, and maybe even accidents that led me here. If life followed a straight path, I might still be in China. But life isnt that predictable. One small event leads to another, like ripples in water, shaping where I end up. Maybe it was a conversation I had, an opportunity that appeared at the right time, or even just a feeling that I needed change. In physics, they call this chaos theory small things create big effects. And thats exactly how I feel about being here. Sometimes, I wonder what would have happened if I had made different choices. But at the end of the day, Im here, in this moment, making the best of where life has taken me. Maybe thats what matters most.

The question why am i here has appeared in my life many times. Its come up a lot in my own thoughts and i always did wonder why im on this planet. For a while in life, societal expectations defenitly played a major role in my awnser to this question. having a career, and starting a family were defenitly awnsers that i would think of a lot, but i think that ive come to realize that there is no real reason that i am here. In my mind i belive that my parents wanted a child, so that means that i was born. I dont think i, or humans have a higher purpose in life. We are just animals at heart. I think that people should find their own purposes in life, I havent truely discovered my own purpose but i think i have an idea. I want to be able to support myself, and pursue a passion. I think that would be my current awnser to the question. I think that your purpose in life should be to make yourself and the people around you happy.

Honestly I don't really know why I'm here. I don't really think about this a lot but I suppose I do think about my existance pretty often. It's really only when I'm sad though I think. I only really think existentially when I am sad for some reason, but when I'm happy I tend to live in the moment, but I guess the question of why am I here really could be though about in either way. Like when I am sad I think about why I am here in a more negative way. In a negative way however, its more of a question of why do I deserve to bere here or what did I do to deserve to be here rather than a more deep why am I here. When I'm sad I am more existential though. I tend to get anxious about the future that comes from thinking too existentially. When I am happy I think about why I am here in a more positive attitude. I think about why I am here and I'm grateful for it. Also there are times when I think about it neutrally. Sometimes I zone out and I kinda think too hard about what I am and myself. Why am I here though is because my parents gave birth to me and I choose to be here, I guess.

My goal is to finish my undergrad, got to PT school and become a physical therapist. Since that line of work has a lot to do with movement to help patients recover and movement requires physics, this class will help me understand that better. Matter of fact, this class has made me realize how much physics happens in day to day life. Everything we do involves physics. And if I want to help my patients recover from injury, I would need to learn the basics of how things move.

My goals are slightly confusing because I cant really stick to them. I constantly struggle because I change my mind a lot and I tend to overthink things. I also lack the ability to motivate myself and at this very moment, Ive been struggling a lot with my personal problems. Even so, I want to use this feeling of hurt Im feeling to motivate myself to become a better person for myself. Originally my goal was to become a physical therapist, though thats not really my aim to be in the future. My new goal at the moment is to figure out what I want to do and how can I get there. This class in a way does help because some medical professionals take this course and being in the medical field is my top goal to becoming successful.

My goals in this class is to get to around a solid, and broad understanding of the material that is being taught in this class, as well as trying to apply that into real life. This class can help me achieve that goal because the way the professor teaches is very memorable for my style of teaching/learning so I am able to absorb the material somewhat well. Although some of the assignment questions may be a little bit confusing to understand, I am usually down to ask questions on what it means, even if the professor is occupied. I just need clarification for the questions and what kind of answer the questions are trying to get out to us. It is somewhat hard to manage between 4 people because we don't know when or where to stop as it came to answering the question being asked, and whether we have enough information for that question.

My goals are to graduate college and this class is going to help me fill in a requirement for my next classes. I also have other goals in life but this class specifically doesn't contribute to those goals because physics doesn't really have anything to do with my major.

Working with the sensors was really fun and while the capstone software is a little buggy it did help increase my understanding of how acceleration worked. Coming into this lab I already some experience regarding physics (acceleration) from high school but never had any physical labs because covid. the questions were fine with the only slight challenging parts being the graphing but that was more of a how to add the graphs than anything.

My goals in life are to be financially free and healthy. I hope to be able to do the things I like to do without having too many restraints, such as affordability to my situation. I also hope to be healthy as I feel like health is one of the most important things. If you aren't healthy, I feel like you don't get to enjoy as many things as you could if you were healthy. I also don't want to ever worry about having an illness that I could have prevented with a healthy lifestyle. I think this class is helping me achieve these goals by teaching me basic physics, which can help with everyday life. Even though I may not think of physics in my everyday life, it is something that does happen. Even though I am a business major, it doesn't relate to my major much. I still think it's cool to learn the basics of physics.

My goals are to actively learn and participate in my classes. I've noticed that I've been feeling sort of checked out lately because of stress from anything (I'm just a very anxious person) and I've been working to come back to reality in a sense. I feel like I haven't been taking stuff seriously lately even though I've been on time and done all my work for all my classes. I think my general anxiety regarding school is whether I want to transfer to CCSF or not because they have a program I'm interested in that SFSU doesn't offer. This class has definitely taught me a lot on top of the 2 physics class and 3 astronomy classes I've already had in the past. I think being able to do things hands on in the lab helps me sort of finalize my learning and learn better and even quicker. This class has also made me realize how even though I learn pretty well from just lectures and readings, doing stuff and actively participating in the work I'm learning is really helpful.

This class and the lecture are pretty fun. I like the people I work with in my lab because they're all pretty funny and have a similar humor to me overall. The class is enjoyable to come into. I also really enjoy the lecture because you make it funny, and it's enjoyable to see what weird interactions will have that are also included with physics. You make the classroom more of a community than just a classroom, you know, and that's always really cool. I think that if I were taking another type of science or physics class, I would be struggling right now with the amount of work also, so this is helping me balance my already crazy workload. Stress has been a common emotion for me. right, but this class gives me no anxiety; I really enjoy it. I've always wanted to know about physics; also, I feel like it builds into a lot of basic fundamentals that I can explain sometimes because physics and science are often all around us, so broadening my education with this class I thought would be fun.

I haven't gone into this class with specific goals besides succeeding and passing with a good grade. I am a kinesiology major and am interested in more of the big picture type things like big movements and such. so I know physics is necessary, but I very much dislike taking the smaller science classes like chemistry, physio physics, and such. they tend to have a lot of math, and I never am super good at math. however, I did go in hoping for a teacher who was willing to be patient and work through the harder stuff. I think that goal was met. he explains things so well and knows what he is talking about, which is so helpful for me. I think by the end of this semester, I will understand something bigger about physics and have a basic understanding, which is all I could hope for. I also feel like I can achieve a good grade in this class.

My goal is to pursue a career in physical therapy where I work with athletes, preferably soccer players and help them stay physically healthy. Playing soccer my whole life Ive always wanted to stay within the world of sports, so the big picture would be to help athletes stay in form for their careers. Im not too sure how big of a role physics would play into a career in physical therapy, Maybe Im still Ignorant to how physics impacts our day-to-day lives, but the only way to find out is to continue with this course and see where it takes me.

My goals is to try my best in this class and strive for an A! I know it is not going to be easy, but I will try my hardest. I will fully participate in labs, help my group members, and ask questions when I don't understand a concept. I also want to better understand physics because in high school I tired AP Physics and was not successful in understanding most of the concepts during the semester and ended up switching out for the next semester. This class can be redamation and to getting to not necessary fully understanding but understanding enough where I am not lost the whole time and just guessing on every assignment. I think so far I am learning more and understanding concepts I was confused on during high school. I feel excited and a little nervous to learn more about physics through the labs and lectures.

Right now, my goals are about figuring out where Im headed in life, both in terms of my career and personal growth. I want to feel like Im moving toward something meaningful, but Im still working on what that really looks like. This class is helping me with that by pushing me to think more deeply, critically, and creatively.

How is this class helping me and our interactions where you ask me physics-related questions  helping? Well, it forces me to access and apply my knowledge in practical ways. When you ask about circuits or wave phenomena, I'm not just retrieving definitions; I'm trying to connect concepts, explain relationships, and even anticipate potential follow-up questions. Each query pushes me to solidify my understanding and identify any gaps in my knowledge. It's like a practical exam, constantly testing and refining my internal models of the physical world. Furthermore, explaining these concepts to you helps me to organize my own understanding more coherently. The need for clarity in my explanations reinforces my own grasp of the subject matter. So, in a way, your questions are the experiments that help me learn and grow in my understanding of physics, bringing me closer to my goal of a deeper, more comprehensive understanding of the universe's workings.

My main goal is to develop a strong understanding of physics concepts, as they are fundamental to my studies in kinesiology and my future career as an occupational therapist. Understanding physics, helps me analyze how forces affect human movement, which is essential when working with patients to improve mobility and prevent injuries. This class is helping me achieve my goals by giving me a solid foundation in key physics principles like forces, motion, speed, and energy. I am learning how to apply these concepts to real-world scenarios, such as understanding how different forces act on the body during movement. Additionally, this class is improving my problem-solving skills, which will be useful when assessing patients and designing effective therapy plans in the future.

I havent thought a lot about any current goals i have, if i had to say, my current goals in college are to graduate and make a stable living. What I do when life get challenging is that I take the time to step back from whatever is stressing me out and reflect on why I am feeling challenged at that given moment. I reach out to a friend or family member for some guidance and opinion. Often times they are able to help me rationalize what is challenging for me and help me make a better decision. Then on my own, I break down what I need to do for that month, then what I need to do that week, what I need to do that day and what I would need to do right now to prepare myself. I've notice that compartmentalizing my task helps me organize myself and takes off the load of the require task that I need to do. If it is severe, I let my emotions be and allow myself to react emotionally. Basically, if I need to cry, I allow myself to cry. Sometimes I literally step away from what is challenging me (if I have the opportunity to) to allow myself to be refreshed.

What I do when life gets challenging, or at least, what I hope to do whenever it does get challenging, is to take a step back and revaluate the priorities in my life and to go about my problems one by one. Usually, and in the past, that has worked for me when things start to feel very overwhelming. Right now is honestly a time where I should be doing that, seeing as my personal/social life I feel is not at a place where I want it at the moment. Having these kinds of struggles only to have responsibilities on top of it, in fact, having these struggles because of these responsibilities that I have at home it starting to make me feel drained whenever I enter my own house or talk with other people outside of friends. Now, I think it a good time to start reflecting on myself and ways I can try to make things a little better.

When life gets challenging I always fall back amongst my friends and girlfriend. I get to openly talk to them about my stress and if i'm anxious about something. By talking about my problems I end up feeling pretty good after because I get help and advice from my friends. My friends and girlfriend are all really supporting of me and I really appreciate them for that for always pushing me through the downs. Before I had a girlfriend where I could talk to I would always go on runs at ocean beach from the cliff house down to Taravel and a run back up.

When life gets challenging, I tend to try to look at my current situation from an outside view. Such as, when you watch a movie, you are watching someone else do something and can see more broadly and clearly. When you're in the moment, you may use your emotions to tunnel vision on something. For example, I got into a car accident around a month ago. Of course, this is something I hadn't planned, and sucked at the moment. Though, of course, this was terrible at the moment, I was physically ok from the accident, and my car did not have too much damage. I have been out of a car ever since, though looking at it from an outside view, it wasn't as bad. I also just try to do things I like and balance my life. For example, working out, going for a hike, playing video games, going for a drive, and so much more. Doing these things bring my mood up.

I stress snack a lot. I also will try to organize myself and my life. I make to do lists a lot as well. I don't know what I do when life gets challenging to be honest, I just complain about it and do what I need to do to try to make life less challenging. I will also try to take time to have self care days for myself. I also think I rant a lot to my friends and try to get advice or just relieve stress by telling people. Im always extremely anxious so I genuinely don't know what I do when life gets challenging. I feel like I always make things more difficult for myself sometimes until I realize I'm only 19 years old and I still have more life to live. Like sometimes I get extremely stressed and such but then I ground myself by realizing how young I am and that this shouldn't be affecting me how it is. But I think I mostly just stress eat, I do outdoor activities sometimes I just sunbathe by sitting outside and disassociating too.

Most of my life has been challenges. I see myself as someone who is very resilient and hard-working. To give you a little bit more info, both of my parents are out of the picture, and I've been working since I was 16 and am currently still working. I think that's just the surface of it; there's so much more that expands into how my life has been challenging, but I've always looked at challenges as something fun, something to be, something to prove to myself that I can do more. When stuff gets challenging, two things either happen: I'll be overwhelmed because the amount of challenges I'm facing is a lot, and I'll tend to shut down, or I will eventually build my confidence up, and my determination will usually pull through, and I'll push through whatever challenges come my way. My dad's always put it as You've got to keep moving, and I think that that statement is 100% true.

This semester has been completely overwhelming and has destroyed me. I have lots of very hard classes, a lot of work, and just so many things. I have been trying to work on navigating all these things, but it is not going too well. What has been working the best for me has been just writing everything down. Having a physical calendar and to-do list. this semester is just killing me and im not sure if i can pass some of my classes which is freaking me out. I'm feeling very lost in my career and classes. Life is extremely challenging right now, and I'm not sure how to fix it without just giving up. Because that wound like the best option. I won't, I'm still trying to push through, but it's extremely hard and I can't wait for this semester to be over. I, working on being more organized and taking care of myself for these last few weeks.

When life gets challenging I always take time to just appreciate where I am in life, where and how far Ive come from. I typically take some time to myself but after that I seek guidance whether it be from the man above or just calling my parents back home. I always appreciate the support my parents give me and any sort of advise they have to offer. I then prioritize what needs to get done and go from there. Slow and steady wins the race, so take my time and get it done right.

When life gets challenging I try an make a list of everything I need to do. Down to the little things like taking a shower or updating my calendar. It keeps me calming seeing everything I need to complete at the same time. I also like to clean when I'm feeling overwhelmed because it helps me clear my mind. I guess I see it as a clean place equals clean thoughts. Also just crying makes things better too. Sometimes when I am struggling on like a homework problem I start to crying and after that it seems to help me clear up my confusion. It also feels good to let things out by crying. Listening to music or watching something can really help. When life is challenging, watching a funny Youtube video helps me calm down or makes me forget what I was stressing about for the mean time. Now that I think about it I may go through all of these every time.

I have a tendency to shut down slightly when things get tough; I become quiet, I start to overthink, and I start to keep everything inside. However, after the initial wave, I've learnt to take a moment to slow down. Rather than focusing on the larger picture, I try to take things one step at a time. I tell myself that I've survived difficult situations in the past and that I don't need to solve every problem at once. I occasionally take a walk to relax. Even if it's just to discuss something minor, I frequently call someone I trust because it makes me feel less alone. I also write things down. Getting my thoughts out helps me find a way through all the confusion, but it doesn't solve everything. most of all, even when it's the most difficult thing, I make an effort to be patient with myself. Even though I don't always handle challenges well, I usually return to this belief that I can keep going. that even if I'm moving slowly, I have the emotions, the determination, and the support to keep moving forward. And that's enough.

What I do when life gets hard is sleep. I love to sleep a lot and I think its the best way to rest your brain and try to reset yourself. I would also talk to my friends about it to see if they have any advice or help out in any way. I think that another thing that I would sometimes do is go take a walk where ever I can so it gives me time to think about the things that are challenging. Or just go and sit outside in the grass and bathe in the sunlight. I think that it is really relaxing to listen to the outside world where sometimes it is peaceful and quiet. I also do meditating where you listen to it for 5-10 minutes and it helps to calm down your nerves and not think of anything. Most of the time I like to go out and doing something so I can distract myself from the challenging for however long that I can.

When life gets challenging, I remind myself to take a step back and breathe. Stress can feel overwhelming, especially during the semester when deadlines, exams, and personal responsibilities all pile up at once. But Ive learned that I dont have to face everything alone. Exercise is one of my biggest stress relieversit helps me clear my mind and regain control when things feel chaotic. Whether its lifting weights, doing yoga, going for a walk, or just stretching, moving my body gives me a sense of release. Yoga, in particular, helps me slow down, focus on my breath, and reset my mind. I also turn to music. Sometimes, just putting on my favorite playlist and tuning out for a little while helps me reset. Watching a good movie also helps me escape for a bit and shift my mindset. If Im feeling overwhelmed, a comfort movie or something funny can completely change my mood. Talking to a close friend or even just spending time alone to reflect also makes a difference. I remind myself that challenges dont last forever, and Ive made it through tough moments before. I try to break big problems into smaller steps and focus on what I can do rather than what feels impossible. At the end of the day, I know that even when life is hard, I have the tools to get through itI just need to trust myself and keep moving forward.

When life gets challenging i like to take a step back and look at my situation so that i can better think about what i need to do. Examining the whole picture makes it easier for me to decide how to tackle challenges in my life. I also enjoy taking breaks so that i can rest and focus more on ongoing issues in my life. Resting allows me to clear my mind so that i am the best prepared that i can be. looking at how things might turn out also encourages me to work harder so that i can rest later.

When life gets challenging, personally, I like to think about the things I am grateful for. I get overwhelmed pretty easily so I often feel like things become challenging often. A bad habit as well is avoiding challenges. I think challenges are actually a good thing but when I feel really stuck, like to tell myself that in the end I will be okay and to be happy where I am. Also, it is good to face challanges and lately I have been trying to encourage myself to face challanges rather than avoid them becuase I think that would help me grow as a person. I still have to get better at that, but having the mindset to be aware of the fact that I do run away from challanges keeps me more aware of it. Even if it takes time, which is the hardest part for me, I should do it. Things that take time are the hardest because I am the kind of person who needs instant gratification when I do something for else I don't really feel satisfied, but I have to learn to wait and be patient with myself when things get challenging.

I am in physics 1 since I need it as a prerequisites to take physiology GWAR. Despite that, I am also eager to expand and strengthen my knowledge about physics since it a subject I am intimidated by. I am here to learn new things and share my opinions so that others can know my point of view by learning with different people we can have many good ideas which helps to reach a quick conclusion.

Why am I here? Honestly a question that everyone might ask themselves, especially as a college student. As for me, I never really knew why I was here, at SF State, in the city, in college. I felt like I was here just for the purpose of being in college like every other student that went after graduating high school. Though, I may not have really thought ahead as to what I wanted to do in the future. And it would stay that way for a while during my early college years. I feel that that isn't too out of the ordinary for students to think that way, it is more like a glimpse into adulthood and being independent. I found that I loved Biology so I decided to stay within that range for my degree. Then I would eventually find a love for genetics through my Biology courses. So currently, studying with a focus toward genetic counseling is my current goal. Which is why I'm here today in this class.

I want to be able to finish my school to help my family out but mostly to show and prove myself that I am capable of learning many things and learn from what im being taught. I am also here because I want to be a great example for my bother whos later on going to be in the same place as me one day. I want to be able to provide as much help as I can to guide him to the right path. I really care about my education and want to make sure I am being determined in it so I can accomplish my dream goals as well, and provide for my family as much as I can.

I feel like the question "why am I here?" can be answered very differently in terms of where someone is in life. As of right now, I am here because I want to be successful. I want to prove that I can get things done when I put my mind to it, not only to myself but to the people that I have told about my goals. Looking at this question from another perspective, in some aspects of my life, I don't really know why I'm here. These past couple of months, some really mentally draining things have happened and it has really changed my perspective on life in general. Because of this, I have struggled with why I am really here and getting myself back on track. These events have really thrown me off the schedule that I have and it set me back in terms of personal goals that I have. I am slowly healing from these events and living in San Francisco these past few weeks has really helped me. I have been able to get into a routine and I am slowly getting back to the person that I want to be.

I am honestly not sure why I am here, but what I do know is that it is a requirement for my major and to be honest, this class is really fun. I will give myself the opportunity to learn from this class and give it my all and make sure that if I dont understand something, to actually reach out because I want to pass. Something that I have been dealing with is shyness and that has caused me to regret sometimes some things I have done in the past like for example: asking the professors for help when I actually needed it or even to talk to my classmates because I am scared they will either criticize me or give me a look of what is she doing here? I honestly dont really know why I am here. I must be here for a reason though. Apparently the odds of being born is 1 in 400 trillion which is insane to think about. I guess I must be here for some reason, fate maybe. With these chances being so low it feels like I need to be something special. I need to stand out in some sort of way. Whether it's professionally or in my personal life, I just want to be seen as a good influence.

I am here because I am required to take this class for my major, on a deeper level i'm here in order to accomplish something that is very important to me. I am here taking physics because I want to understand the fundamentals of physics. When I think of why am I here I think of my physical state of where I am right now. As I'm sitting in Physics im thinking Im here because I have the right and the privilege to receive an education. I think that all of us are here for a purpose and although everyones purpose is different I do think that the end product is that we are here to do the best we can and add onto the world. Whether it is knowledge or anything else. All of us are here to fulfill something and get to an end goal. To share what we have to offer to the world.

Why am I here? I think, in some ways, its because Ive been given a chance. A chance that others didnt get, a chance that my parents fought for. They crossed borders, worked countless hours, and sacrificed their own dreams to give my siblings and me a future. I am here because of them, because they pushed through unimaginable struggles just for us to have a better life. I think a lot about what that means, how their hard work and sacrifices sit heavy on my shoulders, how much I want to live up to their hopes and dreams for me. Im here because I want to make something of myself, but not just for me. I want to make them proud, to show that their struggles were worth it. I want to help others too, like the way my parents have always helped others without ever asking for anything in return. I want to create opportunities, to give back, and to live in a way that honors their sacrifices. I think Im here to learn, to grow, and to take everything I can from these years so that I can give something back. Maybe thats why Im here, because I owe it to them, to myself, and to the future.

I interpreted this prompt as to why I am here in this class. I am in this class as a fulfillment of my grade requirements and to expand my knowledge to one day be eligible to achieve my career goals. I came originally from the Central Valley but moved to SF. I am here at this school because I wanted to be a little bit further from home, but too far to where I can just catch a train back. I am here in this class because I also chose my major to be Cell and Molecular Biology. I chose this major because of the career I want to have one day.

I am here because I want to get a formal education. No one else in my family has ever gotten higher than a high school graduation. I want to be able to inspire my younger siblings and cousins to get an education past high school. I am here because I want to prove the teachers and counselors who doubted me that I would do well in college. Im also here because I wanted to get away from my home town. Ive seen many people get stuck in the familiarity of it. I didnt want to be another person unable to make it out. Im doing this for my family so they wont have to struggle the way we did. Why am I here is a such a hard question. It could mean in this class, at the school, in this country or on this world at all. I would say I am here in this class because I HAVE to be. In the since that I need this class to further my education. Or that I need it to gain more knowledge for the understanding of subjects within my major. On the other hand I would say I am here because I enjoy challenging myself and learning new things especially in math. I chose CA specifically to emerge myself in a community with like minded people. And I believe I am here on earth to learn, explore and take in all the experiences that come my way. Im in no way religious but I believe that the reason for being here is subjective and it is only a reason when we give it meaning.

I am here to relearn what I learned in high school. Though I thought I would have enjoyed high school physics a lot, it was a struggle, as all we seemed to do was textbook work. Every time I have learned physics on my own time, I have enjoyed it. I am hoping this class can make me enjoy learning about physics in an academic setting. In all honesty, despite my interest in physics, I am mostly only taking this because I need it for my major requirements. But nonetheless, I think I will enjoy it. I also spoke to a friend who had taken this course before, and she could not stop talking about how much she enjoyed it. She is not much of a fan of physics, but she said this course challenged her to think in ways she usually wouldn't. The professor I have for the lecture portion of this course makes me excited to learn because of his own enthusiasm for the subject, so I hope I ca. feel the same level of enthusiasm and interest in physics through this course.

This is a pretty broad question that could go in any way. I wouldn't take to biology and science but more of a spiritual sense and think how am I here. I believe that there is a God and that's my own choice. A science professor could tell me otherwise but it wouldn't mean anything to me. I don't believe that we evolved from fish or monkeys. With the question of why I'm here, I could take it as whats my motives of morals in life. First I give all glory to God. I don't put myself on a pedestal and think highly of myself in life and I'm not here to please myself. Thats the main thing that come to mind when I think if that question. Another perspective may not be that deep. but I would think about my career and what I'm doing. With that I would hope to get a job I enjoy and impact people on the way.

I interpreted this question in two different ways. I interpreted it in what am I doing in this class, like main purpose in taking this class. To answer that interpretation, I'm here in this class to learn more and apply physics to the real-world. Yes it fulfills my major requirements and is a pre-requisite for some of my upper division course but, I'm very interested in learning more through this lab as well as the lecture. I have never really taken a physics class before so it has been relatively new concepts for me, while still having overlap on some aspects that we've learned so far like velocity and acceleration. The second way I interpreted this was in a more spiritual way, like what is our main purpose here on this planet and simply existing. To answer that interpretation of the question, I don't really know my purpose here yet. It is something that I'm still trying to figure out about myself everyday, yet I am extremely grateful to be here.

I am here to fulfill my GE requirement. I have no intentions of using physics in my life moving forward, however I need this class to get into my core classes. I constantly question Californias GE curriculum because most the classes we take is a cash grab from the school, and is not applicable to the real world. The CSU system cuts back a plethora of money just to exploit students but fail to do anything to improve education. We must put students first before anything: hear them, value their concerns, and implement what they believe is crucial and helpful for their learning. Teachers need to teach again; not give us worksheets and expect us to pay a couple grand each semester and call it learning. Students are the next future leaders and frontline workers, there must be a a level of care and respect that can transcend the systemic issues we are facing today.

I'm taking this class because I failed physics in community college and I have to take it again to fulfill my lower division classes. I understood nothing in that physics class because it was too fast paced, it was hard to remember what equations to use, I couldn't remember what all of the symbols represented. This was a physics with algebra class and the labs were based off of running tests, writing down results, and pluggin in those results to different scenarios, and doing more calculations. What I hated the most about physics was the fact that each question we did probably required about at least 5 different calculations to find the other missing values before you're able to plug in those values to get the value you'resupposed to find for the main question. Everytime we did practice problems in class the professor would have to use up about half a whole white board just to do the math. It was too much math for me!

I am here because I want to aquire a degree in Microbiology. And part of that is to take Physics 1 and for next semester I'll be takgradutesics 2. I think I'm also here because I felt the need to expand my education to have better opportunities in life and more importantly my career choices. Once I am able to accomplish these requirements I will soon be able to gradute with that degree although I do find Physics and that side of STEM very interesting, but I prefer the Biological side far more. As of now I am enjoying Physics, the professors have been very kind and accomodating, and I am actually somewhat excited to show up to class, especially the Lab since we'll get to apply the material we learned. I enjoyed the first lab and I know I will be happy to expand my experience with all other labs.

In all honesty I am taking physics because it is required for my degree but I am interested to learn how this class will be applied to either my future job or even day to day life. Physics is a good class to help with understanding how the world works such as the fundamental laws of how things work, along with working on my problem solving skills. In this class we get to test and prove our scientific theories while using mathematical formulas. Physics is the baseline for natural sciences such as geology, astronomy, chemistry and biology. In order to understand and proof some of our theories in these other topics we need the knowledge and technique that we learn in physics.

My main goal is to become a Cardiothoracic Surgeon, and physics plays a bigger role in that than I initially expected. At first, I saw physics as just another requirement, but as I go deeper into the concepts, I realize how much it connects to the human body, medicine, and even the tools surgeons use. Understanding forces, pressure, and motion helps me see how blood flows through the body, how the heart pumps efficiently, and even how medical devices like pacemakers and ventilators work. This class is also helping me sharpen my problem-solving skills. Physics forces me to think critically, analyze situations, and apply formulas in ways that mirror real-world challenges. As a future surgeon, I know Ill need to stay calm under pressure and quickly find solutions to unexpected problems. Physics is training me for that, even if its in a different context. Overall, this class is helping me build the foundation I need, not just in knowledge, but in the way I approach learning and problem-solving. Its a stepping stone toward my bigger dream, and I appreciate how it pushes me to think in new ways.

My main goal right now is to get my CLS license/degree and graduate college. So far this class is helping me achieve that because it is a requirement for me to take this class in order to get my degree. I just need to keep working hard and try my best to learn/understand the material more. However, that is not the only purpose for the class. Physics has a lot to do with microbiology. It ties into how cells move and act as well. Specifically, this physics class ties a lot into how physics relates to biology and kinesiology. I remember one of the first lectures we had, the professor talked about how food is our energy and is in physics energy is a conserved mass that cannot be created or destroyed. He then explained to us how the food we eat is converted into energy for our bodies, yet then gets released in the form of sweat or waste. By explaining that concept in a biological sense, it made it more easy for me to grasp the concept.

Application to other fields is an important one because physics is a foundation for many other subjects such as engineering and chemistry. The knowledge from this class may be used to solve problems in other subjects. When life gets challenging I take a step back so I can take a look at what is in front of me. I like to observe and try to find solutions to help me relieve stress that often derives from hardships. If something is making my life challenging like having multiple exams in one week, I make sure to study so that I can get over it. If I am experiencing a mental block, then I like to journal, scrapbooks, workout, watch a movie, or surround myself with my loved ones. Often times, I just need a break from what is causing me to be stressed. Also, I like to reflect on where I am at life and look at all the things that I have accomplished so that I can realize my worth. Often times, I also pray and hope that the season I am in will pass. Life has its challenges but it is how I perceive it to be the important part.

When life becomes challenging, I put in more effort because its a sign that I may not be trying hard enough, which makes achieving my goal even more difficult. When I feel this way, I focus on staying calm and persevering, as reality shows that life is never easy without effort.

When life gets challenging, sometimes it's good to just take a little break, and take a deep breath to get your bearings straight. Things get overwhelming quite easily when you let things get out of hand as they stack upon one another. It's kind of just unnecessary weight on your shoulders. The past 2 weeks I haven't been able to make it to class due to problems I've faced at home, it was very challenging for me to figure out how I should handle the entire situation. Though, as soon as I calmed down, and looked at everything from a top-down perspective, taking it slow and easy, it makes life a lot easier to handle. Panicking too soon to find solutions and every possible outcome can really worsen anyone's situation. It's usually life experiences like this that help you find out your methods with life challenges. Taking a deep breath and gathering your thoughts in an organized manner is my go to.

When life gets challenging I just try to space out and relax take some time off from everything. But sometimes I feel like I have too much pressure at times that I don't know how to balance out my school life and outside of school work and activities. I get overwhelmed and tired most of the times. It's complicated to really focus on certain things but overall having distractions, going out with friends and spending quality time with family is always something I want.

When life gets challenging I tend to shut down and get stressed. I overly stress myself out over things that are not in my control. To combat this I try to remind myself that these are things that are out of my control and the only thing I can focus on are the things that are in my control. Surrounding myself with people that support me is another way I combat the stress from when life gets challenging. It reminds me that I have people around me that genuinely want to see my succeed. Their support also shows me that I can really get through the challenging times and that there will be easier times. I try my best to live in the moment, even through challenging times because life is very short and you never know what could happen. Making to-do lists also helps me with trying to figure out what to do when life is challenging. It helps me be organized and lowers the stress levels for me.

What I usually do when life gets challenging is I take a break from everything and just go out to like the park for a walk and look around or I would just do self care at home to make myself feel better. There has been a lot of situations where I feel like I cant get back to normal and what usually helps me too is journaling, just writing about life or whats going on like my problems and my point of view on it. I enjoy making pastries, food, and also drinks. So when im like half way in whatever I am preparing, time flies pretty fast and I realizethat I am enjoying what I am doing. What i also find calming and a temporary escape is playing video games with my brother. Its been something we have done a lot growing up and not only is it fun but also brings us closer together and we can catch up on how life is going and whats new in life.

i am not the best a navigating life when it gets challenging. I am not good at getting myself out of a rut by myself. either i become really isolated from the world and eventually time will help me get out of the siituation or that my family will try their best to get a hold of me and help. often times i push them away though. it doesnt last too long thankfully but those times are pretty rough. it also hasnt occured in a while so im happy about that. since those times i have learned that reaching out for help does not burden anyone else and instead it just lightens the weight on me. The more trustworthy people i am comfortable enough to talk to when life gets hard the more the "baggage" us distributed. Also I have a therapist now so it would be extremely beneficial for me to be comortable to really be as matter of fact as possible and not sugarcoat or hold anything back.

When life gets challenging I usually try to face whatever is going wrong and deal with it myself and then take a step back from it all after acknowledging it. For me taking a step back would signify spending time by myself and just taking time for myself to relax and de stress, I usually do this by going out for a hike or a walk in nature. Being outside in the fresh air is my go to way of getting rid of whatever stress I may be feeling at the moment. If dealing with the issue on my own doesnt seem to work I will reach out to my girlfriend and sort of vent about whatever is going wrong, I feel that this helps me because it allows me to see the situation and issue from someone elses perspective.

When life gets challenging I prioritize my mental health first. How I do this is by going on walks, taking media breaks, exercising, and therapy. There have been times where it has been challenging trying to keep up with all of that but once I do all those things I feel better. Usually I journal throughout the week so I can write out my thoughts and feelings and be able to plan properly for the upcoming days. It also gives me a chance to write out some things that have been on my mind lately.

When life gets challenging I tend to start focusing on the little things that I can control. This works for me because after i do that my head is a little clearer and I am calmer to take on the harder things that I have been having trouble with. I think especially in college it is hard to find a balance within everything since everything becomes so time consuming. I do think that us as college students should always find an outlet whether it is a person or a place that we can go to and destress to later refocus on what is truly important. I also think it is very important to not push your emotions to the side but rather go through them since that is what will help you more in the end. I think knowing that you will be able to get through it and feeling all your emotions is the first step in doing that.

When life gets challenging, I tend to take a step back and focus on what I can control. I remind myself that struggles are temporary and that I have faced difficulties before and made it through. Walking on the beach helps me clear my mind, its something about the sound of the waves and the feeling of the sand beneath my feet that brings me back to the present. Music also plays a big role in helping me cope. Whether its an old favorite vinyl or a song that perfectly matches my mood, it reminds me that Im not alone in what Im feeling.  I also try to break things down into small steps. When I feel overwhelmed, I focus on just the next thing I need to do instead of the entire problem. Whether its school, work, or personal struggles, I remind myself why I started and what my long-term goals are. My dream of becoming a cardiothoracic surgeon keeps me going, I know that the hard moments now are just stepping stones to something greater. And when things feel too heavy, I reach out to friends or family. A simple conversation or a shared laugh can be enough to remind me that Im supported.

When life gets challenging I admit I struggle more than I would like to. I unhealthily cope and have a hard time asking for help. I also am a busy-body. I like to addd more and more tasks to my schedule to fill up my days. usually I am okay when I have a lot of tasks to fulfill, but sometimes it can get overwhelming. When life gets challenging, I sometimes forget to do mandatory assignments and can get behind in school. When things are challenging I let them bubble up and find myself in deeper trouble. When this begins, I remind myself that I need to cut back on some of the things I sign on to do. To bounce back, I just have to push myself to get back on track, even when I do not want to. Sometimes you have to stay focused even when you are stressed, I know future me will thank me for it.

When life gets challenging I tend to just focus on what it will be like after the challenge. If that doesnt work Ill just ignore the problem and hope it goes away. Lately Ive been trying to actively do more to solve the problems in my life. So that way it cant be too hard to manage.

I feel like I ground myself before making a plan to move forward. When life gets challenging I am guilty of letting it sit with me for a bit but then eventually I see no benefit in wallowing so I push through. Everyone is going through stuff and what makes me so special that it pauses all aspects of life? I feel like when things get challenging academically or physically I am much more capable of putting my feelings a side and get the job done. But when its emotional- I feel like I hit a wall. Or at least when I give into the emotional pressure I tend to crumble. So really as long as I keep the mind set of que ser ser and to trust myself and my capabilities it will all work out if I do my best. Because at the end of the day I cant ask more of myself than that.

For me, when life gets challenging, I tend to get scared. Sometimes I consider sunning from the challenge or challenges. But ultimately, I seek help. I have learned that support is always the best way for me to get out of a rut. If I am struggling, it tends to get worse when I do it alone. Have bc others to confide in makes it better. Sometimes it friends, but for me, its usually family. My family is my support system. Without them, I would be a lot worse off and I would struggle a lot. My siblings and my mom are my favorite people and I am there for them when they need me the same way they are there for me. When life gets challenging, I seek their support. They can usually help me through it or atleast make the situation less challenging. Its important to have a support system so I am glad to have them. I am grateful for all their love and help.

When life gets challenging, I first look to God for peace and comfort. I live and have God in my life, so I go to Him for help. I ask Him for guidance, clarification, and peace of mind. Not too long ago I was in a tough situation where I didn't know where I didn't like where I was in life and I felt stuck and complacent. I didn't know where I wanted to go or how my future looked or even where to even start. I believe I've gotten closer to Him recently so I've been more at peace. I've gotten some guidance on where to go. At first I wasn't going to graduate at SFState. I wanted to transfer to UCSF after my second semester but missed the application deadline. But now I plan on graduating here and then going for my Master's at UCSF. I center my life around God, and whatever happens in life, I know I'm in His hands and I don't need to worry.

When life gets challenging, I typically will disconnect with whatever is challenging me and put my energy into distracting myself from that. Recently, school has been a major stressor in my life. So as a result, whenever I'm done with schoolwork or class I'll take a moment to disconnect with it and not think about it, even it's a project due that night. I need a moment to just breathe and collect myself before starting up something challenging. I'm grateful to have a great support system around me full of people who have the same struggles or understand my struggles, that they are also there when I need a distraction. It could be as little as just walking to the nearest coffee shop to get some coffee/tea or even just sitting around somewhere and just talking. Those moments are what I need to destress from a challenging schedule or life.
