So as of right now, my ankle is sprained and what helps me get thru this is having a support system! My friends and family have offered their assistance and service to help mitigate my ankle sprain. It makes men relief that Im not going through this alone, I feel like I can overcome this because I was able to have a support system. Resting is also important to destress and saying no.

For me, when life gets challenging, I tend to do three things. Depending on the severity of the challenge, I resort to taking a visual break from work (if were speaking in school material). If I just need a good 20-30 minute break, Ill go on YouTube and watch a comedy show or anything related to a show Im watching at the moment to give me that comedic relief. If I need to separate myself from my house and forget what Im doing Ill go out on my bike and ride for a good 45 minutes to an hour through the canyons and hills on the East Bay. Now if I need a complete wipe of my mind to reset everything, Ill take my dog on a hike, take many pictures, find somewhere to sit for about 5 to 10 minutes and then head to get him and myself some in-n-out.

When life gets challenging I like to put my problems to the side and give myself a few hours to regenerate. That either means spend some time with favorite people or family, walk my dogs, read a book, or go play some sports. I enjoy to dirt bike ride in the winter or do water sports in the summer. Sometimes I need to take a step back to find myself to make my problems not as big and scary and while I still have to deal with my challenges when I get back it helps me feel less stressed about tackling them finally. Sometimes my challenges are just too big to handle alone so I have to lean on my people either for help or even just some support. Sometimes I just need to speak to someone about my challenges and get their input or support to help me realize my challenges are easy to overcome even though they may not feel like they are in the moment. I have to remind myself that while there will always be challenges in life these challenges are just another bump in the road and temporary soon they will be over and I will look back at overcoming them.

When life gets challenging I start hiking a lot more. I prioritize getting outside and getting enough sunlight, sleep, and exercise. I find that the only thing that really stresses me out a lot is school. Work thankfully is very much an in the moment kind of stress and not something I take home with me. I had taken about a year off from school and it was amazing to see how much easier life is. I swear there was more color to everything. When I came back to school it only took a few weeks for my face to get puffy again, my hair started falling out again, and everything looks grey, and I am always tired. Fortunately I know that school is not forever even though it feels that way. Lately, the stress from school has been getting to me so I have taken more time to get myself outdoors but I am also working too close to deadlines which is stressful. It will all hopefully be worth it though. I really look forward to graduating and not having to worry about balancing work and school anymore. I am even considering taking some time off after I graduate before going into OT school but I know that that is a dangerous move, especially if I am able to secure a job in the field of Kinesiology with just my bachelors. I have even been looking at certifications and work I can get into with just the associates I have. I really do not want to be in school anymore.

After life gets challenging I honestly like to just take a break and do something I like to clear my mind off. If i keep surrounding myself with my work then I will feel even worse about it. After clearing my head by going on a walk or just talking to a friend or even probably getting myself a treat I take the time to understand what is happening and why is it so challenging. I try and take a different approach to what I was doing to see if it will help change. There is nothing in life that is not challenging, everything you meet across can be a challenge. For others something you don't find it a challenge can be a challenge for them and the other way around. Other than reflecting on what you can do differently to overcome the challenge I tend to just talk to someone about it and see if they have some kind of advice. Getting some kind of help from someone often helps you out.

When life get challenging Ill do one of two things. One is nap and play video games or figure out how to solve the problem at hand. If Im feeling overwhelemed by school usually I will take a step back and try to figure out what needs to get done immediately and what I can hold off on. Then Ill usually get to work in the library and try to finish as much as I can within 5 hours. Usually this works and it works for studying to. Giving myself a lotted time to focus only on one thing. If Im dealing with challenges in my personal life I tend to just have a chill day in my room. Ill usually just watch some Netflix play some video games or draw. Im not one of those people that really focuses on my self and going deeper into fixing stuff. Im more of the what can I do to make myself happier in the moment. Also spending money. If I have a minor issue usually spending money on video games makes me feel better

In all honesty what I need changes day to day but some things i have found in moments of stress anxiety and all the other mind consumimg emotions i face are; sleeping, focused breathing, silence and sunshine, the ocean, a hug, music, art, or writing my thoughts out. These activities all either give me the chance to take a breath and decompress or are enjoyable acticities that make me find joy in life. Sometimes i eont lie its hard to even be able to lut in effort to do these things which is why sleep is that one that comes in clutch. When things are so bad that being concious is too much or not safe i will easily pass tf out until im ready to reemerge.

Life has been pretty challenging since I made the move to San Francisco. I have had plenty of opportunity to face adversity since moving here in terms of adjusting to my new life and getting used to my heavy coursework. I think when I face challenges, I take a step back to see the whole picture and try to take it step by step. It's important to take a step back and see the glass half full in times when you're facing challenges. I try to remind myself of how far I have come and the steps I have taken in my life and academically to be here today. I am blessed to be able-bodied and able to work to afford my higher education in such a beautiful city, and have been lucky to meet such wonderful people along the way. It is important for me to take time to relax and take care of myself as well.

I am here because my whole life I have dreamed of being a marine scientist & it seems like to get there I have to push through a million other science classes as well. I am here because my dad always wanted me to go to college & get the chances in life that he didnt. I am here because its a requirement, Im in my last semester of college (hopefully) & this is on of the last classes I need to graduate. I am here because I have already failed this class once before, depression + college = academic probation. But it also means determination to be better, to never have to experience what that failure hole felt like ever again. After this I will be graduated shortly after being married & for the first time in my life I wont be a student. For the first time it wont be whats your major? its going to be whats your degree?, from student to alumnus. I almost dont know what to do with myself, up to this point 90% of my life has been student, but Im so excited for what lies ahead. I just hope that wherever I am that I am getting to do what I love with the people who love me.

I am here ultimately because I am required to take a year of physics in order to take Human Physiology. I've spent some time thinking about why physics is needed as a prerequisite to Human Physiology because what I've learned in physics, so far, I haven't yet been able to tie into functions of the systems of the human body, but maybe that will come later. As for why am I in this lab, I think it's a good way to apply the concepts we learn in lecture to real life tangible objects. I hope to gain a new perspective on how objects exist in the real world and how scientists have figured these things out.

Why am I here, I am here because I am a student at San Francisco State University, I am here because it is required for my major, My major is biology so this is why I'm here, also I am here to learn more and more about physics, I don't know much as I have only taken a physics class in my high school year once, so this is all new to me and it is very exciting, I always wanted to learn a bit more into how the world works and why they work that way like how gravity and all the different kind of energy does the things it does, It's very cool to me and weird how things are they way they are, I am ready to learn and be the best student I can be in this physics class because I am here today in this class.

I believe Im here to be a good daughter, older sister, and granddaughter to my family. I think Im here to be a good daughter to my parents who have supported me and what I want to do in life. Im here to be a role model and guide to my younger siblings as they also find out what they want to do in life as well as help them grow. Im also here to be there for my best friends and be able to help support them and be there for them just like we were when we were younger. I think Im also here to be able to help people in the future since I want to work in the medical field. In summary, I think Im here to support others and be good to them. I think it is also what I aspire to be and hope others feel the same way about me that I think of myself.

Why am I here? It's a question I ask myself every day. The difficulties of life can make it so easy to wish I was never born, that I never had to worry about grades or money. I find myself wishing there was some goal to look forward to, but it can feel like there is nothing except death. Despite this, I am still here. I don't want to commit suicide, and I wake up every day. I think it is the simple instinct for survival that explains why we are here. Although its hard, every day I wake up and try my best. The world will leave me by if I don't.

I am answering the question "Why I am here" in a physics aspect. I am here because I want to learn more about physics and see how it is connected to my Kinesiology major. I have never taken a physics class ever before in high school so I am excited to learn more about all the concepts of physics and how it is connected to my real world. In the three weeks of school, I have already learned a couple of physics rules that are applied to our everyday lives, like vectors and force. Now, answering the question "Why am I here" in a school aspect. I am a student at San Francisco State because I had the opportunity to play softball and get an education in the degree I wanted. I want to pursue a career in Athletic Training for Major League sports, colleges, and other divisions like high school.

Why am I here? This is a question I often ask myself. At times, I struggle with balancing my personal life and college responsibilities, making it difficult to prioritize self-care alongside my job and studies. However, I've come to realize that I must navigate these challenges to become the person I aspire to be in the future. As for my class, I am a criminal justice major, and this course is a requirement for my degree.

The reason why I'm here is because I need Physics for my major, which is Kinesiology. I also genuinely enjoy this class, including the lecture portion, because the stuff we learn in both sections is pretty fun. I like learning new things, especially forces, since we all use it every day where we go and whatever we do. It is always implemented in our daily actions, such as walking or working out. Since I took a physics class in my Junior year of High School, I already know the gist of physics. In my Senior year, I was enrolled in AP Physics, but I dropped the class two weeks later because I thought I wouldn't need the class for college. Once I got to college, I checked my roadmap for my major, and it said that I needed to take physics, so I enrolled for the class in my second year spring semester. I'm glad that I'm taking the class right now because I am actually interested in learning about physics, and it's also a fun class to be in.

I've always wanted to help others and have had an interest in research, medicine, and understanding how things work at a deeper level. Science has always fascinated me, how small genetic changes can have big impacts, how populations adapt over time, and how we can use research to solve real-world problems. That curiosity led me to where I am now. Wanting to be a microbiologist and more so a clinical laboratory scientist is something i've always wanted to accomplish. I think Im here because I want to make a difference. Whether its through microbiology, or uncovering something that could help future generations of both humans and wildlife, I feel like science is my way of contributing to the world around me. We are the next generation of scientific advances and it is such an interesting time in science with how rapidly technology is advancing. I am excited to not only learn in this class this semester but also meet other like minded individuals.

Why am I taking Physics 112? I am currently a biology major with a concentration in ecology, evolution, conservation, but I am unsure of what exactly Ill be doing with my degree after graduation. One of the appeals of science for me is how vast it is. There are so many fields of study for me to undertake. I believe that is why physics is a requirement for science majors. It is a fundamental pillar for not just science, but even in everyday lifephysics is everywhere, even/ESPECIALLY in places we dont think about. That is why its so important to have at least a basic understanding of it. I imagine that the skills and knowledge I acquire here will have far more applications than it appears. Also, collaborating on lab projects with others helps to cultivate knowledge from different perspectives, which is another important aspect of science. That is why this class is important.

I am here because this class is a pre-requisite for grad school. After I graduate with my bachelor's in science, I plan to attend physical therapy school or get my master's in athletic training. In order to be accepted to either one of these programs I have to complete and pass this class. I am not only taking this class because it is required, but also because I want to learn how things work. In the few weeks in this class I have realized that physics is related to almost anything and it is something we deal with every day. It has been interesting to see how much more detail there is to simple things like moving a box or simply walking. Being in this class has challenged my thinking and really think about how and why certain things work they do. So overall, I think I'm here to challenge my knowledge and apply what I learn in my everyday life and future education.

I feel like my purpose is to just enjoy life to the fullest and living to my full potential. I don't really give the question of "Why am I here?" much thought day to day, but I know what I want to do and feel in my life. I like to do the small things I love and things that make me feel good and confident in myself. When there are chances to, I like to do big things like travel and going places to enjoy myself or with people I love and care about. There are hard things to learn in life and it is difficult to navigate through life sometimes as expected, but the struggles are part of life and it's good to learn from your struggles and mistakes. It's also good to push yourself and make sure you are responsible and taking care of things because the only person who can take of you is yourself. This is all what I think life is about and even though I am unsure of what career I want to go into, I try not to overwhelm myself with worry about that because life will take me wherever I need to go and I will figure it out eventually.

I'm here because I want to go into the medical field. To understand the human body, I have to understand many areas of science. In my high school anatomy class, we touched many different subjects, including biology, chemistry, physics, and math. I have to have a good foundation in all of these areas in order to successfully heal the body. An example of this is X-rays and MRIs. I think it's also helpful for any student. My high school physics class was more logic than anything else. A lot of my classes were just memorization, but physics actually required you to improve your critical thinking and logic skills. It was less about studying and more about practicing. I think it's extremely important to learn how to think this way and not just learn the way you're typically expected to learn in core classes like history or algebra. I hope to get a good understanding of physics from this class so that I can use it in my professional career, as well as improving my thinking skills overall and making me a better problem-solver.

I am here to live and learn. Moving to San Francisco was one of the biggest decisions I have made in my life. I am glad I decided to step out of my comfort zone and spread my wings. As a public health major pursuing optometry, I must take physics and other science classes such as a variety of biology courses. So far, my journey here in San Francisco has been wonderful. I do miss home from time to time, but I have learned to love it here. There is so much to explore and so many sights to see. There is also a wide variety of good food here, which I am super excited to try. My education journey at San Francisco State has been great. I finished my last semester strong and aim to finish this one strong as well. This physics course is my first physics course ever, so I am excited to learn more as the semester progresses. Looking forward to all the labs and what they have to offer. :)

"Why am I here?" I am here because I want to be a medical student and this class would be a requirement. I do enjoy physics though I even took it as an elective my senior year, I wanted at least a crash course to understand some subjects before college physics classes as well, and its even more enjoyable when I actually understand the concepts and can solve problems efficiently. I am here because I want to improve my math skills, I take calculus and it feels like an extra review when Im struggling in physics or calculus to go to lectures because I either get them explained further or get to see it applied to a real world example. I also want to understand how things in the medical field like how certain radiation machines affect the body or how certain medical machinery works and hopefully taking this class will help me with jobs in the medical field in the future.

I am at SF State because I want to get a degree in Kinesiology, because I want to pursue Physical Therapy. I am in Physics 111 because I need that course for DPT schools, and therefore I am in 112. I think my purpose is to be in physical therapy, and it has been something of interest for me for a few years. I've enjoyed the classes that I have taken to this point to prepare myself for a DPT program, and I think that has allowed me to feel connected to that as a future path for me. For physics I am really interested in growing what I know, and I do want to understand the world around me. I think it can feel quite overwhelming and intimidating, but I think that I am in the right spot and can definitely handle it. As for being in San Francisco, I moved here for the school, but it has surprised me in many happy ways. I could see myself staying here for a long time, and I hope to be able to do so.

The question for this journal reflective assignment really made me reflect on what is motivating me throughout my educational journey. I am taking physics because it is required of me for my degree. I don't believe I'd take physics if it wasn't a requirement. For that reason, it is my first time being enrolled in a physics class. However, I'm here at SF state in pursuit of my bachelor's degree in Kinesiology. It is my second step in getting closer to my ultimate goal. My final goal is to achieve my Master's in occupational therapy. In reality, the reason I continue to study is to one day look back and say "I did that" and to be able to honor my parents'sacrifice of coming to this country in hopes of a better future. I can't wait for the day in which I can hand my diploma to them and make them proud. My family drives me to be better, to do better, and to achieve what seems impossible for me. Therefore, if I had to answer " Why am I here?" I'd say I'm here for my family and I.

I am here because it is one of the classes that I need to take for my major, which is Kinesiology. Although, I need this for my major, physics has always been a topic that I wanted to learn bout. Physics is important to learn about because of all the cause and effects it has in society. It can help with anyone in the medical field because of the fact that we are learning on the fundamentals. We are able to understand the principals of the foundations of medicine and technology if needed for the career that we would like to join. At first, I did not think that physics would not be important, but the more I have been in lab and lecture, it makes sense on why medical students need to learn in this class. So, I can say that I am in this class in order to understand my career in a better sense and is a requirement too.

I feel that I am here for a major reason of fulfilling my major requirements. But another reason that I am seeing that I am here, is to be able to connect real world problems with physics concepts. I have felt that lecture and lab have been especially helpful in finding the relationship between the two. Additionally, by applying this mindset it has allowed me to better understand the objectives of each of lecture and/or lab. Even though I can, at times understand how real world and physics apply to one another, the subject in general can be difficult for me to understand. To expand on that, I feel that another reason I am here is to use my resources such as my lab instructor and lecturer, as well as fellow classmates to better understand the subject we are talking about for that day. Reflecting on this idea, has allowed me to truly understand by goal for this course and I hope to find that at the end of the semester that question Why am I here leads me to success.

Reflective Journaling #1 I am here because this class will take me one step closer to the goals I have set for myself. I want to become a physical therapist, and to get into a physical therapy program, I need to take a year of general physics with labs. This class is one of my core requirements to get in. I struggled with physics in high school, but when reading the syllabus for this class, I was genuinely excited. The topics and experiments are interesting. Doing experiments each week will help better my understanding of the subject, and hopefully, I will not struggle as much as I did a couple of years ago. In fact, I am already starting to see a change. Having the lab on Wednesdays prepares me for classes on Thursdays. We learned about motion and velocity this week, which made it easier for me to understand the material when our professor taught it to the class on Thursday. So, I am here to learn and achieve my goals.

I'm taking PHYS 111 and PHYS 112 because it is a major requirement. Other than that, I wouldn't really be taking physics. So far though, I like that we're going over basic physics concepts. At UC Davis (my old university), we started off with energy and entropy, which felt a little weird. I wonder if this curriculum makes it easier for students to learn physics. I wonder how different in the other general physics classes are, since this one is for the biology/health track. I don't completely understand the connection between physics and biology. To me, physics feels like the philosophy of movement. Couldn't I just understand the nature of how things in the biological world work? I suppose we learn it so we have a tool to help us problem solve/troubleshoot something like a molecular process that requires physics knowledge. However, it's interesting how biology majors in the Philippines don't learn physics (at least in the 90s), yet our doctors and nurses are highly sought after. I like how interactive physics labs are. I get to move around while explore physics concepts. A friend once told me that she found physics easier than OChem. I wonder if that is true.

My short term goal for the next year is to graduate from SFSU with my B.S in Biology. This class is helping me achieve that goal because physics 1 is a stepping stone for physics 2 which is both a graduation requirement and a prerequisite for Human Physiology, which will be my GWAR class. My career goal is to be a Physician Assistant and some concepts in physics class thus far like velocity and movement can be related to body functions such as joint movement and the direction and speed of blood flow to and from the heart. So there are some aspects of physics that will help me better understand the mechanics of the human body.

What are my goals, I want to say my goal for this class is to learn and expand my knowledge of physics as a whole, as I don't know that much about so that would be very exciting and cool to learn more and more about. Basically, just learn how the world works and how things are the way they are like gravity. How is this class helping me achieve these goals, This class is helping me achieve my goals by teaching me exactly what I want to learn, how the world works,and why things are the way they are like gravity. Also, I think these classes are kinda fun for me because we get to do labs, and doing things that are fun is a fun way of learning about physics which I like. So I think in the end I will get a better understand of physics in this class which will result in me reaching my goals

My goals in life as well as in this class are to become more confident in myself and in my choices. I think this class could help me achieve these goals by helping me be able to think critically and force me to be confident in my thinking and decisions. To me every lab is a way to challenge in myself and trust what I know. Throughout each lab we are tasked to set up a procedure and record our findings and as well as answer questions and if we dont know something or how to do it we have to ask the teacher. This class also can help me be confident in myself by making me have to ask questions if I dont know something. Being able to be confident in what I know and still being able to want to grow more and learn more will help me be able to achieve my goals.

What are my goals? How is this class helping me achieve these goals? I have always been driven by learning and hoping to set myself a good future. My big goal is to hopefully one day graduate from pharmacy school and become a pharmacist. I want to help others and talk to people in the community, and I feel like that would be great for me. Despite this, it won't be easy. To get into pharmacy school, I will need good grades, recommendations, and experience. Currently, I am on track, studying Biology, taking classes in chemistry and math, and not failing. I think that physics class will open my mind and give me a new way of thinking about the world around me. In addition, I think it will help me master my mathematics skills which I will definitely need one day. To reach my goal, I won't give up. I hope to find work as a pharmacy technician soon so that when I do apply to graduate school I already have experience.

My goals are to complete my classes with proficiency, acknowledgment, and understanding to then help me in my future with my professional career. I want to strive to be an Athletic Trainer for college and professional sports. Another goal I have is to graduate because nobody in my family has completed college and this milestone in my life will be amazing to not only me but my family as well. Lastly, my goal for this class is to really understand how to use the equipment that we use in labs because they are a bit confusing but I know I can understand the use of the equipment. This class helps me achieve this goal because it is a requirement for my undergraduate bachelor's degree. In addition, because this class is a requirement also for GRAD school I really want to obtain the content from this class with hopes that it will apply to my career in the future (which it will since I want to go into the sports field).

What are my goals? well, I have a lot of goals, but the main one as of right now is passing all my classes and being able to graduate college; even though this class is not related to what I want to become in the future, during the times that I have done the labs with my group, I came to the realization that this course is helping me a lot with critical thinking. It for sure connects with my desires for the future. My goal, besides graduating college, is to pass the LSAT exam, which is offered around two times per year, one at the beginning of the year and the last towards the end of the year. I have done the free sample tests, to see how those exams work and to be able to get an answer correct. You have to do a lot of critical thinking because some of the questions sound confusing and feel like they are playing with your head, but you simply need to analyze what has been given to you. I want the outcome of this class to help me learn more about physics and improve my critical thinking skills.

To learn more about the basic rules of the universe in physics class. I've always been interested in motion, energy, and force, especially when it comes to sports and how people move. As I work toward becoming an athletic trainer, physics will help me understand how the body moves and how outside forces like impact and acceleration affect athletes. It's the perfect way for me to work with athletes and study kinesiology at the same time. This class is helping me reach those goals in small ways. Biomechanics is one of the things I study, and motion is directly related to it. When we talk about forces and energy transfer, it helps me understand how bodies move and how that applies to sports. I'm also learning how to think critically and analytically in this class, which will help me at school and at work. Not only learn equations, but also understand how they relate to kinesiology and sports performance.

My goal is to contribute to society in a way that positively impacts the world and brings us closer to finding cures for medicines. I want to contribute to science as a scientist. Medicine requires knowledge of a variety of different subjects. Needing to know how cells and reactions work with each other. Having also to know dosages. Physics, to me, helps us understand the things around us and why things are the way they are. Through labs, I am able not just to learn the concepts but directly apply them in real life. The hands-on experience will set a good foundation for being a scientist. More than just coursework, this class reminds me why I pursued this path in the first place. It reconnects me with my curiosity about nature and striving to use science for meaningful conservation efforts. I am eager to continue learning about physics.

My goal is to graduate with my bachelor's degree in biology, but I am unsure on what exactly I want to do with my degree after I graduate. My hope is that this class will help me to explore my options by expanding my knowledge on physics. In general, biology doesn't delve too deeply into the mechanics of physics. The things taught in general physics classes are not heavily utilized in most fields of biology, or at least the fields I'm interested in. That is why I'm interested in this class, because it will be a look into a field of science that's slightly detached from mine. Practicing physics in lecture and in a laboratory setting will help me to determine whether it's something of interest to me, and even something that I could look further into in the future. I have always been discouraged by all of the math involved in physics, but I will never know for sure if it's for me if I don't try.

My goal in the future is to become either an Athletic Trainer or a physical therapist. In order to get into graduate school for either profession I need to take and pass this course. Not only is this course required for my major and grad school, it is also important to understand physics for my profession. Another one of my goals for the future is to become a softball coach. I think understanding physics could help me be a successful coach because I would have a deeper understanding on how things work and move. Another one of my goals is to graduate college. I come from a family where college was never an option because it was to expensive. So being in this position and having the opportunity to further my education is a blessing. Therefore, being able to graduate with a college degree and start my dream career would be one of the biggest accomplishments in my family.

This physics class is helping me in achieving my goals because I've never taken a physics class before this one and I wanted to this semester. I was looking forward to learning about physics finally. In this class, I also really enjoy working with my tablemates. They are kind and friendly and we all work very well together as a team on the lab assignments. Being in a good environment like this benefits me because I am always looking for ways to improve my social skills and my teamwork abilities. Improving in those aspects is always one of my goals and something that is important to keep in mind. This class is something new to experience for me in many ways. Overall, I am enjoying this class way more than I expected, and I am doing well in the class as well, which are both great achievements so far for me.

My goal is to go to medical school. I think physics is absolutely necessary to understand the human body. I already notice a lot of connections. I took an anatomy class my senior year of high school, and I realized you basically have to understand all the core science subjects to understand anatomy and physiology. We were already going into concepts like pressure and flow rate. I took AP Physics in high school and I didn't notice as many connections to the human body, but once I started this class I really did. I think our professor made a conscious effort to connect physics concepts to the human body because a lot of us are biology or kinesiology majors. From the beginning, these concepts were introduced. For example, when we talked about the amount of pressure our bodies can take to examine if a car accident could be survived. The most notable example is Bernoulli's equation, I think. We specifically talked about how an aneurysm comes from increased pressure and causes an artery to rupture, or how a constricted blood vessel comes from decreased pressure, causing it to collapse. Lab is helping me explore all of these topics in a very in-depth and hands-on way, and I know that as my classes progress I'll be doing a lot more labwork, especially in medical school.

My goals are to graduate with my bachelors degree in Public Health and go on to optometry school. My end goal is to be a practicing optometrist. I want to help people and serve my community for allowing me to grow up in a diverse and culturally rich environment. In the end, I want to be married, have a family, and have a house of my own. This will all be possible with a degree and a well-paying profession. This class is helping me achieve my goals because it is fulfilling a prerequisite for optometry school. This physics class is also teaching me hands-on skills and real life scenarios that physics plays a role in. Physics is in our everyday lives and understanding it allows us to see the world differently and allows us to think critically about everyday events. In the end, this class will have taught me several ideas and principles that will be relevant to my life and profession. These concepts will be something I carry with me from now on.

My goals consist of furthering my education and hopefully getting into med school and becoming a pediatrician I live being able to help people especially those who cant speak up for themselves like children. My goals right now though are to pass all my classes especially this class as its one of the many stepping stones I will take in my academic career. I love physics even though it can be super confusing at times. This class will help me become more curious and theoretical but also calculating i. the way that numbers have to be precise and certain charts go for certain measurements. It will also help me interact with other people in my field and other scientists. I also want to have experience working or at least interacting with physics concepts so the labs are especially important. This is why physics is helping me achieve my goals by furthering my curiosity and helping me learn the concepts behind them.

My goals are to get a degree in Kinesiology with a focus on Movement and Exercise Science. This class will help me to achieve that goal as it is a graduation requirement, but I have actually already filled that requirement. This class is helping me to fulfill requirements to apply to a DPT program (Doctorate of Physical Therapy), which requires Physics I and Physics II. This class is the first step in finishing those prerequisites, and it has been an interesting class for sure. I think this will definitely help me in future classes, such as my next physics class, but also my kinesiology classes when we are closely observing and studying movement and motion of the human body. Many of the main ideas we cover in this class will definitely be applicable then. This class helps me to achieve many different goals that I have, and I also want to be successful in this class. For me, I want to achieve an A in this class, so that is something that I keep in mind when I am studying and completing my work. I don't just want a A, I also want to understand the material.

My goal for this semester is to finish the semester with a 4.0 gpa. Thus, making my goal for this class to receive an A at the end of the course. However, I do have a bigger goal than receiving a good grade. My ultimate goal is to be able to absorb as much knowledge as I can. As previously stated, this is my first physics course, meaning I don't know a lot about the study of physics. Being in a lab for physics has helped me understand concepts better because it is hands-on. It does become a little difficult when the topics aren't discussed in lecture before, but the brief discussions we have before lab help. My career goal is to become an occupational therapist. I would like to learn more about ways in which physics will apply to my future career. I know there is a field of bio-mechanics in which physics would apply. I would be very interested in gaining more knowledge on the subject. Nevertheless, I want to be able to finish the course and know I've gained valuable knowledge.

My goals are to graduate from SFSU by next year with a good GPA overall and with a minor in Athletic Coaching. After, I want to get into a DPT Program where I would be able to become a Physical Therapist. That is my goal in life. I want to become a Physical Therapist and hopefully I would be able to specialize in sports, so that I can work with a big league like NFL or NBA. This class is helping me achieve these goals because it is helping for the first goal, which is to graduate. This class is a requirement for me to graduate, but the more I have been in it, the more I have noticed how it can help me in my career. When learning about vectors and pushing/pulling with friction, it has shown that I would need to understand this concept when helping my patients.

My goals for this course are to understand how physics relates to major in biology. I am a little confused as to why this is requirement for my major but I am grateful to be able to have a different understanding outside of biology. Another goal of mine is to obtain in A in this course. I feel that this can be easily done by the curve the instructor has provided for this course. Additionally, all of the extra work for this course such as the in class worksheets, which is an excellent and innovative way to truly understand the material. It helps with sticking and being more clear. Lastly, the weekly labs are very helpful to help me reach this goal of getting an A in this course and understanding how physics is relative. I feel that for the most part the instructors for this course have been very helpful in helping me understand physics as it is a complex subject to wrap my head around. Though my goal is to get an A in this course, I hope that by doing so it allows me to truly understand physics and apply it to my major or area of study.

My goal is to get into a DPT program and become a physical therapist.This class is helping me achieve this goal by helping me complete prerequisites for the program, and preparing me for some future courses. Every DPT program requires one year of General Physics. So, by taking this class, I will be halfway in completing that goal. As for future courses, biomechanics is one of the core requirements for my major. The prerequisites for that course include General Physics I and II. Biomechanics largely uses concepts from general physics, so taking and understanding this current course will definitely help prepare me for that one. This class is also helping me to some degree in my other current classes. For example, I am taking anatomical kinesiology where some physics concepts are being used to describe human body movements. I have also been able to connect some concepts to my chemistry course, which is helpful.

My goals are to finish my degree, gain professional experience while in undergrad, and get a job that will allow me financial stability. This class would only help me achieve the first goal. As a biology major, I need to complete physics as one of the core subjects. As we complete labs that challenge our intuition on Physics concepts, I am able to understand the theory better and see witness how it's applied in real-life scenarios. Particularly, I think exploring the topics we learn through practice problems in class and more hands-on examples in lab will cement Physics for me. In a way, being in a lab and working with peers will also help me gain experience, as one usually needs to be able to coordinate and collaborate in a job setting. Right now, that looks like assigning roles for each groupmate and corroborating/communicating/sharing our understanding of what we learn with each other.

When life gets challenging I visit my family. They are only a couple hours away by car and Im fortunate enough to be able to visit them often. Life has been very very hard lately and Im trying to make sense of it, and visiting with my mom and hearing her perspective helps me a lot.

What I do when life gets challenging, I try to preserve and try my best to push through it all full force but sometimes I cant and life is pushing back even harder, so then I will reconsider what I'm doing and take a break, go for a walk , eat some food just enjoy my self for a little while, then I will attack life again and I will try everything in my power to accomplish what I needed to accomplish , it will be hard but I know I can do it, I finish what I need to finish no matter what because I know I can do it, after I do I will let my self relax and enjoy the rest of my day worry free. I sometimes also do is ask for help from my classmates or my friends and sometimes that helps a lot asking someone to help you

When life gets challenging I like to take a step back from whatever Im doing and reflect and collect myself. For example if Im really stressed about exams or a quiz I give myself an allotted amount out of time to just let my brain relax and calm myself down. If thats not working I also will confide in my friends and let them know the situation and get their thoughts, opinions, and advice. Usually by then theyre able to help me through it and be able to see the bright side of the situation or help me with how I should approach the situation. So essentially when life gets challenging I try to keep a level head and if I cant then I try to confide in my friends to be able to get their outsiders point of view and just help me calm down and distract me from whatever the situation is that is having me stressed out and challenging me.

Being in college, away from home, I sometimes find myself really struggling with life. There is a couple of things I do when life get challenging and they are: I hangout with my close group of friends, try to find some time in my day to do self-wellness stuff like clean and organize my things, or try do new adventorous things. Doing these certain activites really help me because it allows me to really take my mind away from all the stressors that I have in my life like a really big exam coming up in one of my classes or having to juggle school, practice, and work. I really do find myself being able to relax and really destress after completing the challenging obstacles that I am faced with then after rewarding myself with a bit of fun and joy like doing something new and fun with the friends I have made away from home. I definitely had to learn new ways to cope with different situations and this is how I cope when life gets challenging.

When life becomes challenging, I often find myself panicking because I dont know how to handle certain situations. I tend to overthink and focus on negative outcomes. However, once I manage to cope with these feelings, I like to keep myself distracted from the emotions Im experiencing. I have a dog named Yoshi, and I usually take him for walks or spend time with my cat. When thats not the case, I try to escape from whatever intensifies my feelings. I listen to music, take naps, or play the piano or chess to keep my mind engaged. As a college student, I often face difficulties with certain classes that I struggle to understand. Balancing school and my job, where I work more than 40 hours a week, can be overwhelming. Despite the challenges of combining these responsibilities and studying to grasp what is being taught in class, the activities I mentioned have helped me significantly.

I often feel like everything is too much to handle when things get tough. I often shut myself off and let my mind wander, thinking about all the things I can't change. I keep telling myself to slow down, though. While taking a deep breath, I try to focus on just one thing at a time to break things down. I look for something I can do, even if it's just getting out of bed or going for a walk. Anything that makes me feel like I'm making progress is good. Besides that, I ask for help. Being honest isn't always easy for me, but when I do, telling a friend or family member what's on my mind helps me see things more clearly. I tell myself that hard times don't last forever and that it's okay to not understand everything right away. When things are hard, I try to remember my goal which is to keep going, to keep learning, and to keep growing, even when life seems too much. They make me who I am because they push me to do my best.

When life get challenging or overwhelming at times it can be hard to take a step back and just breathe. I used to handle stress and stressful situations a lot differently than I do know. I do think as you get older, you have many more responsibilities that can cause stress. Some ways i've learned to deal with stress and feeling overwhelmed is sleep, breath work and taking a step back to regain perspective. It is important to remind yourself that this is a temporary feeling and it will pass. I tend to like to isolate myself and really prioritize self care. It really helps when I can shut down and really unwind by myself. I constantly remind myself "one day at a time" and that I am exactly where I am supposed to be in life. We all have our own stressors in life and I think learning how to manage that is the best thing you can do for yourself. Although at times managing stress is easier said than done.

When life gets challenging I have to remember to take a step back and breathe. Challenges come from problems that arise, and when they pile up on each other its easy to get lost in the mess. College students especially are prone to allowing school, work, time with friends, and time with family, to all become high priorities and overtake their life. Being able to take a step back and breathe allows me to reassess whatever situation I'm in and look at the bigger picture. It is almost like a soft reset for me. I tend to work better after I give myself a small break, because I can look at my problems with fresh eyes and see things from a different angle, which opens up the possibility of solutions that I'd never considered before. There are also other useful methods to cope with challenge. Talking it out with loved ones, or partaking in relaxing hobbies can be therapeutic and helpful as well.

I struggle with anxiety, so when life gets challenging, I sometimes tend to internally shut down. I get overwhelmed when I feel like I don't have control over my life or certain situation. However, over the years I have learned how to manage and cope with my anxiety and not let my emotions or thoughts get the best of me. So, when I feel overwhelmed, I focus on breathing and tell myself that I'm okay and that everything will be okay. I then create a list of things I need to do, from most important to least important and I focus on things I can control. I feel like when life gets hard it's important to focus on one thing at a time and everything else will fall in place. I also feel like it's important to have a good support system that you can lean on when things get challenging.

When life gets challenging sometimes, I like to take some time for myself. I like to take a break from homework for example and do things that make me happy such as coloring, taking a nice long shower, go for a walk, watch a nice show or movie, spend time with a friend etc. Those are just some of the things I can think of at the top of my head that are my "go-to" things I enjoy doing when I feel stressed out. It is hard to lose sight of your hobbies when life gets hard but I always try to keep a good balance so that I don't get super stressed out and feel exhausted from day to day responsibilities. Usually I try not to spend money doing things to make myself happy because that would just make me worry about how much money I'm spending, so I usually just try to do small self-care things for myself at home and treating myself well and feeding myself nice meals.

When life gets challenging, I usually try to find something to relax me for a moment. For example, I like to watch a movie, YouTube video, or listen to a song. This helps me get in a better mindset. Once I feel more calm and in control, I start with easier assignments to slowly work into it. I think it's really important to know when you need a break. Forcing yourself to work when it just feels like too much won't help, it'll just overwhelm you. I find that when I overwork myself, it's easier for me to make silly mistakes. It's better to let your mind rest for a while and ease back into your work flow. This looks different for everyone, for me, it's usually some form of entertainment because it's an easy distraction. For others, they might like to do a hobby or something like that, but I think it's better to do something simple.

When life gets challenging, I take a step back from everything and prioritize my well-being. I take time to myself to make sure my mental health is at its best and I make sure I am happy. Taking time to myself entails watching movies, hanging out with my friends and family, playing with my dogs, baking, and crafting. These things make me realize how enjoyable life can be with or without the challenges. It allows me to reflect on my life and think about my goals and plans for the future. It also allows me to figure out how I am going to address the challenges in my life. I believe it is really important to talk to people and open up about what is going on in your life. It helps to share things you feel comfortable sharing. Sharing allows for deep reflection, advice, and even comfort from your loved ones. So when life gets challenging, I do what I love and I do what makes me happy.

When life gets challenging I like to go back to my roots and take time to myself to think of my challenge and what I can do to solve it. Sometimes to be honest I feel like giving up but most of the time I try to think positive and try to remind myself that theres always a solution even when it doesnt seem the most conventional. My life always gets even more challenging when I start to worry or get anxious about my problem so its always important to me to break down the harder parts into small chunks that I feel like I can handle at the moment, from easy to hard just so I can get the handle of what Im doing and finally be ready after because Ill get a grasp of what Im doing. Thats mostly what I do when life gives me problems always keep a positive attitude and do what I can handle at the moment. Its important to push yourself but always to the amount you can handle.

Usually when life gets challenging I tend to focus more on what is important to me, as that will usually remind me of why I am working so hard and may feel overwhelmed. For example if my classes start to feel difficult, I remind myself of why I am in that class, why I want to do well, why I want to know that material, etc. That usually grounds me and allows me to not feel so overwhelmed by small details and instead understand I am just on a pathway to reach the goals I have set for myself. If other things are starting to feel difficult or overwhelming that may not be so easily talked down I usually turn to people I trust to confide in. Specifically my parents, sister, boyfriend, or friends are all people that I trust and feel comfortable discussing when I am feeling like I need someone to talk to. Usually they are able to provide some advice, comfort, or perspective that allows me to feel okay with the fact that life will always get challenging or else we would never be making progress and life would be pretty boring.

When life gets challenging I like to remember to take everything one day at a time. If my day is exhausting and I feel drained, I like to take things One thing at a time. One of my biggest lessons I've had to learn is that some things are out of my control. As much as I want to solve something, everything is going to work out the way it's meant to. One thing that has helped me a lot when life gets challenging is praying. I'm very big on my faith and in trusting God. I believe everything that happens is because he allows it and there is a purpose no matter the situation. My faith does tremble at times when it doesn't seem like there is a way out, but I've always been able to find comfort through prayer. To conclude, I'm a big believer in that there is a lesson in every challenging moment we experience throughout our lives. If life didn't get challenging, we wouldn't learn and be who we are.

When life gets challenging, I tend to stay to myself and try to disassociate so that I tend to be able to focus. After isolating myself, I am able to process the variables of what is happening and see what I can do to make my life more manageable. Being able to process all of the events or things that I may have to do helps me see which I should focus on now and which I can focus on later. I tend to tell myself that life is not gonna be as challenging like this at times. It is for a learning experience and it is gonna help me become stronger or to learn from the challenges. Another thing that helps me when life gets challenging is talking to my therapist about the sudden challenges. Talking to my therapist allows me to feel validated in my feelings and gives me new perspectives on the challenges.

When life gets challenging, I will make time for myself by getting outdoors, exceeding, or taking self-care days. Some other things I like to do are "mindfulness" moments, where if I am having a difficult time in the moment I will take breaths and a moment to relax. Oftentimes I am forgetful that I when I am in challenging moments it feels never-ending so I try to remind myself that there are solutions and that I can work through them. Some other things I do, are talk to family and friends whenever I am having a hard in and outside of my academics.I think that is very important to remember to make moments and mental health days to avoid burnout, which may result in a decline in mental health. I do find when I take moments/days for myself I have less challenging moments and am better able to get through difficult times.

When life gets challenging, I initially find myself getting stressed out. But then, when I have had some time to think about the situation, I try to do something about it. By this time, I realize that stressing over the challenge is just going to further waste time, and the only way to actually overcome it is if I actively start taking steps to confront the problem and solve it. Another source of comfort to me at that time is my family and friends. I look to them for advice, and I often find it very useful to have multiple perspectives on the situation as it gives me the opportunity to look at it from different angles and gain some insight. I also find it helpful to think about my end goals from time to time. Last semester, I learned in one of my classes that frequently revisiting your goals keeps you motivated. So, in that way, it helps me keep going on despite facing challenges.

When life gets hard, I try to turn to positive coping mechanisms as much as I can. An example is going for a walk outside to get some sunlight and fresh air. Sitting on the grass and taking in my surroundings or watching people idly pass by is related to this practice as well. These are ways for me to ground myself, figuratively and literally. Often, when I am having a hard time, I'm overwhelmed by a lot of stressful and racing thoughts. Being outside lifts off all the weight I am experiencing and allows me to feel less congested. It also reminds me that my current reality is not burning down like I thinkand feel like it is. Another coping mechanism is being honest with myself. I take a seat back, check in with myself, and ask what is I want to do during a moment of stress. This allows me to problem-solve and get to the root of what is troubling me. If I know what I am struggling against, I can create a plan to follow to feel better. Of course, this requires facing the hard and reminding myself that turning to temporary dopamine boosts, such as scrolling on my phone, will not help me as much as I want it to. Lastly, I talk to loved ones so that I don't have to bear all the brunt of a challenge. Communicating my current mental and physical state to significant others also allows me to feel seen and not have to be quietly struggling.

I'm here because I really want to get physics. It's always been something that's kind of buzzed around in my head, but I've never felt like I truly understood it. I'm hoping this class will change that. I want to go beyond just memorizing formulas and actually grasp how everything fits together. I'm super interested in seeing how physics shows up in everyday life. Like, how does my phone work? Or why does a bike stay upright? I want to see the connections, to understand how the stuff we learn in class applies to the real world. That's what makes it exciting for me. I'm here to learn, to ask a ton of questions, and to figure out how physics makes the world tick. I want to leave this class feeling like I actually understand something that used to seem really confusing, and maybe even find a way to use that knowledge down the road.

I am here to learn and gain experiences that will contribute to my personal growth and future career. As an aspiring physician and researcher, studying the natural world will help me become a more informed and knowledgeable professional. College provides the opportunity to explore a range of topics, allowing me to make educated decisions about my future. It's also a time to meet diverse people and network with professionals both on and off campus. As a first-generation student, I feel a responsibility to honor the sacrifices of those who came before me by breaking the generational barriers that have kept my family from educational spaces like universities. Ultimately, I am here to enjoy the journey, learn from my mistakes, grow into a better professional and person, and contribute positively to the communities I engage with both now and in the future, while continuing to expand my knowledge and personal values.

I am taking this class because it is attached to the physics lecture and I need that class for my degree. I want to develop a deeper understanding about how the world works around me. I have always been curious about how and why things work the way they do and physics gives me logical and mathematical reasons that satisfy that curiosity. Physics will strengthen my problem solving skills and critical thinking skills which are valuable in any field. I appreciate the way that physics pushed me to think more deeply about how things work and builds a strong foundation for other areas of science and technology. I am here because I know this class will expand my knowledge but also help me become more analytical.

Physics does not mean a lot to me. I am taking this class solely to get to the next class, but if I had to say something about this class from the heart, what does physics mean to me? It means that I can learn and understand the motions of this world and how I can walk and not float. Understanding this part of my academic career can be crucial in my future career as a Physical Therapist. Being a Physical Therapist incorporates a lot of movement that can be explained through physics. By participating in Physics I will forever be grateful because I can learn how to evaluate my patients' or clients' overall treatment and the moves that I will give to them I can calculate things through Physics terminology. Overall I am grateful to be in this class because I know in the end this class will be very beneficial down the line in my career and I hope to be able to use this knowledge one day and show others what Physics mean.

I am here in the class because I need it as a prerequisite, but also because I like physics. Im at school because I have to be here but I also like school, I like the environment and the people.But, I have to be at school in order to get a degree, and although Im not entirely sure of what exactly I want a degree in, I know I want one, but I also need one. Im the oldest of my siblings so Ive been told I have to lead as an example to my other siblings, and thats why Im here. In order to be that example I have to be here, its more of a need than a want, I have weight on my shoulders that I can only get rid of once I meet that goal, so for my own good, I need to be here. So, Im here because i need to be here.

I'm here because the class is a requirement for my chemistry major. I know that physics and chemistry have a good amount of overlap and find some of the concepts in physics very interesting, as well as the math and work that goes into working on physics problems. I've been interested in science and the different sections since I was young and even though chemistry is my major I enjoy any opportunity to get a better understanding in any field of science. I don't know what career I plan to pursue with my degree but I plan to figure that out while I'm here. I also chose to be here to get away from where I was, I felt very Isolated and unmotivated. Being in San Francisco motivates me because I know that I need to put in the work so that I can make it through the years. I also hope there is more opportunities to find what I want to do after I get my degree.

, When I think of the phrase "Why am I Here", my mind automatically goes to why am I where I am right now. What steps and decisions have I made that have created the life I live today. That doesn't make much sense to most people but that is truly what went through my head when I first read the question. Life moves very fast and I'm currently thinking what caused me to choose a state school and why close to home? Did I really want to come here? Did this decision make me happy? Was this a decision I made with the mind of someone else as opposed to my own? Decisions are made daily some harder than others and many times we second guess our decisions to benefit others wellbeing, happiness, or even judgement without thinking about how the outcome could have a negative impact. That is why I am here because of decisions some good, some bad, and some that were made for me.

I'm in a physics class because I'm majoring in biology and it's a required course. As for why I'm majoring in biology (my major is more specifically ecology, evolution, and conservation biology), I love animals. I don't really know specifically what career I want to pursue; all I know is that I want to work with animals. Going into college, I actually started as a literature major. I love reading, so it felt obvious to just go to that. I realized after my first semester it wasn't gonna work. I love reading, but I kinda hate writing, and majoring in literature requires a lot of writing. I knew I had to change my major. I knew I loved animals and was super interested in them, I just didn't think I belonged in science. I had a big interest in it as a kid, but I got really discouraged after my experiences in high school science classes. Then, I realized, if I let other shit I experienced in high school make my decisions, it would make a lot of things suck, so why would I let it affect this decision? So, I changed my major, and last semester, I got to take my first biology classes in college, and it was great. Of course I still struggle, and I haven't exactly gotten to my major courses yet, but I just know it's right.

The reason why I'm "here"- at San Francisco State University is because I want to have a career that I love, which would be being a veterinarian. However, In order to do that, I need to get a degree in Biology first thennnnn go to vet school. In order to get that degree though, I need to take this physics lab/lecture class along with many others. I'd say I love anything STEM so this class should be a slight breeze... I'm hoping to get better at math while I'm here, but we'll see about that since I'm way better with science and english. You may be asking, "What made you want to become a veterinarian in the first place?", so let me answer that, ever since I was a little girl, I've had a deep love for animals. I live in a city where theres one side of the town that is wealthy, while the other side is not so wealthy; I want to be able to help those people who are in hard times, with their animals, because I know for a fact some people may not seek out veterinary care for their pets because of the high costs.

As I think deeply as to why I am here, I am here because I want to create a better lifestyle for myself. In order to do that, my education comes first. Education gets people to have connections and also learn more about how to move up the social ladder. I want to build connections with the people around me and it will also allow myself to become knowledgeable about how I can become successful. People always say that it's important to go to college and get a degree which it is important too however I believe that you can learn in every environment no matter what or where it is. I choose myself to be in a university because I want to further my education. I want to also gain opportunities of a lifetime here as well. I am here because it is that one step I need for my lifestyle to get better.

Why am I here? Although it is something that I have to take for my major and something that I wasn't primarily worried about when choosing my major, I never got a chance to take it in high school when they offered it. I took the basics of Biology and Chemistry, but my schedule became too busy for me to be able to take physics. It is primarily not worried about because I love math, and so far, it has a lot of math connected to it. Still, it is enjoyable learning about physics, motion, and behavior and getting to know other fundamentals included in the course. I'm hoping to learn more as I'm taking the course and hope that it is something that I'm able to connect to with the kind of work that I want to do in the future, Medicine, but I'm also hoping to gain more than just a grade in this course and being able to connect with my classmates more.

I actually don't know why I'm here. I think that I have got this far just becase of the pressure that my family has put on me, I always wanted to study to become a doctor, but I don't think that at this point it is something that I really want to do. And I also feel like my parents' influence like I feel like they expect a lot from me but sometimes it gets to over whelming. I just like to think positive and think that I have everything under control even though I don't know what I'm doing. It gets confusing sometimes becase I don't like to live here I'm the US I actually love to live in Mexico and every time I go there for vacation, I never want to come bac, I actually go there becase I have a house and my car and everything. sometimes I think that i should just drop everything and live a confortable life in Mexico, but I know that is not the best option for my future and that I have more opportunities here. But is this really what I want or I'm I just doing this to satisfy my mother's need and desire becase she never went to school, and her dream is to see me as a professional. And don't get me wrong I do want to become a doctor but how can I possible do that I f i don't know what path to take and it is so hard for me to make friends. I don't know why I'm here but I will try to make the most of it and if other people made it how come I can't.

The question why am I here can refer to a number of things. The way I am currently thinking about it related to school. In other words why am I coming to school or putting forth the effort to be here. I don not think I have really thought about it much but I guess there is a reason I am here. I am here because this is my stepping stone to getting to where I want to be at. I am here because I know that without being here I limit myself and my potential. I am also here because it feels as though it is a duty of mines. My parents didn't get a full education and they sacrificed a lot of their life to allow me to have the opportunities they never had. So it shorter worlds I am here because I have the opportunity to use this to get me to the places I want to go.

I am here to fulfill my purpose. I believe my purpose is to find the people I can connect to closely, and uplift them along with myself. I plan to bring all of the people close to me on my journey and I want to be faithful to all of them, along with strengthening our relationships as much as we can. The relationships I have with these people bring me purpose, but I have also learned to find purpose in myself. I know I am here to help others around me, but I also want to help myself to be the best person I am. I put myself at as much priority as I put the others around me, and I believe that is a fair way to think about my purpose. I would like to believe these are my reasons for being here, but that could always change and I'm open to that.

While reading the prompt, I drew a blank. I still haven't found the specific reason as to why I am here today, but I do know that I am here because of something even if I'm not sure of it yet. I just need to take the time to find that reason. I might come across this particular reason on my future path. I've been trying to experience new things and trying to apply the things I learn in my lecture to my everyday life to help me find out why I am here. How am I here? From what I've relearned in this class, everything comes from something. From our understanding, everything cannot be made or destroyed. I actually remember something that was mentioned in class, which is something I did not know beforehand. We all came from the stars. Millions and millions of years ago we came from the gases that emit from the stars and became human. Maybe we were something else before that and evolved into what we are today, but who truly knows?

This is a tough question. For me personally, I believe that God put me on this earth to do/be something helpful/comforting to the world. I don't think it's anything big, but it may be for one person. It's not like I'm going to be curing cancer or anything of that sort. But more of a helpful/comforting hand to someone in need. I'm planning to work in a hospital and love comforting people in need. It may have something to do with that or maybe not. It's hard to plan when theres so many twists and turns of life that I still have yet to go through. In my opinion its not "why am I here?" but "what is my purpose?" I know I'm here for a reason, I just don't know what that is just yet. Though my journey through finding my faith was extremely helpful with being comfortable with who I am and being a good person, I still have no clue what my purpose is. Maybe once I have a secure job or when I eventually have a family I'll find out, but for now, I'm just taking life for what's its worth and making the best out of it.

I was born and brought up in India, fascinated by the human body, by the intricate ways cells communicate with one another, by the silent battles our immune system fights every single second. That curiosity led me to this place, to SF State, to major in Cell and Molecular Biologynot as a major, but as a means to something greater.I am here because I want to learn, to find, to mend. I have seen illness up close, felt the helplessness of seeing someone hurt, and learned that information is power. I may become a doctor, perhaps a scientist, but something, I want to heal it. Science is the language of intent, and I am here to speak it effectively. But I am also here because life has led me here in ways that I never fully meant. I am learning more than biologyI am learning independence, determination, and self-discovery. I do doubt if I am doing the right thing sometime,. But in the end, I know that I am here because I am meant to be.

My goal for this physics lab is to finally make these concepts stick. I'm not just here to get through the experiments; I want to build a foundational understanding that I can apply beyond the classroom. I'm tired of physics feeling like a language I can't speak, I want to become fluent. Specifically, I want to develop the ability to interpret physical phenomena in my everyday life. When I see a bridge, I want to understand the forces at play. When I hear about energy efficiency, I want to grasp the underlying principles. I want to learn to think like a physicist, to break down complex problems into manageable parts and apply logical reasoning. In this lab, I'll actively seek out the 'why' behind every experiment. I'll ask questions, research relevant topics, and strive to connect the lab work to real-world examples. I want to be able to explain concepts to others, which is the ultimate test of understanding. I'll evaluate my success by my ability to not only get the right answer in lab, but also to explain why it's the right answer, and to use the concepts to analyze situations outside the lab setting. Ultimately, I want physics to become a lens through which I see and understand the world around me, a tool I can use when needed.

My short-term college goal is to complete a Bachelor of Science degree in Biology, with honors, at SFSU in Fall, 2026. In addition, I am pursuing a minor in Chemistry. After completing my undergraduate degree, my long term goal is to pursue an MD and PhD in Cancer Biology. I am currently on track to successfully complete my academic goals at SFSU including graduation with honors. These are ambitious goals, but I have made them achievable by preparing myself for success. First, I participated in Clinical Research Coordinators: Learners for Equity Training Program (CIRCLE) at UCSF for one year. This program provided me with mentorship, biomedical research exposure, and career advising to ensure a smooth transition into a medical and research program. Secondly, I participate in Gators Reclaiming Our Workforce Program (GROW) , a program at SFSU and UCSF for first-generation, low income students who have been historically underrepresented in medicine. This program has been instrumental in providing me with academic support and career mentorship as well as medical shadowing experiences. Lastly, I surround myself with a valuable support network including Future Physicians Society, Pre-Medicine Equity and Diversity Society, Perfect Pair, and the Chemistry and Biochemistry Student Association.

My goal is to be part of something bigger than myself. I want to contribute to cancer research and help find better treatments and maybe even a cure someday. That is what drives me. I want to be someone who helps change that story for other people. I'm not just interested in the science, I am passionate about the impact it can have on real people. This class is helping me by teaching me how to understand forces around me and how to label them properly. My goal is to become a Physical Therapist and I believe that Physics will help me down the line in my career when I have to calculate someone's overall movement from certain positions. Physics is a difficult subject for me but none the less I will do my best to learn as much as I can to learn all the subjects this course has to requires me to.

My main goal is to graduate with my bachelors degree in EEC Biology and then pursue a career in the veterinary field, where a strong foundation in science and problem-solving is essential. This physics lab helps me achieve these goals by deepening my understanding of fundamental principles such as force, motion, and energy, which are directly relevant to biomechanics, medical imaging, and the advanced technology used in today's veterinary care. Through hands-on experiments, data analysis, and real-world applications, I am developing critical thinking and technical skills that will be valuable in both my academic journey and future professional career. as a veterinarian. Additionally, this lab strengthens my ability to work with precision and attention to detailboth of which are crucial in diagnosing and treating animals effectively. Learning how to conduct experiments, interpret results, and troubleshoot challenges in a controlled setting mirrors the analytical approach required in veterinary medicine, making this experience highly beneficial for my long-term goals.
