My goal is to pass this class with understanding the material given. Having physics as a lecture provides us with some classwork along with information to do but doesnt feel enough. Including a lab that does work problems really helps because we can learn the basics and think critically while reviewing our mistakes. The number of students in the lab vs lecture can change too since theres more opportunity to ask for help and focus more on the group than the individual. The class is about 2 hours long per week which I like because it happens at that day and time so there wont be any waste and we can do our work without having less time cut. There are times where we have physical work, so it provides us better than word problems. The set up of classwork also works because having the basic learning from the beginning and continuously stacking up along with what we learn from the lecture really shows us the connection. At the end of the class, there will be a post lab to wrap it up,so it really assists on what were learning from that day.

When life gets challenging, I like to remind my self that whatever is going on is just temporary. I feel that breathing techniques such as deep breathing truly help me. I like to find healthy ways to help me decompress such as reading a book, watching tv, or sleeping. I try to move my body in any way, shape, or form to help me sweat and release stress. Most of the times this includes going to the gym and joining a group workout where our main focus is to get through the work out, have fun, and support each other. Another thing I do when life gets challenging is surround myself with family and friends. Most of the time these people help me feel refreshed and they help me laugh which always seems to make whatever is going on a bit easier. I'm working on asking for help in any way so that I do not feel alone when I encounter challenging situations.

Life can be tough, but thats what makes it exciting! Every challenge we face helps us grow and become stronger. So, when things get tough, I see it as a chance to improve myself. Life isnt always easy, but its full of ups and downs, good and bad moments. We just have to keep going. Last semester was the toughest year of my life, but it was also the most rewarding. It taught me a lot about patience and resilience, and it helped me grow into a better person. Because of that experience, I was able to do really well in the fall of 2024. I almost got all straight As, so I guess the challenge pushed me to become a better student and person. Now, Im using those skills in my life, and its going great! Ive been accepted into all the programs I wanted, and Im feeling really positive about the future. So, when life gets tough, we just have to keep going and overcome it!

When life gets challenging I try to pause and remind myself why I started. It's easy to get overwhelmed when things don't go as planned, but I have learned that staying grounded in my purpose helps me push through it. I take a deep breath and take a step back to focus on what I can control. Sometimes that means writing things down or talking to someone or clearing my mind. I have learned not to bottle things up because challenges are a part of life and facing them means I am growing. When things get tough I also think about the people I want to help one day and I remember this struggle is all a part of the process and one day everything I am doing right now will pay off for me and the people I will eventually help.

There are many factors in my life that is challenging and when it gets to me I tend to get frustrated and not aware of myself and what to do. As of recent I have been gaining more experience with dealing with rough times in life. I want money, the nice cars, and clothes these are the only things that stress my life out but how I hope with it is by understanding why I am feeling this way and letting myself know that it's okay to be in the spot that I am in and that everything I ever wanted will come into my palms as long as I continue working steadily and consistently. In other words what helps me most is by reminding myself that I will be okay in the future and that all I need to do is stay calm and consistent with everything I do in life because In the end it will be rewarding to me.

When life gets challenging I tend to get over whelmed. If I have to much going on at one time I tend to look at whats causing those challenges and put down what ever is less important, or what I see as less important. This allows me to focus on what I find more important and have less to worry about. But this could also be bad for me because sometimes I need to drop something that I really enjoy and it end up affecting me more and to burn out from just doing the important things.

When life gets challenging, I tend to for starters let out a good cry and release any sadness or anger that I may be building up. Growing up expressing emotions was very foreign to me and it was almost taboo. That has made it very difficult for me to feel things in the moment but as I have grown older I have tried to break that generational cycle. I have learned to be more in tune with my feelings and express them in the moment in whatever way that I wish and decide in that moment. Whether it be yelling into a pillow or crying that is usually the start of what I do when I am overly stressed and do not know what to do next. Another thing I do is clean my environment because I believe that a clean space always helps to clear your mind as well.

When life gets challenging, I think what I do the most is fall back on the people around me. The people I love mean so much to me, and I always want to be there for them and they're always there for me. When I'm going through hard times, even a small phone call with a family member or my partner will make me feel better. I also depend a lot on doing the things that I love and make me happy. Things like watching my comfort tv shows/movies, eat yummy food, journaling, doing yoga, all really help to cheer me up and center me. Simple phrases like "all things must pass" always help to remind me that stress is temporary. Sometimes just forcing yourself to do the things that make you feel better is the hardest part, so it's important to not let yourself down and you'll get through it.

What do I do when life gets challenging? Well there are a couple of things I do, but the main one is telling myself to stay positive because everything will, and always, get's better, and in reality Im the only one who can get myself better..Music also helps me stay positive, if I'm in a sad mood and I want to get out of that, then I just put on a song that I know will make me feel good or optimistic. I even have a playlist just for these type of situations. One of my most favorite things I try doing when life gets challenging (and if im at home) is talking to my family members to distract myself. Another outlet is going to the gym. The gym makes you feel good and look good! My other favorite outlet is just being with my pets, my three dogs and cat. :)

But for the most part when things get challenging, I tend to go for a walk with my dog, sometimes that gets me to clear my head and thing about the problem that Im trying to face. When that doesnt work I tend to listen to music, sometimes listening to something helps me. Another thing that tend to help is talking to other about it, sometimes getting a whole new perspective of things can help me process the challenge.

Every time that I get tired or over stressed I like to have a cup of iced water, i think that iced water gets really in the system and clears my mind up. Another ting that i like to do is to rest for a little bit, when I get overwhelmed with school of homework I like to take a break, I fell like this helps a lot to feel better and clear my mind as well, if my head starts to hurt I like to take a cold shower that helps me relax my muscles and start fresh. Also I think that something that makes me. Feel a little bit more overwhelmed is if I have not ate some thing during the day, so eating something is also one of the things that I do

When life gets challenging I always tend to take a moment to breath. In general with school that means that I give myself breaks so I don't feel overwhelmed with everything. I try to manage my time and take care of myself. Having self care for me is important because in those moments that get hard I feel more calmed and relaxed even through all of the pressure. Something that also helps me is distractions. Going out with friends and doing different activities as a way to be distracted from everything that is goin on.

When life gets challenging I often try to find some things that bring me joy. I want to not only see the struggles of life but also the nice things that it can provide for me. I try to be to indulgent in the things that bring me joy as I do not want to neglect my priorities but I find it important to stay in the moment. There are many times where I thought life was just too tough but I did not want to let the work crash down on me, and so I chose to prioritize my happiness in those moments. Life can bring a lot of challenge but when I am able to break down the pieces of that challenge into something manageable then I am able to approach it at a different angle, making the challenge easier to take on. I want to improve on these methods so I will continue to work on them as I move through life.

When life gets challenging, I take a step back and take a break from everything. I take a yoga class, and we're learning about meditation and I've learned to take time out of my day to meditate and connect back to the sun. I also take lots of naps as I work part time while being a full time student, and because of that I am very sleep deprived. Whenever I'm well rested I always feel much more better about the world around me and most importantly myself as well. Life always has its challenging moments, and its important to take care of your mental and physical health. Those two things come above everything because without those two, how are you supposed to do anything at your highest potential? I always try and keep that mindset and remember that whenever life gets challenging, I am allowed to take breaks for myself.

Life is full of ups and downs. Its like the ocean, sometimes there's really high and happy points, and other times its low and sad. But its how you handle those low situations that you start to challenge and know yourself. Luckily for me, my life hasn't consisted of too many low times. Of course, everyone has their bad days, or even worse, losing a loved one. But I've managed to maintain a positive outlook among the harsh times. I take my time to grieve, or to be sad because without the sad times, you don't appreciate the good times. To make myself feel better, I'll workout or go outside and get some fresh air. Typically this would make me feel somewhat better or rejuvenated. Then I'll get out of the house and maybe hang out with some friends. I'll dress cute and put some makeup on to feel put together. If the challenging times consist of schoolwork, then I get the work done and get my rest afterwards. Because homework and schoolwork aren't a necessity to my life. Of course it sets up your future, but teachers and professors are very understanding and if I need an extension they'll typically give me a decent one.

When life gets challenging, my first instinct is to reach out to the people who ground memy family and close friends. My mother, especially, has always been my safe space. Talking to her, even if she doesnt have all the answers, brings me a sense of peace and clarity. She listens, understands, and reminds me of my own strength. My friends also play a huge role in helping me navigate tough times, offering support, laughter, and a fresh perspective when I feel stuck. Alongside seeking comfort in loved ones, I turn to prayer. Connecting with God reminds me that I am not alone, that there is a greater plan beyond what I can see right now. Prayer gives me hope, a belief that even in the darkest moments, light will find its way. I remind myself that challenges are temporary and that I have faced hard times before and come out stronger. In moments of struggle, I also try to pause and reflect. Instead of running from the challenge, I ask myself what it is trying to teach me. Every hardship carries a lesson, and while it may not always be clear in the moment, I trust that with time, I will understand its purpose.

What do I do when life gets challenging? My mind set it I know life gets challenging but never give up, you have friends and family there for you. It also depends on what type of challenge it is. If its a small problem I will try to get it solved, but if it was a big problem then I will try to ask for help. If I cant get help, then I will try to solve it myself but sometimes it is hard because my depressive side of bipolar hits in, so sometimes once I am sad it affects my whole mood and makes me sad then whole day or an couple of days, and sometimes I do have bad thoughts,I am very grateful for my friends though, for sticking by me no matter what and comforting me when I am sad. One thing that helps me is my music and coloring to try to clear my head.

I think it is hard to imagine what I would do if life were to get challenging because I am unsure what aspect I am preparing for, if a specific aspect of life gets challenging, like financial issues, relationship issues, or something else, I can prepare for it beforehand, but if something random and unexpected were to happen, something I don't see coming, I won't know what to do until it happens and then proceed from there I assume. I don't thing any time in my life has been especially challenging or majorly challenging that I could think of it right now. The times that I could consider challening I don't feel are that major and they no longer affect me. I think the only thing I can do when something gets challenging is to keep going and deal with the problem as it comes up or if it is something that I cannot deal with maybe something that would affect me permanently then the only thing I could do is to keep going and not let it hold me back.

When life gets challenging I remind myself, my goals and my values and positive things about myself , my life and things around me. I make sure I am being healthy and making healthy choices as well as healthy habits. I meditate and do things like yoga and exercise to make sure im taking care of myself, my body, my mind so that Im am doing my best. Self care is important to have energy for yourself , others and life itself. Making sure you reach out for support from the resources and people around you. Getting things done in a manageable resilient engaging way. Solidifying time to relax and recuperate.listen to your body and your needs. Giving attention to signs of exhaustion and any other signs that can make a difference in your life. Be generous with self compassion and care. Creating mantaras helps me as well as acknowledging progress no matter how small. Trying is doing .

When it comes to learning I would ask for someone's help or advice. It would usually be my parents since they have more experience than me and I have easier communication. I would also go to the internet to find similar problems or questions related to the materials given. In public education, I would talk to people in class and ask questions with information we are learning. Sometimes I ask my friends who are taking the same class or know a little bit. I usually ask the teacher but only in group projects or in private because Im shy so I dont intend to speak in front of everyone. I dont ask for much help when it comes to personal things. I dont know why but I like to keep things personal to myself and I dont like answering too many questions. It just gets me irritated and wanting to get out of there.

What I do when life gets challenging is do something that I enjoy doing, which oftentimes means either playing video games, running, basketball, or challenging myself to take my mind off of what bothers me. I do this because my hobbies force me to think of the present compared to what I have to do later. They also challenge me to think outside of the box, since not all videogames are the same, some have combat that I have to focus on or are aimed at making money so I have to think of efficiency. Running also forces me to think of the most effective way to breathe to keep my pace and also lets me figure out how to deal with my problems because when I run, it is just me and my mind. Finally, basketball helps because it's my sport that I've loved since I was little, and because I want to keep getting better at it. When I play or practice, I always think of how I can improve on my current skillset and never about my life itself, which distracts me from feeling stressed.

When life gets challenging, I try to figure out what it is in my life that I'm having a struggle with and directly combat it. This helps me figure out the root of the problem and slowly build my way to fix it. This also helps with my problem solving skills as I can figure out what's wrong within me and try to figure it out. But other than that, if I can't control it, I would often try to ignore it with other stuff that would distract me from thinking about it. For example, I like watching shows because that keeps my thoughts from ever thinking about the certain thing and I can stop from overthinking about it. I always tell myself that it's going to be okay and that everything will work out. I also like listening to music as it blocks out thoughts of other things. When it gets really challenging, I try talking to other people for help and how I can overcome this obstacle.

Life is full of ups and down. I think only when we go through down we realize and appreciate the up. Sometimes I found myself not being grateful for life, being unhappy, sad or find life challenging. Those times, something that helps me is reminding how I'm blessed with everything I need. Having food to eat, clothes to wear, roof to live, all the love received from everyone itself is such a blessing. I also practice yoga and some breathing, meditation helps a lot to convert that low feeling to full of love, joy, gratitude. Yoga helps me to realize there is nothing to be ungrateful for. To everything we can be grateful. I have been following yoga, spiritual master from last few years. From him I learned lot of methods to be happy and healthy. The most powerful practice that helps me when I'm feeling bad or challenging is practice of love, compassion of gratitude. Wishing all beings to be happy, healthy. Loving everyone from heart, being grateful makes me feel positive and happy.

Why am I here? That is a loaded question why am I in this class? Well I need it to graduate. Why am I in this school well it was one of the only places I got in that I could actually afford. Physics I know will be hard and that I will need to work to understand it, and that is exactly what I am doing. Being here also means being present and I am present because I actually want to learn and grow. I am not sure truly how helpful physics will be for me in my schooling or in my future career but I will get past this hurdle and move onto the next. I am here because I see a positive future for myself within the major I am in. That I have everything i need to succeed in my life!

In the time I spent reflecting on why I am here, my initial answer was to continue my education to get a job that will not only support but also satisfy me. I also believe I'm here to discover how I operate professionally and to deepen my understanding of science and how it will apply to my future. I am here because I care about showing up to class and putting in an amount of effort that I can look back on and be proud of. I am spending money to be here and learn, and I do not want my time to be wasted. I am here to make my parents proud. I am the first in my entire family to go to college, and I'm paving the way for generations to come, especially women of color. I say this because my mom was the first woman of color to marry into the history of my family, and I take it upon myself to show how her guidance allowed me to be stronger.

I believe I am here only to enjoy life and help others enjoy it as well. I do not believe in divine purpose or fate. Instead, I believe we have complete control on how we can live our lives. I understand not everyone has equal opportunities but there is always a choice in how we perceive life and what we choose to do when faced with a choice. That is why it is important in me to choose to enjoy life no matter what. I have faced a lot of problems in my life and still do, but I refuse to let that hardship bring me down and cloud my view on life. I wish to help others think that way too and enjoy their lives despite the adversity they might face. Life can be as negative or as positive as we make it to be which is why I think it is important to help people see that so that they can strive through their own lives with optimism no matter what.

I am here because it is a requirement for my major which is kinesiology. I'm here at school because in order to get my career job which is an athletic trainer, I have to take classes in order to reach it. That goes for every class I take, but to be fair the classes that are not related to my career job, I tend to care less or put less effort into. Physics especially is apart of physical therapy, it's literally in the name. That was my first dream job but, I realized the effort and hours or days of studying you have to put to get to that position. I am not saying that I have no possibility of reaching it but, right now being an athletic trainer just seemed more obtainable. Also, with school I don't find it necessarily enjoyable but, I know I have to be here so I take the most out of it. Even if somedays where I don't want to go, I know that if I want to get my dream job, I have to persevere despite whatever obstacles come my way. In the end, whatever it is, if that letter grade at the end of the semester is a C and below, I know that I have failed myself.

W hy am I here?. Why am I here in Physics 112? Im here because I am required to take physics even though Im not really good at it but its required for my major which is Kinesiology. I am actually trying to get into Nursing so Kinesiology is a backup major in the meanwhile, so I am taking the required classes. Why am I here at San Francisco State University? Well Im here hoping to reach my end goal of becoming a postpartum nurse. I am here to pursue the career I want, take the perquisites and classes needed to get into nursing. Hoping to get into a program here or at another university or even an accelerated program for nursing. Then once I do and finish my years then Ill specialize to become an NICU or postpartum nurse. Those are the reasons towards Why am I here? because I choose to be, I choose to reach for my end goal and go to school to become a nurse.

I'm not sure ifI fully understannd the qestion. Why am I in class? becasue I want to learn, I am curious about physics as I have never gotten to take a physics class before and the subject has always interested me. I am here because it is a requirement for my degree and this is when it best fiit into my schedule? What specifically is this asking?

I am here to get my degree and it get some practical experience for my future. I am also here to get better in possible fields of study I'd like to pursue. I'm also here to prove to myself that I am capable of succeeding in higher education. I am also here to make my parents proud. They were a very strong driving factor for me to go to college and get a degree. I believe getting a degree will help me move up in life and be more successful but as time has gone on I feel that a degree means less and less. But the idea that getting a degree will help me and my family not struggle as much is a big factor in me being here and staying on top of everything while in college. Overall I am here for my future, my family, and myself.

When Im asked a question like why am I here my automatic response would be, well because I have to be. But another part of me is excited to be here partially because I know almost everything in the world is related to physics and ive never taken a physics class before in my life. Since this is my first physics class I have made connections with things ive learned in Statistics in high school and in my Chemistry classes ive taken at SF State. I think im here because at some point in my Major upper division courses, I think I would benefit from knowing the general concepts of physics which I feel like is a mix of Math, Science and street smarts. I am excited to make connections in physics and relate our problems to real problems in the world.

The reason I am taking this class is because I am a Biochemistry major and it is one of the required classes for my major. Soon enough though, or by next semester, Im deciding to take the nursing prerequisites in order to switch to the Nursing major. Even though Im planning this change, Im still taking this class because I want to have a backup major in case I am not accepted into the Nursing major. This past winter I sat down with my academic advisor and we talked about the different options I had in order to one day have RN in my name. She told me that since I already had a major assigned to me, I could continue having it while taking the prerequisites for Nursing and then do the switch once I have taken the classes. She also warned me how there are a very limited number of seats in the nursing program so she told me about another option in which I get a BS in Biochemistry and then apply for a masters in nursing. So, Im taking this class just in case I dont make it into the nursing program on my first try.

I am here because i need too get an education. I am an environmental science major and i am hoping to add an astronomy minor so i need to take physics to fill my requirements. I am here because I am a first generation latina and also a first generation student. I am here to better myself and get a higher education that many family members never had the privilege to do. I love learning new things and being able to grow as a person and learning science is the foundation of doing just that. I am here to get my bachelors in science and to one day work in my field. I am not sure what i want to do specifically with my major but i know i want to make change in the world. I am here because knowledge is power and power is knowledge. I do know that i want to advocate for the environment and try to dismantle the systems that are in place that cause harm to our environment.

I am here at to get my bachelor's degree in kinesiology with a focus in exercise and movement. I've been going here for a few years now but I'm specifically taking this class because it's a requirement for my major. I'm required to take general physics 1 and 2. In addition, I know for a fact that I'll be using terms that are in physics in the physical therapy world. I do plan on being a physical therapist and we're definitely going to be keeping in mind concepts like, length, tension, and velocity during our exercise programs. It's important to make sure that the patient's exercise plan is created in a way that keeps in mind the patient's physical abilities and safety. Knowing these concepts and material will help me achieve that. Moreover, I am at school to enhance my overall knowledge and understanding. I've learned a lot in terms of the overall mechanics of the human body with terms from courses like physics. These concepts are a part of the real world in general and it's important to look back on them in my future career.

The reason I am here is to complete my degree requirements for my Kinesiology major, which require me to take Physics 111 and 112 as prerequisites to other classes that I want to take like Physics 2 though I am thinking about switching my major to a Biology major which still requires me to take Physics 111 and 112 as courses to complete my degree. The purpose of these physics classes is for I am able to get my degree and try to get into a program or graduate school that can allow me to get a career in the field that I want as well as expand my knowledge of what I know so that I can better understand the world I live in. Another reason I'm taking this class is because it's interesting and I like learning how things work especially the motion of objects and why there are certain movements.

I am really interested in physics and always wondered how it would be taking a physics course. Throughout highschool I've never taken a physics course, which is why I decided this would be the perfect time to give it a try. I heard more about physics from one of my friends who took the course, which really made me interested. I'm here because of my curiosity and my interest to learn more about physics. I also want to apply my knowledge from physics in real world situations, which is why I'm enrolled in this lab course. Not only that, but I'm also here to apply what I learn and my current knowledge to my future aspirations and goals. This is also one of the many major requirements I need to fulfill my bachelor's degree in Biochemistry and a prerequisite to take higher division courses. Taking physics will prepare me for these higher division courses.

I am here to become a first college student in my family. I also want to be part of the percentage of latinos that graduate college. I want to make my family and myself proud. Being in this class will allow me to expand my knowledge and get closer to my career goals. I want to either become a dentist or someone in the medical field. Although it's been a rough two years due to getting the wrong advising I will try to push through it. Im scared that I wont be able to accomplish my goals but I have to have faith. So far I feel confident I will at least pass this class with a C. Although that's just my goal to pass I would like to get at least a B to make myself proud. I'm here to learn and to attend every class and to ask questions.

I'm here to grow, learn, and work for my long-term objectives. My fascination with microscopic organisms and their effects on the world, particularly human health, led me to pursue a degree in microbiology. I'm interested in learning how viruses and bacteria function, how diseases propagate, and how science may benefit humanity. In order to improve people's lives, I hope to work in a clinical lab where I can help with disease research and diagnosis. However, college is much more than simply academics. I'm here to meet new people, experience new things, and push myself to new limits. I'm becoming a better version of myself with each class, assignment, and late-night study session. I feel overburdened by all the work and obligations, and some days are more difficult than others. However, I tell myself that all of this is a necessary part of the process. I have faith in my future, which is why I am here. No matter how hard things get, I want to keep moving forward. I want to learn new things, acquire new abilities, and grow into a person who can truly make an effect. I'm here for that reason.

I am here to learn about physics but to also finish my GEs and get my units. This is another step to getting my degree and moving on to the jobs I want in the future. I am nervous though because the physics lecture is a bit overwhelming but Ill try and manage it. Physics lab though so far is relaxed but I still feel productive in getting all my work done. Ive made friends with my group mates so its easy to talk and have relaxing conversations while completing the work. My lab teach is chill and helpful when I have questions so I am thankful for that. I honestly wanna go home and sleep because my Thursdays start from 8 am and end at 6:45 pm. I still have a good amount of work to finish by the end of the week so hopefully when I am at work Ill get most to all of it done. I work at the private gym working front desk so its alright if I do my work as long as I also complete my work tasks. Its also nice because I get to use all of its equipment for free like the benches, weights, and sauna after my shift.

I am here to succeed through struggle. Despite how hard the next step may be I need to keep moving and improving or else I have no purpose. If every time I hit a problem I was to look for a solution then I would be moving away instead of towards my goals. When I am faced with an impasse I am forced to work harder than I thought I could and that leads to progress. Whether my studies are starting to drown me, I am hitting walls in my training or I am just having a hard time there is no reason to stray away from the issue when I can face it head on. Not to say that I should cause injury physical or mental to myself because recovering ones body and mind is equally as important as pushing it to its limits.
wait were we supposed to write about the class my bad..

Im here to learn about the natural world and how it works. How it interacts with itself. Im interested in Ecology so basic physics is important to have a background in. Physics is how we understand why everything is here. Im here because the Earth is so big that it pulls me towards it with gravitational force. So is everything else on this planet. Im here in San Francisco because I wanted to experience a different place than where Ive lived before. I wanted to live among different plants and trees and animals. Theres black birds here and I never saw one of those until I moved here. I miss seeing banana slugs though. Maybe I just havent been hiking enough here. Im here in this building because I walked over here in the rain because Im committed to learning all I can from college, even if its hard to understand or not something Im completely interested in. I think its so valuable to have basic knowledge in most things. Im here because I want to do research to help out environments and make it easier and more accessible for people to live closer to nature. Urban farming is something Im especially interested in learning.

I am here because I want to graduate in a field that I love to learn about. I started at ASU as a biomedical engineer major and tried to transfer into SFSU under the same, but wasnt able to. I then started to think about what I would be interested in and came to the conclusion that I loved the biology and chemistry classes that I had to take and found out about Biochemistry. I love math and science and am excited to understand more about it all. Physics has always interested me and I want to understand how the world works the way it does. I would like to have a job that is more about research and understanding, so I need to learn as much as I can before venturing off by myself. Ive always thought that the idea of having an apple fall on your head relating to the gravitational pull of the moon is such a fascinating topic and would love to be able to relate different experiences like that.

Sorry this is late I just figured I would try. My goals are always changing right now my main goal is just to survive college and make it out with my sanity. That is going ok. I think in the future my goals will be more like, getting a steady income that is good and can support myself and the people I love in life. Having a nice warm place to stay where I do not have to worry about the weather or whether or not I will have enough money to eat and that I will be so loved with my family. i also have another goal of maintaining a B avg in school but that is not going the greatest for me and that may be in-part because I have overloaded myself again and that i am not relying on people like I should be doing. However no matter what I am doing I am working my way to the end of these goals and this class could help me pass and to hit the goal of actually graduating college.

My current goal is to get an internship in a lab. This class is helping me achieve this goal by providing me with the educational background to succeed in a lab environment. I want to get an internship in a lab on campus because it will be a good precursor to working in a DNA lab. I recently wanted to apply, but I need more relevant science experience before being accepted. Working in a DNA lab would help me get closer to achieving my goal of becoming a forensic analyst. Through the DNA lab, I hope to make connections and learn skills that will bring me closer to this goal, since it would be a similar environment to what I want to spend my life doing. I find science exciting, but it can be challenging at times. I have to do my best to gain relevant experience so that I can live the life I want to live while simultaneously studying what I am passionate about.

My goal at this time is to just continue doing well in my classes so that I can pass everything and fix my gpa. I want to be a marine biologists in the future and I am working very hard to achieve that. Doing well in my classes includes taking the time to study, and doing homework on time. I have to push myself to not fall behind because then I will have a hard time catching up to the material. In the future I want to have a career I will be happy with and can support my loved ones and I with which is why I need to work hard.

My goals for this class is to pass this class and to have an understanding of the material being taught. I want to be able to help my little brothers homework when it comes to physics. Also, it is required of my degree to pass physics. When I think of physics I think of physical therapy. Being a physical therapist was one of my first dream careers that I wanted because I am really into sports. Just helping out athletes is one of my goals, being an athletic trainer or dispersing products, who knows what will come into play. The goals for this class is just being able to bring me closer to my bigger goal. I dont know if I have specific goals, I just want to pass this class. I dont know just seeing an A on my transcript is rewarding and thats what I want for myself. Overall, to me goals pop up as long as time goes by. Obviously I have a dream goal but I know its not coming anytime soon, so I just take it one day at a time.

I have a lot of goals I am hoping to reach. My main goal is to become a nurse, specifically a postpartum or NICU nurse. Which is why Im taking classes here in SFSU to take my prerequisites to be able to apply and get into a nursing program. So I guess this class is to help me reach that goal. But I have other goals once I become a postpartum nurse and that would be to travel everywhere. Its always been a dream of mine to travel so I made it my goal to travel once I get a stable job and am making money from it. I also have a goal of buying an apartment as well, with a cat as well. Im hoping that I can reach my goal of making enough money to live in Los Angeles. My goals are all related to each other and what Im going to reach for in the future.

My goals are to understand the basics of physics and how they apply to my life and the world around me. Learning about motion, vectors, acceleration vs. velocity and all of what we have been working on in lab help with that as I can usually find a way to apply what we are learning to the world around me. A lot of what we were working on reminded me of driving and thinking about how long it will take to get somewhere.

Some of my goals are graduating with high honors, finding what I'm going to do with my degree, and maintaining a healthy work-life balance. I have a feeling that the first goal of graduating with high honors may change but it keeps me motivated to show up to every class and try my best. I want to know what possible career pathways I can pursue with my degree. I chose my major because it is a field I'm interested in but I am not sure how I can use my degree to get a job in those fields. I am working while going to college and am trying to figure out how much time I need to allocate towards school and for myself. I feel like I have it pretty balanced but if I fall behind in something for a class or pick up an extra shift my life gets unbalanced and I burn out. My goal is to find a middle ground where I can work, go to school, and socialize with out burning out.

Ive always envisioned myself as a successful person and that put me in the position to think hard about my future and career goals. Ive completed many goals like graduating high school and attending university but have an endless list of goals that im waiting to achieve. My most important goal would be to graduate from my 4 year CSU and earning my BS in Biology. Graduating college has always been one of my first life goals since I can remember. Recently ive been aligning myself with the best path to medicine and the medical field, which means that another goal of mine is to complete Sfsu EKG Technician program and venture off into clinics, convalescent homes and even hospitals to administer EKGs to patients in need. My biggest life goal is to graduate medical school and get my medical degree. As of now im still deciding between surgery and anesthesiology but both paths are headed in the same direction so that gives me peace of mind on my decision making. My overall goal is to be a good person and help people and be a healthy version of myself.

My long term goals are to have a successful career and live a successful, relaxed life. The way this class is helping me achieve those goals is by potentially being one of the classes I need to graduate. Im also learning skills to address problems and thats something I will need to be actively doing in a career to expect the unexpected. For my short term goals Im trying to work on my time management, build friendships, work on my perseverance, and have patience with myself. This class has also been helping me achieve those goals in the aspect that I have to work quickly in order to finish the labs before class is over. Then, Ive also met kind people in this class and Ive gotten a little bit more out of my shy bubble by talking to new people and getting to know them. The greatest way Ive noticed this class has helped me with my perseverance is that I have become more determined to work on a problem I may be struggling with rather than simply giving up. It helps me keep that in practice and to not give up when I find myself facing a wall.

My goals are to become successful in the things i am passionate about. I was to strive and try my very best in phisics and to do what i feel i need to do to give it. I plan this Friday to go to tutoring sessions to help me prepare for the upcoming exam in my physics lecture i am having. My goal is to become a physical therapist who works with kids. I like the idea of helping others and learning about the human body's mechanics. It helps me learn about my own exercises and I can assist those around me as well. This class is helping me achieve these goals because concepts that are involved in physics are also incorporated into my future career. This includes terms like velocity, tension, acceleration, and vectors too. The human body is like a machine that involves such concepts and it's important to keep these terms in mind when trying to correct certain movements of patients. Ultimately, my goal as a physical therapist is to have my patient's gain better mobility and quality of life. They will be able to gain their autonomy back and I hope to attain as much knowledge as I can about the human body to help them out. It's a long road for rehabilitation and I want to make sure that their movements are done in the correct way.

What my goals are for physics is that I hope to be able to study over the weekend for the physics exam 1. A long-term goal for this physics class is to keep my grades and pass this class with a good grade, which to me is an A grade. This class can help me by going over things that I don't understand from the lecture and allowing me to slowly process what I'm doing/ learning, making it easier for me to process the information, which will allow me to focus and understand the lectures. Another goal I have is that I want to be able to remember and use the information learned from this physics class and apply it to any other physics classes that I might take in the future. One personal goal I have is trying to fix my sleep schedule because, lately, I have been staying up later at night.

My goals for this class is to understand at least the basic concepts. I want to be able to understand and solve problems on my own and be able to show/ teach someone who may not understand the concepts. My goal is to pass the class with a B or higher, but if I do get a C i'm okay with that as well. This class helps me understand the lectures given to me previously an allows me to do hands on work. Through this class I get to interact with what I learn which makes the experience of learning it more interesting. This class also will help me with my major classes, since its a requirement and I believe it will also allow me to see if weather or not I enjoy what I will be doing for the future. This class also helps me by allowing me to ask questions and expand my knowledge.

i am currently in my third semester at SFSU, pursuing a degree in microbiology. My main goal is to work in a clinical lab, preferably in a hospital setting, as a lab technician or scientist. To achieve this, I need a strong background in science and hands-on experience in laboratory work. Even though physics is not my primary focus, PHY 111 plays a role in helping me reach my goals. Many scientific tools, like microscopes and centrifuges, rely on physics principles, so understanding how these concepts work will be useful in my future career. This class also challenges me to think critically and solve problems, skills that are important in any scientific field. While physics may not be directly related to microbiology, I know that having a broad understanding of different sciences will make me a better scientist. I hope to stay engaged, learn as much as I can, and apply this knowledge to my future work in a lab.

Im really just nervous about my exams coming up next week. I have three so my mind feels a little scattered. Im luck to have open notes for one of them so thats great but im more nervous about my physics lecture exam. Im still not confident with all the equations and when do use them during a problem. At least we get a one page cheat sheet so Ill just put the equations and definitions there. In different news Im happy because I hit diamond 2 on Marvel Rivals. What I noticed from lower ranks to higher was how much more talking the higher ranks were put also how much more toxic they were. Such big egos its annoying. My goal is to be a successful biotechnician and hopefully make the world a safer place while also making a lot of money. Physics will help me do that by allowing me to expand my knowledge of how the physical world interacts and assist in getting my degree at SFSU. Hopefully along the way it will also introduce me to some interesting and smart people who will be able to help me while I try to reach my goals. Overall I think physics is an important stepping stone for me to become the best and brightest I can be in the biotech world.

Madeleine Simon My goals are to become successful in my field of choice. In my case, I want to become a dermatologist or ultrasound tech.  To best fullfill this, I need to major in biology. To fully major in biology, I need to take this physics course, especially since I've never taken a physics class before. I hope to gain a basic knowledge of physics in this class so I can pass it (hopefully) and continue to pursue my degree. I am pretty stubborn when it comes to my future and I won't take no for an answer when it comes to living the life I feel like I deserve so I feel like my perseverance will help me reach my goals not only in this class but outside of class. Hopefully this class will give me the experience I need to do well in my future studies while perusing my major.

One of my main academic goals this semester is to focus on learning things in ways that allow me to remember the big concepts and ideas past the end of the classes Im taking. I want to build my knowledge and scientific strengths as much as I can so I dont struggle in higher level classes. Even thought physics is one of my lesser favorite science topics I still think this class is fun and I feel like Im learning a lot. Another goal I have is to make sure to stay on top of balancing other aspects of my life along with school.

My goals are to understand physics and be able to pursue a goal in research to help better the world. I first started in biomedical engineering and I loved one of my lab projects about finding a problem and building a model of a device that would help solve it. My group chose cerebral palsy and it was so interesting learning about to condition as well as figuring out a new way to help children with it. It involved a lot of math and physics to make sure the part would be working correctly as well as helping the quality of life with children who have it. This class helps me with my goals because it helps me to understand more about physics and what I need to know in order to be able to correctly design medical equipment for the best outcome. It also helps with putting the lessons into real world situations and figuring out exactly why things are happening the way they are.

I know this is so late, but I decided that maybe I could try and turn it in late. So for me when life gets challenging I would love to say that i get back up again and just try harder next time and maybe a few years ago I would've said that also, however as time has been going on and this semester has been kicking me in the but i have almost noticed that I just lay down and I take it, seeming like i am not fighting for what I want or deserve. I know that that is probably because things in my life really haven't been going to plan and I am just trying to survive. I should look and seek help from my family, friends or even classmates but that is hard to do also sometimes. To admit that you need help is challenging especailly when you are already over-whlemed with a lot of other things in life.

When life gets challenging, it's easy for me to get overwhelmed. I have to take a step back and remind myself what I'm here for: an education, and that is what I should prioritize. My time here has shown me that being confident in your abilities and able to produce great things is more important than just being a part of things to show face. I like to take a long, relaxing shower to refresh myself and get back on track with what I want to accomplish. Having an active to-do list has been very helpful, especially when I add due dates. I haven't been overwhelmed recently, and I have that to thank. I also try to call my mom or talk to friends to vent about what I'm finding challenging. It's not healthy to keep things bottled up, even if they seem small or easily manageable. I am learning how to ask others for help, and this alleviates challenges as well. However, sometimes challenges can be beneficial. I think by having challenging things, we also find things to work on to make ourselves more successful.

When life gets challenging I usually like to take a break and give myself time to relax or recuperate to deal with my stress. I can get drained pretty easily so I try not to overwork myself. When I take a break from whatever it is that is challenging I like to just breathe and reflect on myself a little bit. However, I dont always just stop. Depending on how challenging what I'm doing is or how close I am to completing it sometimes I will just push myself to finish it. I would rather get things out of the way if I can so that I dont have it lingering in the back of my mind. When it comes to life in general I choose to take things slow and avoid things that will cause stress when I feel overwhelmed.

When life gets challenging, I start to look for ways to make it easier or look for distractions. Especially during school when I have a difficult exam or test coming up, I try my best to study and get the best score possible. Or even when a something personally challenging pops up I usually try to bottle it up. Try my best to not show emotion because men seem weak when they show emotion. Honestly, I try my best to power through it. If the obstacles are right in front of me, Id run right through it. When I mean distractions, I distract myself with my hobbies, like a little getaway. For me its video games, its a step away from the real world and just makes me feel like all the problems in the world are just gone. I dont know even sometimes I want a challenge, when everything is going a little too easy or going my way, I expect a challenge and ready to take it head on. Challenges are not there to just throw you off your game but to make you get out your comfort zone. Getting out your comfort zone can benefit yourself.

Usually when life gets challenging I do things to calm myself down or get rid of some of the stress. I do things like self care, reading, playing games, going out, talking with friends, etc. Doing things like that helps me feel better about myself or lifts up my mood when things are feeling challenging so when I am feeling better I can face it head on. I dont like to avoid things that are challenging because I feel like thats not a good way to go and facing things can help you accomplish the things you want in life. Since of course there will be times where it feels challenging in life, but doing the things you love or self care helps let go of some of that stress or anxiety youre feeling. But my favorite way to distract myself is by mostly reading because I love reading.

I usually panic and avoid for a while when life gets challenging. I like to take some time to myself to refocus and figure out what to do. I make a priority list and a fun easy thing list. I start going through my priority list and when things get too hard, I switch to something from my relaxing/fun list (usually something like reorganize a cabinet or go to the gym). This helps me get back on track.

When my life gets challenging I usually will take a step back from everything and try and get a new perspective on my problem. I try not to get tunnel visioned on my problems and taking a break helps with that. I feel like I can find intuitive solutions to my problems when I take a break from whats challenging. I usually find that the simplest or easiest solution is usually the right one. When my life is really challenging I tend to overcomplect things and spiral but taking a break stops this for the most part. This is especially helpful when trying to learn a new topic for a class that's challenging, taking breaks and digesting information is better than trying to brute force learn something. I started implementing this strategy when I got to college and it has been really effective so far. Overall I feel like when things get challenging and I am able to find a new solution that works best for me.

When life gets challenging Im always happy to pick up a good book and make some snack and cuddle up on my bed or couch and let my mind dive completely into the novel. I prefer to read when Im overwhelmed because it presents me with a new life as Im reading this book through the eyes of the main characters, im almost able to feel what they feel and as my favorite genre is romance it usually results in me being in a happier mood.

First of all, I get very overwhelmed and probably bed rot which is not helpful at all. I overthink of whatever is making my life challenging and I brainstorm solutions without actually acting upon those solutions. Eventually I will stand my ground on something I can change and will make a change to the stressor in my life and hopefully remove that stress. I always try to focus on what my goals are for my future and where I want to go with my life. Having those thoughts in the back of my mind are always helpful to remind me I cant just stay stuck and give up and rather that I have to do something to get there. Sometimes it takes me a little longer to actually get to this point while other times whatever is challenging my life can have a quick solution. The time it takes longer is definitely the worst as it can be up to weeks until I actually make a change in my life.

In all honesty, I lie in my bed for as long as possible. Ill doom scroll on TikTok or play sudoku. Then, Ill get up for the next time that someone is else is depending on me to get up or I have an obligation to be somewhere. Sometimes, I talk about my feelings or my day with my roommate. I tend to get sidetracked a lot so I dont know how much she actually listens to. But, talking about how I felt throughout the day makes me feel better sometimes. Shes also very funny so that usually cheers me up as well. Generally speaking though, I deal with challenges by realizing I have no choice but to deal with them.

When life gets hard i write in my journal. have been documenting my life in journals since i stared college in the fall of 2023. It has helped me to keep a physical form of my life and has allowed me to express my feelings. I find that going outside and just sitting in the fun for 30 minutes really helps me to reset my mind. I find that i get in my head the most and that i need to take a deep breathe and not second guess my knowledge and intelligence. when life gets challenging i write in my journal ten things i am grateful for and then i write about what is bothering me. It honestly helps me a lot to write down the things i love and that i am grateful for. When life gets hard i forget all the good i have in my life and only focus on what has challenged me.

When life gets challenging, I usually try to go outside and get some fresh air. I feel like sometimes I tend to overthink and walking outside seems to calm me down. In addition, I do believe in retail therapy. I've honestly felt better after purchasing new clothes and electronics. Besides material items, I love spending time with my family or my friends to de-stress or talk to them about what's going on in my life. It always helps to have this outlet rather than keeping it bottled up inside. I also like exercising at the recreation center on campus. It makes me feel less worried and it keeps me physically fit as well which is a plus. Moreover, if life is stressful, I also like writing my feelings down. I try to take a step back and write about what's bothering me so I can reflect and find a solution. I also find that if life is hard at the moment, making lists of tasks that need to be done helps too. The more organized I feel, the less stressed I am throughout the day. Overall, I do recommend talking to loved ones when life get hard.

When life gets challenging what I usually do is to stop whatever I am doing and take a break this method usually works for when Im stressed about my academics like for exams or homework or something similar. For situations that are challenging that require immediate answers I usually take a breath and try to answer the best I can. When Im in a situation where theres a challenge and I need help I usually go to my friends for help and them to any tutoring and finally my professors, I like being able to exert all my options before going to the professor and confirming my answer or seeing what I did wrong. Whenever life get challenging I like being able to have support from the people around me so being able to talk to friends about anything helps me especially when you personal matters you cant/ dont feel like you are able to be properly understood by anyone else.

I initially have a tendency to withdraw inward when life becomes difficult. My natural tendency is to sit with my feelings and truly experience them before attempting to make any changes. I've discovered that suppressing feelings of frustration or despair just causes them to surface later in surprising ways. I therefore allow myself to admit when things are difficult. After that, I search for a calming activity, like going on a walk, writing in a diary, or simply sitting quietly. It serves as a reminder to me that I have overcome challenges in the past. I consider the people who encourage me, the goals that keep me going, and the motivation that keeps me continuing. "What is this challenge trying to teach me?" I ask myself. Asking changes my perspective, even when the answer isn't always obvious.Above all, I remind myself that hardship does not equate to failure. It denotes development. And I have faith that I'll figure it outone step at a timeeven though I might not always know how to proceed.

When life feels hard, tough and out of my hand I take a deep breath and try to stay calm. Stress makes things worse, so I remind myself that every problem is temporary. Sometimes, I step away for a little whilelistening to music, going for a walk, or just dancing on random songs , make me feel little batter . When I feel overwhelmed, I break things down into small steps. Instead of stressing over the whole situation, I ask myself, "Whats one small thing I can do right now?" This helps me feel in control. Talking to a close friend or family member also makes a difference. Even if they dont have the answers, just expressing my feelings makes me feel better. I also remind myself why Im doing what I do. Whether its school or personal goals, focusing on my purpose keeps me motivated. No matter how tough things get, I believe challenges make me stronger. I just have to keep going, step by step.

I take some time to myself and find a distraction that makes me feel good. I try to always allow myself distractions without guilt even if sometimes living guilt free is hard. I find this best when doing home work, it is okay to take breaks when I find things challenging.

Usually what I do when life gets challenging is that I go crazy and ramble to my friends that Im so cooked. But after that I pick myself back up and break down the challenge Im faced to smaller parts to lighten the load. I would also have a friend on call so they can hear me as I ramble with all the emotions in the world how I hate this challenge but Im going to destroy it. If I feel burned out for the day I just spend the rest of the time on my PC playing games, watching anime or watching my friends play games. I try finishing my challenge the best I can but by the end of it I feel dead. But I still completed it and thats what counts.

When life gets challenging I try to focus on what I can control. Things like my habits such as exercising, studying, and hanging out with friends are easy to make better or last longer and that usually helps me work through problems. I also try to focus less on the things like impending problems, large scale projects, and mistakes I have made in the past. It is best for me and my mental health if I try and hold myself to a high but reasonable standard and when life gets challenging in the process focusing on the important and controllable parts of life help me.

When life gets challenging, I usually get really stressed out and have to distance myself from everything for a day. This is something Im working on as this isnt a good way to deal with stress. Ive been practicing working on one task at a time and taking shorter breaks so I still get things done without being too hard on my capacity for work. I also am trying harder to reach out to classmates/friends/ sometimes family for help and advice. Lately Ive been taking on too many responsibilities and have had to step back and make sure that Im being firm on the amount of stuff I can do in one week. There are so many different things that are important to me, namely organizing with the community around me and being there for my friends. This can disrupt my academic side of life as its hard to put value on school when I know that my tuition is going towards things I never agreed for it to go towards. But I still love learning and have fallen into a better rhythm of balance with school, friends, organizing and work. I am also moving back home after this semester so its hard to commit fully to anything currently as I know Im going to be leaving soon so its kinda like But when life gets challenging I do like to make myself a cup of tea and read a book in my free time or just walk around outside to feel better.

When life gets challenging I like to take a nap or play with my son. Recently since having him, Ive been very stressed and its hard juggling school, work, and being a full time mom. When life gets too much and I just want a break I tend to forget about everything else and just focus on him and making him laugh. I love seeing his smile and how he lights up the room. Well often listen to music because he loves to dance or load up in the car and walk around the store. I love that hes there to take my mind off of the more adult things and I can watch him experience the world for the first time. He loves to watch me do anything and I love to explain everything that is going on. I also have a dog and he loves watching her play so we will often go outside and watch her run around and play with her toys.

For this entry I just kind of wanted to speak about why I am here in the sense of going into a stem major of kinesiology. This major was kind of picked by lifes design in the fact that sports have dominated my entire life. Since I was little the first memories of mine are playing soccer and sports with all of my friends. I have suffered a lot of small injuries that led me to so many hospital visits and urgent cares that I began to pickup and interest into what a career in that field looks like. Coming to SF State my original plan was to go as an athletic trainer and directly work with athletes. With no disrespect to that profession and physical therapy, there is a certain ceiling that you reach within the career. For that reason I decided pursuing medical school as a better use of my time and resources as the pre requisites are the same and it is the same commitment of 4 years and residency after so why not pursue medicine? Now I am finishing up my last semester before pursuing that dream of mine.

I am here because I was able to successfully pass Physics One. I was super happy and excited that I had passed such a challenging class. I am now in Physics two and I am here of course for my major requirements and also to learn and expand my knowledge on physics. I am also here for my parents. I am first generation and my parents immigrated to the United States for our future. I am super grateful for all the sacrifices my mom has made for my sibling and me. Which ties to the big reason why I am here. I am here to represent my culture and my background. As well as being able to graduate for my parents because that's something that unfortunately was not possible for them. I am also here because I want to graduate with a biology major and be able to go into what I most love. Which is getting to work with kids in the medical field.

Im here to better understand how physics affects our surroundings and why its important. Since I want to become part of the medical field its important to know how it can affect my work when it comes to medications and other related things within the medical field. Its not only in medical field that physics is important but other fields as well like architecture I believe since they want to make sure that nothing goes wrong and building dont collapse easily.

Im here because I want to understand the world better, learn how things move, how forces interact, and how the principles of physics apply to everything around me. At times, physics feels abstract, full of equations and concepts that dont always click right away. But then there are moments in the lab where it all comes togetherwhen an experiment confirms a theory when I see the direct connection between numbers on a page and real-world motion. I think Im here to develop a deeper sense of problem-solving, to push myself to think critically, and to gain the skills Ill need in the future. Even though Im planning for a career in medicine, physics still mattersit teaches me precision, patience, and the importance of questioning the world instead of just accepting it. Some days, I feel frustrated when experiments dont go as planned, but I remind myself that mistakes and unexpected results are part of the learning process. Maybe thats the bigger reason Im herenot just to get things right, but to learn how to approach challenges with curiosity and resilience.

I am here to get an education. I'm here to learn and get a degree so that I can get a job that I genuinely enjoy. I guess if were talking about why I'm at this school it would probably be because my mom made me come to this school. She didn't really make me but she made some very good points as to why I should go away for school. I'm from Los Angeles California so its a 6 hour drive from there to here, pretty far from home. I guess I had to learn how to be independent and not rely on my parents for as much support. If I went to community college I would have been taking care of my siblings, driving and dropping them off to school. I would probably also have to get a job and here I don't really have to do that so I guess thats why I'm here.

Why am i here? I am here because I care about people. I have an unwavering love for my fellow humans and i want to serve them for the rest of my life which is why i am perusing a career as a physician. Even though it is a long hard road, i am dedicated to do well on the path because i want to be there for people who i care about. Physics is one of the hardest courses for me, but i am trying my best because i want to be a safe person to the people in my life. I also have a deep love for science, and i want to learn as much as i can about the universe around me. I am so curious of how the world works and i am excited to learn about it in this class. I look forward to being here and learning about the world.

I am here for e multiple reasons. I need this class specifically in order to complete my biology degree. Im getting the degree in order to pursue my ultimate goal of becoming a doctor. I enjoy physics but its not my main interest or goal. This school specifically i chose for a lot of reasons. I really love the area and enjoy living here. The school itself, I also enjoy. I find that everyone is pretty friendly and the learning environment is encouraging and welcoming.

I am here on a mission to achieve good grades and to learn the necessary knowledge that would make me ready to be part of the medical school Im trying to apply to. At first I never saw the connection between my major and physics but as I proceeded further with the physics classes I was easily able to realize how much connected they were. Not to forget to mention that its mandatory for my career path but even if it was optional I would definitely still take physics courses. I have taken physics 1 and now its time to take physics 2 which is a bit more challenging if I am being honest but definitely not impossible. The main reason for why I am here is to save as much lives as I possibly can in the future because I have always seen the amount of people dying for no apparent reason. Which really motivates me to be here and keep me moving forward no matter what comes ahead of me.

Why am I here? This is a good question that I answer to myself very frequently for me to remember my goals and path I really wish to go on, and therefore motivate myself when I feel overwhelmed. I am here because first of all, I am very passionate about science and I really enjoy learning new things about it, but secondly and most important, I want to become a doctor and help a lot of people that does not have the enough resources to pay for it. Being here has been a big step on my life, because to be here, I left many things behind, like my own country where I grew up up, my family, my closest friends and overall my culture. However, it has all being worth it, and I am very happy with my development here, I wish to continue like that, improving and growing as I stay here.

I am here because I need to complete General Physics I/II for the prerequisites for the Physical Therapy program at UCSF. The program requires the two semesters of general Chemistry, General Physics, and General Biology. These prerequisites are the same for most of the programs I have researched. I am looking forward to this class (as well as the other sciences), as I enjoyed Physics I. I love everything science so I am just looking forward to learning as much as I can. Physics is especially fascinating as it concerns the fundamentals of motion and energy, which are key components of how the world as we know it works.

Although I'm not required to do PHYS 121 for my major, it is a pre-requisite for medical school in which I plan on attending 3 years from now. Not only that, but PHYS 121 is the most tested physical science on the MCAT which is an admission test for medical school. I hope to learn physics that will set me up for success. My aspiration for medicine also involves a study on radiation which has a high emphasize on physics such specialty such as radiology involves the use of radiation and how light particles, or x-ray detect such diseases such as cancer that can be removed from the human anatomy. As a pre-med, I hope to learn new concepts that I will be taking away from this class, not only for the sake of the class, but concepts that I will carry with me in life. Hence, I am here because of my aspiration for medicine and completing this pre-requisite will set me up for success, not only for my undergraduate career, but for goal to go to medical school.

I think that this lab did a great job to demonstrate how positive and negative charges interact with each other. I also thought that I learned how polarization works which I did not know before. I had fun doing the tape experiment and feel like I could recreate this experiment at home if I wanted to. It was nice to learn about how why my hair stands up after going down a slide. I would still be interested to see why my finger gets shocked after getting off a slide and touching metal but I would guess it is because or a very large charge transfer. I also thought that my group did a great job dividing up work while also making sure everyone learned everything. I think that this concept is becoming easy for me to understand and how vectors can interact with each other in space is fairly intuitive at this point. Opposites attract and the same charges will not.

I am here in PHY 122 lab in order to work towards completing my major requirements as a Bio physio major. I chose to be a stem major because my career goal is to earn my MD after undergrad and become a childrens physician. I have had this dream of mine since I was a young girl, so I have been slowly working towards it for a while now. In other words, I am here today so I can succeed in the goals I have, career wise and life in general.

I am here because it is a required class for Physiology, and it is important to know for the MCAT. I am interested in physics though, especially electric nuclear forces . Im in class because I did the math and its around $80 per class, so if I miss any its like burning $80, which strongly motivates me to attend even when im feeling down. My apartment flooded today and I still came to class so i wouldn't be dropped from the class. I am at San Francisco State because I am interested in the research as well as the city. I wanted to have as many opportunities as I could, and to be able to have something to do off campus. I was between UC Merced and San Francisco State University, and I am very glad I chose San Francisco State University as there is a lot more to do.

I am in this school in order to pursue a higher education and to be able to gain the knowledge needed when pursuing my career goals. I am here in order to make my parents proud and to take advantage of the resources and opportunities that are available to me especially since I don't want all their efforts and sacrifices to have been done in vain and want to show them that all their hard work was worth it. I am here to show my younger sister that there are more opportunities past high school and to serve as an example for future generations that are to come after me. I am here in order to educate myself further past my career goal but on various topics in order to come out of my experience from higher education a more well rounded person. I am also here in order to gain more hands on experience that could potentially aid me as I look for a career in the future.

Why am I here?, the reason why I am here in this physics lab is because it is an essential part of my major requirements. In my roadmap this class is required for me to take. I started off with physics I and its lab now i'm moving on and completing physics II and the lab. As a student majoring in biology with a concentration in physiology it's important for me to take this class. This lab provides us a learning of test theories, fostering critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Through carefully designed experiments, I am able to learn a lot and able to use what I learn in the physics lecture. Using what I learn in the lecture I am able to test that learning here in the lab,collecting data, and analyzing results. This lab will help me develop a stronger foundation for other courses and future research.

I am here today because of the people who helped guide my path, the resources and privileges I was granted, and the decisions that I have made. My biggest goal is to become a plastic surgeon, and while physics might not seem directly related to that goal, I know it plays a huge role in the medical field. Plastic surgery requires a deep understanding of biomechanics, fluid dynamics, and even thermodynamics, these are things I might not have considered before taking this class. Physics is everywhere in medicine, whether its understanding the forces at play in tissue reconstruction or how energy transfer affects surgical techniques like laser treatments, etc. This class helps me build problem-solving skills, which are essential in surgery. In physics, I analyze situations, break them down into fundamental principles, and apply the right equations to solve them. Surgery is similar since it requires critical thinking, precision, and the ability to adapt when things dont go as planned. By challenging myself to think logically and systematically in physics, I know Im developing a mindset that will help me in medical school and beyond. Even if I dont use every equation I learn here in the operating room, the skills Im building, like attention to detail, patience, and problem-solving, are all things that will make me a better plastic surgeon in the future.
